review_title: These are nude, not pink. My comparison between Capezio vs. Bloch toddler ballet shoes.
review_body: I am not a dancer nor do I have any previous experience with ballet slippers, but I do know a quality shoe when I see one. I wasn't happy with the options at retail stores in my area, so I found these on Amazon for less than what I would have paid in store.

review_title: Was confused on size at first
review_body: These shoes are super cute and very well made. I loved the leather smell right out of the box. They are more of a nude shade. I was so confused on what size to order. My daughter is 2 1/2 and in the 50th percentile for weight and height.  She wear a size 7- 7.5 shoe. They were out of the 8.5 so I had to decide between the 8 or the 9 unless I wanted the 8.5 narrow or the 8.5 wide. I chose the 8 regular. When I pulled it out of the box the shoes seemed SOO TINY! I thought for sure they would never fit but to my suprise they fit perfect! I would buy again. I wouldnt say that she has a lot of room to grow into that much, but for less than $20 i dont mind. We should get maybe 6 months use out of them I'm guessing.

Ballet shoes (and even different brands) all have their own strange system of sizing - the sizes do not compare to normal street shoe sizing.  According to the Capezio manufacturer, their toddler/little kid ballet shoes are to be ordered one full size up from their current street shoe size.  Bloch brand kids ballet shoes are to be sized up 1/2 size.  (If you order adult shoes, they're often sized down 2 or 3 sizes...) Any dancewear store will have this information, but unfortunately Amazon doesn't provide this tidbit, so it can be quite confusing as to what size to order.  I hope this helps any future purchasers!

review_title: (I'm so glad I took their sizing advice)
review_body: My daughter wears size 7 in regular shoes, and I purchased size 8.5M according to other reviewers, which fit her perfectly.  (I'm so glad I took their sizing advice). I ordered the pink, and it looks just like the picture, great quality material. You can even tighten the lace for an even more snug fit.  My only complaint is that the knot tied from the string comes undone quite often (at least once or more every time she wears them), even when I double tie the knot, this is only reason I'm giving it a 4 stars.

Cute! Due to ordering first bloch ballet shoes, I learned my lesson of ordering a wide ballet shoes for my daughter in capezio brand because even if she has a small feet it was quite tight with bloch brand. I ordered size 6.5 for my daughter that wears 5.5 and it fits her perfect theres few mm extra to grow but since its leather it will strech a little more overtime. The color is not really pink more like nude. The straps are wider than bloch and tighter. In comparison with size from two brands mentioned my daughter wears the same 6.5 size with both brands... shes 6.5 W with capezio and 6.5 C with bloch 5.5 with regular shoes

review_title: Run SUPER SMALL - order TWO SIZES up
review_body: Let me start by saying these shoes were ordered for play for my 2 year old who is obsessed with ballet. I don’t know anything about ballet shoes or how they should fit. Ok, going forward - these shoes seem to be good quality. We have a hard time finding shoes that fit my little girl’s wide feet and the wide shoes fit great. I read other reviews to order a 1-1.5 sizes up. I decided to order TWO sizes up to leave room to grow. Unfortunately, they won’t fit for long. These shoes run SUPER, SUPER SMALL. Again, these are great shoes but I strongly recommend ordering two sizes up.

The description said order a half size up and I did. I’ve already had to return one pair and I needed these ASAP. These are not only at least a whole size too small but they’re very narrow in the toes and I ordered a medium not a narrow shoe. My kid does not have fat feet I’m pretty sure... all other regular shoes fit her and I’ve never had to buy anything wide.  I tried to do a return based on an accurate item description and it wasn’t allowed. What a scam.  As you can see in this photo they’re next to a pair of size 5 shoes these are way smaller and there’s supposedly a size 7!! I’m so peeved.

The shoe itself is fine - a little large, but the drawstrings make it adjustable. The strap, however, was not sewn as pictured here, but a good inch further back toward the heel. It will fit your child perfectly if she doesn't have ankles. Because we need these for a holiday performance, there wasn't time to return, so I cut out the straps and resewed them in the proper place. Frustrating.

Way too small. These ballet slippers are extremely narrow. My daughter typically wears a toddler 8. I purchased the toddler 8 1/2 and they were tiny. She could not even get her foot in them. Not only were they narrow but they were also shorter than typical 8's much less 8 1/2's. I am extremely dissatisfied.

review_title: Great ballet shoes for my 5 y.o.
review_body: My daughter is very picky with clothes and shoes. She usually complains that it's uncomfortable. We tried several ballet shoes and had to return them because of this. Finally we bought this one (way cheaper here on Amazon than directly from her dance school, but same brand). She LOVES them. Wants to wear them all the time. She's usually a size 11, but I ordered 11.5 so she has some extra space for comfort, and it was perfect. It also helped when I understood that the bow in the front was not just for decoration, but it actually tightens the sides for a better fit.
Very warm jacket for California cold. My daughter is 2.3 but I bought her 3t. People say shes tall and it fit perfectly.

I love this coat. I bought this for my (almost) 2 year old daughter & got a 3T because I'm hoping she can wear it again next winter. It is definitely a little big but I wanted it that way. We live in Illinois & it gets very cold here & this will be her "playing in the snow" coat so she doesn't get her Northface one dirty. She tried it on last night & didn't want to take it off. She kept saying how fuzzy it was & would have worn it to bed if we let her! I am very pleased especially for the price!

review_title: Bought three times over the past six years, but they changed the material this year
review_body: Bought this 3 times now as a heavy winter coat - every two years as my daughter grows out of the last one, but they seemed to have changed the material recently.  It's not as stiff as it was previously, and seems to be softer and more comfortable, but it's nowhere near as warm.  We've been using this for a heavy winter coat for years, but this time can only use it at a heavyish jacket, and had to get her a different coat for when it gets very cold out.  Won't be buying this again when she grows out of it next time.

I love this jacket. I ordered a 7/8 for my almost 4 year old daughter in pink. She is extremely tall but lean and this jacket is perfect with room to grow. It's not crazy big but it's not a perfect fit, it's roomy. I want it to last a couple of years so I sized up. The pink is the exact color you see in the picture and I don't think the picture does this jacket justice, it is just beautiful. The Sherpa lining is so nice, I love that it has a hood and the back is slightly longer which I also love. Overall great jacket and definitely true to size. If I'd ordered her normal size 6  it would be a perfect fit. Great quality as well, feels and looks well made.

Love this jacket so much. It looks great on my baby, and also I love the quality. My baby is 23lb and 15 month old and size 18month is little too big. I think it will fit her perfectly when she will be 18 month.

I bought this jacket for my petite 2 year old. I ordered a 2T knowing that it would be a little big. I wanted it a little big because I was hoping to get another year out of it next year. I received fast prompt shipping. It was packaged neatly and easy to open. It arrived in perfect condition. It is true to color in the picture. A really lovely girly shade of pink which my toddler loved! I have to say, I love Carhartt jackets. Growing up my dad had one and I remember it lasting just about forever. After receiving my daughter's jacket I think hers would last forever too. The quality of material is great! The exterior is sturdy and strong. I think it will hold up well to her rough and tumble ways. The weight of the jacket is nice too. I live in Texas so we don't get bad winters here. I needed a jacket that was warmer than a sweatshirt and lighter than a snow jacket. This fit the bill. The inside is super soft. My daughter squealed when we put it on her and she immediately wanted to go outside in it. It's a little roomy on her so she could easily wear a sweater under it. The hood has elastic sewn in around the edge so it stays around her face when it's up. Very happy with our purchase!
She loved it!
She looks like a doll in her jacket. It will keep her nice and warm.

review_title: Good jacket for 10 year old girl
review_body: Bought this for my daughter as she wanted a carhartt jacket like her dad.  It's a tad bit big and bulky but that seems to be the standard with Carhartt's.  Its outer material is softer than the adult version while the sherpa lining on the inside is fluffy and warm.  I'd buy this again.

Very nice jacket for cold weather. 4 yr old weighs 40 pounds and 44 inches tall and size small 6 fits her good with some room to grow and hopefully wear for two winters. Inside is soft and outside not too stiff, feels like will soften up nicely as she actually wears it more. Color is as pictured and very pretty.

This boot is tiny. As in I thought someone sent me doll sized rain boots. I was excited to find little rainboots because her neoprene size 5 boggs are not waterproof and the waterproof boggs start at size 7. I ordered a size 6 for my one year old who wears size 5 or 5.5 and they are smaller than her size 5 sneakers. They are also very narrow. So narrow that I couldn't even get them past her toes. I attached pictures comparing her size 5 sneakers to the size 6 boots.

review_title: Blue is darker and brighter than pictured.
review_body: Just a note that the blue is not as pictured. I love the actual color and it was a pleasant surprise for me. But wanted to let others know in case they're looking for a periwinkle (light blue/purplish) that these come more as a cobalt / royal bright blue.

review_title: Order a Size Up, Extremely Lightweight and Easy to Put On
review_body: The rain has been unusually generous this year in California this year, and in the Bay Area it's been enough where sending the kids to school in rain boots hasn't been too bad of an idea.  Unfortunately for us, this was the year that our son's

review_title: GREAT purchase - lightweight, easy to handle, not stinky
review_body: UPDATE (DEC. 2015):

We loved these boots until a few days ago when we discovered one boot had shrunk.  Before we bought these boots we had read someone’s review that their pair also shrank but we were skeptical.  However, within a period of one or two days, the boot went from fitting just fine and being equal to the other boot, to being significantly smaller.  We hadn’t done anything differently than we normally did when she was wearing them, so I have no idea why the one boot shrank so drastically in such a short time.

review_title: I have always loved Crocs so of course they were my goto for ...
review_body: I have always loved Crocs so of course they were my goto for rain boots for my son. I find that these are really difficult to get on, even with a light weight sock. My son's heel gets stuck, and it's hard for him to push his foot all the way down into the boot. Once he gets them on though, they fit great. He's 2 so, he doesn't understand "push your foot all the way in" lol I pull and pull on them, but he just has to walk or run in them for a few minutes before his foot goes all the way in. The lower back of the boot is very stiff, not a lot of give. He loves em though!

review_title: A pound lighter in weight than my kids' last rain boots!
review_body: The number one thing I love about these boots: the super light weight!! The attached pictures show the whole POUND less difference in the weight between a pair of size 8.5 "typical" toddler rain boots, and a pair of these Crocs in size 10.
I bought a pair of these for my four-year-old and one for my 1 1/2-year-old. The colors and quality are perfect. We got a green pair and a yellow pair and they are the cutest things ever.

review_title: These get a lot of use with our little farm ...
review_body: These get a lot of use with our little farm kid.  They fit a little large but thats okay as he can wear his socks with him.  Boot is a very popular word in our house.

My daughter LOVES her new rain boots.  She's going to wear them to help dad when he goes fishing.  She is 3 and just now transitioning into a size 9 toddler shoe (she's more like a 8.5).  These fit her perfectly....which means they are a little smaller than her regular shoes (since her size 9 sandals are a little loose still).  But any bigger and the boots would be too big...so I guess I'd say order the size your child currently wears if your child still has some wiggle room in their shoes.

Adorable and well made. My daughter is 2.5 years old and I generally put her in 3t stuff (sometimes 3t is a little loose but I prefer that over fitted). I ordered the 3t and it did fit but once buttoned there was no room to spare. The sleeves were good length. I’m so glad I went with a 3t and not a 2t because that would not have fit. I can’t see her getting more than a couple months out of this if it’s buttoned up. If we don’t button it I’m sure she will fit in it a while longer.

review_title: Glad I ordered a size up
review_body: My daughter wears a 7/8 but being that it runs a little small in my opinion, I ordered her the large. I purchased this same jacket when she was 3 and ordered a size bigger and she had it for 2 years. So I knew to order her a large instead of medium. It fit just right, sleeves a little long but I can roll them. She’ll have it for about 2 years again, I’m glad I ordered on amazon in the store this jacket is $25.99 or more.

review_title: A little short but great other wise.
review_body: Great jean jacket. The sleeves are long enough to grow into but the chest/back of the jacket is a tad short. The jacket fits my toddler perfectly but I wanted it to be a little longer since I went up a size. I just bought a bunch of shirts and sweaters size 3T and they all fall below my toddlers waist which is great since she can grow into them within the following months. Yet when I bought this size 3T it only sat on her waist and not below like the rest of her tops. A little confusing since the sleeves are just right. I'm going to keep it anyway since it's nice otherwise.

review_title: My daughter was disappointed that there are no pockets
review_body: I bought this for my daughter and she loves it. She usually wears a size 10-12. I bought the size 10-12 and fit her perfectly. I only gave a 4 star because the pockets are not real pockets. It is just a decoration. My daughter was disappointed that there are no pockets.

review_title: It fits great and is a really good quality
review_body: I ordered this jacket for my daughter who generally wears a size 8.  I ordered a size 10-12 as I wanted it to be roomy enough to fit over sweaters. It fits great and is a really good quality.  I would recommend to anyone looking for a cute denim jacket.

review_title: Also works for a petite adult.
review_body: The weight and color of this denim jacket are perfect! I’ve been searching high and low for a waist length denim jacket but being 5’1” I find they’re always too long. Decided since the price was so inexpensive, I’d try the size 14 in “big girls.” I am about 110 lbs and usually wear about a 2/4 in women’s. I did take in the sides of the jacket slightly to give more of a curved silhouette but otherwise it’s perfect. Only taking a star off because it smells of cigarette smoke, I imagine this jacket was returned at some point from a smoking home. I wish someone had noticed this before sending it out again.
Adorable and true to size

The quality is good but it has a really annoying short waist. I just wanted a classic jean jacket for our daughter. Our girl is petite so this 3T should be big on her, with plenty of room to grow. With a normal cut we could easily get two seasons out of it. Well, the sleeves are long but due to the stupid cropped short waist, by the time she grows into the sleeves, the  body of the jacket will be not even fully cover her torso. Will order a boy jacket for her. Should have known.

review_title: The Perfect Denim Jacket for Little Ones
review_body: This denim jacket could not be cuter! It's the perfect accent jacket to my daughters outfits. It's thick without being bulky and the quality is better than expected.

review_title: Grand daughter likes this jacket. I thought the jacket ...
review_body: Grand daughter likes this jacket. I thought the jacket would have been longer around the waist and sleeves are kinda long but she likes it so thats all that matters.

Gave this watch, in two different colors, to two boys of mine(6 and 8 years old) for Christmas. For the price, the watch quality and appearance is excellent. There are major design flaws however that parents of younger children should know about. I'm 45 years old, and have had various digital and analog watches since I was about 8. This has the strangest setting parameters I've ever seen. To change time or date - you simply push the bottom left button three times - even with a long pause between pushes - and you're in setting mode. Yea, isn't that great for kids? Then, pushing any button but the bottom right again, will create some kind of change. It has long memory, so it stays in setting mode. My kids mess it up at least once per week. One of them has stopped wearing it because the digital time is constantly messed up. My Casio watch when I was 12 years old had the year/month/date system PROGRAMMED into the watch. This dumb watch expects you to set the day of the week and actual day of the month  independently - no year is programmable. My kids mess all these settings up, amazingly, every single week since Christmas. PM/AM is hard to see/figure out initially. Lastly, the analog and digital don't stay in sync for more than maybe 12 hours - at the most. That drives my older boy a bit crazy - so I'm having to re-set that all the time, too. If you have an older child less prone to pushing buttons/playing around, go for it - it is a very attractive watch. For younger kids, stay far away from this watch.

review_title: NOT WATERPROOF (day one failure, first jump into the pool)
review_body: Looked great out of the box, BUT beware of the "waterproof" claim. My son jumped into the pool and the watch immediately stopped working - and the space between the watch face and "crystal" filled with water. Very disappointing, and I feel like the product is not what it's represented to be.
buy it for my sons birthday gift  he likes it alot comes in good condition and it was fast would like to buy one again for gift next time

review_title: Watch is very nice and well made
review_body: Bought the watch as a gift for a 10 year old. Watch is very nice and well made. the watch was a little hard to set up, other than that it is a great deal.

review_title: It was what you could afford but we didn’t want it to be a cheap piece that would break and disappoint him. He has been wearing it for a ...
review_body: My 7 year old son purchased this with his own chore money, so we were a bit nervous for him since it had a low price tag. It was what  you could afford but we didn’t want it to be a cheap piece that would break and disappoint him.  He has been wearing it for a couple of months now and it is fantastic! Great quality he even jumped in the pool once with it on and it still worked great .

review_title: Returning the same day I bought it!
review_body: 🙄 The watch was malfunctioning the moment we took it out of the box today. My son was begging me to send it back! It is packed and ready to be returned!

review_title: It's cheap and it tells time
review_body: It's a cheap watch with limited features but reasonably accurate timekeeping.  Fits a little 50-something pound kid just fine (on the tightest setting).  Perfect for free-roaming kids who need to know the time, but can't be trusted with something of actual value.

review_title: Perfect for a 5 & 6 year old boys
review_body: Kids like the fact it’s sport & glows in the dark..,it’s a little tricky to set so read the instructions.

review_title: ... little bit to get it set and it was good until a day or two later and had to ...
review_body: It took a little bit to get it set and it was good until a day or two later and had to correct the day but other than that my son seems to like it.

review_title: My 11 year old son LOVES this watch. It ...
review_body: My 11 year old son LOVES this watch. It fits well around his tiny wrist. He loves all the functions, though some are a little difficult to figure out.

I purchased these shoes for my three year old son who is really hard on his shoes.  I wanted shoes that were a good price value and that my son could put on and take off by himself, run around in, and that would stand up to 3 year old kid abuse.  These shoes fit the bill, and for the price I would recommend them and I would buy them again, but they'd be even better if they were even more reinforced around the toes.

review_title: Adorable, easy to get off & on but about ...
review_body: Adorable, easy to get off & on but about 1/2 size off. I got my daughter size 10.5 in both stride rite and saucony and there's quite a difference.

review_title: Better off with a Nike Free Run type shoe
review_body: These are super adorable no doubt but we quickly realized they honestly just have suuuuuuuch stiff soles! Forces your kids to walk unnaturally blocky. Better off with something that flexes like Nike Frees etc. - our son immediately wanted to run in those. Fashion over function just isn't worth it. Bummer
While the shoe looked great, it started coming apart after 1 month of light (relatively, as mostly used indoors due to cold weather) use.

review_title: Supposed to be XW but were more like M width
review_body: Pros:

review_title: Signs of not being 100% brand new...
review_body: So I think the shoes are ok. They came in a New Balance kids sandals box for starters... they were lightly wrapped in tissue with no tissue inside the shoe. Each shoe has what appears to be a slight skuff but the tread does not appear to have been worn but there is a small amount of glitter on the bottom of each shoe. I felt no foot or toe indentations inside the shoe... so I'm not sure what's going on here. Im planning on keeping them since they are back up shoes for school which get wrecked pretty quickly but paying full price for a shoe that has signs of being used by someone... that makes me rather upset. I bought a different pair of sauconys and they came wrapped tightly in tissue paper with tissue inside the shoe in the correct shoe box... I'll pay full price for that.

review_title: ... a wide foot and tall top of foot fits great in this shoe
review_body: My son has a wide foot and tall top of foot fits great in this shoe

This shoe is very cute, and we wanted to like it. However, the shoe is soooooo stiff that my daughter absolutely hates putting them on. Once they are on, they fit well. I have tried to work the opening of the shoe for several days to "break it in" so my daughter can put them on without hurting her fingers, but the stiffness is incredible and persistent. I will never buy this brand of shoe again.

review_title: Nice shoe but sizing was WAY off.
review_body: I like the shoes, my son had a pair in a smaller size, but the sizing on these is off. He has two pairs of shoes in other brands that are size 8 toddler. I got these in a size 8.5 and they were smaller than the 8s. So small, that he couldn't even get his foot into the shoes. Also, do to a shipping error, I wound up w/ two pairs. Both were smaller than his 8's, and the two size 8.5s were not even the same length! I like the shoes - the soles are grippier than the box store cheap shoes, the velcro lasts longer, the design is nice enough, but the sizing and QC is obviously way off.

review_title: Decent shoes, a little tight at first
review_body: I was happy to see kids wearing saucony's again because I used to wear them and loved them. I remember mine taking a beating on the playground. My son is rough on shoes. We live out in the country where there are plenty of things to get into, so I thought these would be a good invesment. So far so good as far as how they are holding up, but when we first purchased them, they were a little snug. I was worried I should have gone up a half size. He generally wears a size 6, and I thought something was odd because all his other shoes fit fine. With time, they have stretched to slid on more comfortably. Personally I think they are very cute shoes, but I just wish they'd sized these better. I don't want my son's feet to hurt while we wait on them to break in.

I got this watch for my daughter. She LOVES it. But the face cracked when she bumped her wrist on the side of the sink while washing her hands. I used their "worry free replacement" to see about repairing/replacing it.

This is a great first watch. Not a toy, a real watch that is easy to read and helps the kids learn to tell time rather than just reading a digital display. This was a gift for my granddaughter who is 8. She has a tiny wrist so the strap is a little long but there are enough holes to accommodate this and it looks nice on her. I would recommend this product.

Great little watch, fits me (an adult) just fine and the price is excellent. My only complaint is that the band is very stiff so it doesn't sit super comfortably on my wrist. I'm hoping once I "break it in" it will feel more comfortable. It does NOT have "indiglo" - a light in the face (I was misinformed that it did, I think an older version of the same watch did have that feature).

review_title: Product has changed - Does not glow
review_body: I ordered this watch about 6 months ago. My 7yr old totally LOVED it. She especially loved that it glowed when she pressed the button in. Well, she dropped it and the glass broke so I ordered her another one right away. Exact same item number and everything.  She was SO excited when it arrived...it looked the same, fit the same....but this time it does not glow. :( It's not that the glow is broken but it functionally does not have the ability to glow. We were both very disappointed that this feature has been changed. We returned it.

review_title: No indiglo for us and died after a few weeks.
review_body: It's a cute watch that fits my 10 year old perfectly. The band was a little stiff at first (as most are) but is not any longer. It keeps good time so far. My only complaint is that it is NOT an indiglo. My daughter was disappointed, but not enough to send it back.

My sister gave me a watch like this. I loved it because it fit my small wrist AND because I could check the time at night with the illuminated dial. I wasn't sure if this watch had that feature but in 1 of the reviews, it had a picture of it. I told my daughter that was what I wanted for a mom's day gift. But when I got it, it was already set and running. So I don't know how long the battery will last. Also, there was no illuminated dial on it. As far as just the watch is concerned, I love it-easy to read, band that fits, etc. I didn't return it bc I needed the watch and the price was right. I was just disappointed in the way it came.

review_title: Good watch for kids learning how to tell time
review_body: Very cute and ideal first watch for my 9 year old.  Like that it's water resistant and has a second hand to count and teach time with. Numbers are clearly marked as well

review_title: I am disappointed to see that it was imitation leather
review_body: This watch fit my three year old daughter. I am disappointed to see that it was imitation leather, but thats my fault for not being more careful while ordering. Still a lovely watch

review_title: The strap gave my daughter a lot of trouble...  And now it's lost...
review_body: The strap gave my daughter a lot of trouble...  And now it's lost...  As everyone said, not leather, but its also a pretty long watch band for something marketed as a "First Watch" for a little girl.  I had to put the watch on her wrist, since the stiffness of the band made it had for her to thread the end through the loops and such.  It was a little difficult for me to do.  So she wore it to school, after me convincing her to try it.  She was nervous about operating the band if she needed to...  Guess what?  The watch came off at some point...  and...  was never to be heard from again.  I'm giving it 3 stars, since overall it was a good watch.  I think they should either shorten the band a bit, or change how the buckle works.  I looked at those other "first time" watches with the fabric bands.  Thought those were velcro, but they don't appear to be.  Maybe Santa will bring another one of these.  I'll just have to modify the band a little.

Warning! This watch has changed. I purchased this watch a couple years ago.  Due to the low price, I decided to replace it rather than try and find just a band for a children's warch. I went through my previous orders so I could purchase the same one.  BUT it isn't! No Indiglo! That was one of the reasons I liked the watch so much. I came to the product page and now see others have the same complaint. I think it is incredibly shady to change product features and still keep the header on the page saying this is the product I purchased.

After 2 days of wearing this watch, my daughter began to develop a rash. At first I figured this was just a combination from it rubbing against her skin and the dry winter air, however the picture attached is taken 2 WEEKS after the rash first appeared! She only wore the watch for two days and has now had a rash for over two weeks. My wife and I have been putting lotion on it daily to no avail. I have never seen her break out from any of her other jewelry. I am extremely upset as the rash not only looks horrible, but is also causing pain to my 4 year old daughter! This is absolutely ridiculous and the worst watch you could buy! I will be writing the company and will update my post, but I would highly recommend not buying this watch for a loved one!

review_title: Ideal Watch At A Good Price
review_body: My daughter is 34 and disabled.  The watch gives her the time and date and she can not inadvertently change the time or date because there are no buttons for her to push by mistake.  The price is terrific - if it is lost or stolen there is not a big monetary loss.  The watch does not seem cheap or poorly made.  This watch is an ideal buy for a child or adult as stated previously.

review_title: My little 2yr loved loved loved this watch
review_body: My little 2yr loved loved loved this watch.  I had to make 1 more hole to fit her tiny wrist but all in all it was a perfect fit.  It's sturdy and does not feel cheapy. :)

review_title: Don't believe the hype. Cheap Junk.
review_body: Purchased as a stocking stuffer. As my daughter & I opened package on Christmas Eve the watch was already broken and the peg for the clasp missing. I was going to return, but then I ended up using a spare peg I had but within minutes it broke apart again. I can't be bothered to return or ask for a new one because it's obvious this is a very cheap product so I do not want another one and the headache of returning doesn't seem appealing either. Very disappointed overall. Waste of money. I don't know why this has so many good reviews, don't believe the hype. My son's Olaf watch is much better quality and has not broken apart once. I should still demand a refund but I already threw the junk in the garbage.

I never write reviews, but this is the first time I have felt compelled to do so. Don't waste your money. Go buy something cheap at Wal-Mart, it'll last longer. I just gave this to my daughter this morning for a birthday present. Wasn't very satisfied to begin with when I first put it on her. It was huge. Don't get me wrong, I expected it to be a little big. She has tiny wrists. But still, she is six, and it is a child's watch. It shouldn't have been that large on the tightest attatchment. However, that alone is not my reason for a one star review. If I was able to give a zero star review I would. 3 hours after I gave it to her she dropped it two feet onto the kitchen floor and it shattered into pieces that cannot be put back together. It's a cute watch, but if you have a child like mine who drops everything it will be broken by the end of the day.

The face is still a bit large for a 6 yr old.  Although I prefer a traditional watch face, my 6yr old loses everything so I went with a cheap digital watch until she can keep something on her wrist for more than 5 minutes.  Overall, it is exactly what I expected.  Packaging was soaked and mangled.  Delivered via USPS so no surprise it was in such poor condition.  I'm just happy the watch was in a sealed clam shell so it was unharmed by all the water.

Just got home to this package my sister had been eagerly awaiting only to open it and find that it DOES NOT sing wouldn't pay more than $5 for this in store she collects cute watches and usually pays about $6 for ones that light up. Very disappointed

review_title: Cute for Frozen lovers, but needs more holes
review_body: This is a really cute watch.  It does need more holes to make it tighter, though.  My son is a size 3T clothes, and this watch fits loosely around his wrist.  It seems like if there were more holes, this could be remedied.  So far, it works great, and he loves it.  Any Frozen lover would love this watch.  Probably best for 5 year olds.

My Great granddaughter just loves the watch the band is a little bit to large for her wrist had to make holes in the band in order for it to fit.. She is a five year old with large bones so I thought it would fit with no problem for a kids watch it is nice and Elsa just made it perfect for her.
Junky watch.  I got two of these are both do not keep time correctly.  I would not recommend!

review_title: Reviews are right - TOO SMALL!! Order WAY UP!
review_body: These are super cute and great quality shoes. I was confused because a lot of reviews on here say they run small, a lot say they’re true to size. So I took my chances and sized up but they’re still way ridiculously small. Like I can’t even get 50% of my daughters whole foot in the shoe, and she has slender-to-average sized feet, not chunky at all!! I’m disappointed (so is she) but I am willing to reorder, I just have no idea what size to order.. maybe 2-3 sizes bigger than her normal size??

These well-constructed, nice quality shoes hold up to tough use by our 3 year old, who wears them most of the day. Our previous pair from another maker were size 9 and getting way too tight. These were 9 1/2, but turned out to be a bit big on her. We'll know about the difference in sizing next time, but in the meantime, these will last quite awhile!

I can't speak to the quality or durability of these ballet shoes because they were far too small for my little one's feet.  She wears a size 5-6; 5 in most shoes generally fits her; 6 is still a bit large in most styles.  I ordered a 6 in this shoe to be safe, but I couldn't get her foot in no matter how hard I tried.  I realize ballet shoes are supposed to fit snug, but NOT like this.  Very disappointing.

review_title: Just like I was hoping they'd be!
review_body: These darling little ballet slippers fit just as I was hoping they would. My daughter usually wears a 10/10.5 street shoe and her previous ballet slippers (I got those from Target this past Fall in black) were size 11 (at that time she was barely in size 10 street shoes).  She was supposed to wear pink shoes for her recital last week so I was hoping that if I bought her size 12's that they would be a little big but not too big (so she could wear them for the coming Fall season) that I could tighten them and she'd be fine dancing in them. They were just as I hoped and just a little big but just fine when tightened and tied.

First I had an issue with the sizing....my daughter is 2 and wears a 4 or 5 in shoes so I ordered a whole size up and got 6M.  I could get them on her, but they seemed right.  I wanted to get them in  6.5M, but they were unavailable so I order a 7M. When opened them up today the box was smashed flat and one shoe looks just fine, but the other looks used and all creased.  When I went to see if I could exchange these I discovered they are not eligible to be returned or exchanged.  I think next time I will just buy directly from a dance studio...

review_title: These ballet shoes were too small for my daughter--I understand ...
review_body: These ballet shoes were too small for my daughter--I understand the sizing for ballet shoes but they still didn't fit. Normally, no problem on amazon--I just exchange them for a different size. This product can not be returned (or even exchanged!)--there was no place on the product description page that informs buyers that you can not return. I'm extremely unhappy about this and won't purchase from capezio again. Amazon--please fix this by at least providing the information for your customers.

review_title: Fits very small! Unable to locate size that fit in length.
review_body: I gave these shoes two stars not because they are bad shoes, but because the sizing is ridiculous. My daughter consistently wears a size 6.5 shoe (toddler). I ordered size 6.5 which were too small. I then ordered sizes 7 and 7.5; these were also too small! I don't understand how or why I would need to order 1.5-2 sizes bigger than her true shoe size.  I finally gave up after ordering three pairs and did not continue to order the next size up to find the size that would fit.

review_title: Don't follow the Capezio size chart!
review_body: I am very angry right now! I found out on Friday that my 3 yr old daughter got into a waitlisted ballet+tap class that starts tomorrow. I ordered these on Friday using the Capezio size chart. My daughter wears an 8 US, and the chart said to order a 7. WELL the chart is WRONG. These shoes are NOT the equivalent of an 8 US. They are way too small! I should have ordered the 8! I'm so upset. There's no way for me to get another order in time for her class. I'm scrambling to figure out where I can go locally to get what I need for her. This is extremely frustrating and disappointing.  And AGGRAVATING because without their "helpful" chart, I would have ordered the correct size! And guess what? SAME STORY WITH THE TAP SHOES. I am not happy at all.

review_title: Great little ballet shoes for my 3 year old
review_body: Great little ballet shoes for my 3 year old. They definitely fit snugly, as ballet shoes are meant to. She wears a 9 or 9.5 street shoe, depending on the brand, and a 10 in these is perfect. The elastic thread does not stay tied very well, but that can be solved with a couple of stitches or a dab of hot glue. I am partial to leather shoes over canvas, but they are more prone to odor (especially if said 3 year old is obsessed with ballet and wears them nearly 24/7...) but a quick swish in soapy water cleaned them up nicely and they didn't shrink at all. Will buy again.

Seriously, there isn't much cuter than a little girl in full ballet regalia. These adorable ballet shoes were the perfect item to complete the uniform. My little girl has a wide foot and many shoes simply do not fit her, not to mention how all over the place sizing can be. These shoes are soft, and give quite a bit which made them perfect for my little one's hard to fit feet.

This watch was purchased with the intentions for my first grader to learn how to tell time.  The first day she wore the watch it worked perfectly she was even using the minute numbers to help her tell me what time it was.  By the second day the minute numbers were completely gone!!???  There wasn't a single remnant of them.  I don't know if they just completely rubbed off or if they were some kind of sticker I didn't notice.  I am very disappointed.  The watch fit well and seemed extra comfortable too.  It has a super cute design also.  If you are just buying this watch for its design and not because you want to learn to tell time with it then go for it.  But, if like me your sole purpose of buying this watch was to help your child learn to tell time stay away it's a complete waste of your money. I bought my 5 yr  old son the Mickey version at the same time and the same exact thing happened so I didn't just get a defective one.

This is a super cute watch and my daughter immediately fell in love with it, however it was defective. The "minutes" hand was just flopping around as it wasn't attached properly. Amazon replaced it and the the new one was also defective. This time the "seconds" hand was completely unscrewed and flopping around the face of the watch. I'm going to try my luck a 3rd time only because my 2.5 yr old loves Minnie and pink and loves this watch.

review_title: Great kids watch, even for small children.
review_body: I bought this watch for my 2 year old and was unsure as to whether or not it would latch small enough for her little wrist. I was very surprised that I was able to close it and still have one hole left that I could make it smaller.

I will start by say that the watch itself is very cute. It looks exactly loke the picture and for the short amount of time that I've had it, it works well. The reason for 3 stars was the fact that the metal case that it came in was horribly dented and the paperboard box was ripped. Since I am giving this as a gift, this proves very inconvenient.

I can't believe how cheap this watch is. I literally just took it out of the box and the band broke off from the watch. After I fixed it, I put it on my daughter and I looked at it after 10 minutes and the front clear plate was gone! After searching for it for an hour we finally found it and will have to glue it back on. Do not waste your money!

Should've noticed this is not water resistant-but even at that, I would expect for my 3 year old to at least be able to wash her hands while wearing it. She wore it all day Christmas and the day after without issue, but her 1st day back to daycare (where they are probably sloppier about hand washing) the watch came home completely fogged up with water under the crystal and all the outside numbers worn off. Kind of ridiculous for a child's watch not to be able to withstand more wear & tear than that. Would not purchase again, which is a bummer because it's super cute and she loves it.

review_title: Gave it as a Christmas gift and she loved it. Never got it wet
review_body: Worked for about 4 months. Gave it as a Christmas gift and she loved it. Never got it wet...but it stopped keeping time. The battery is NOT dead-as we did change that out, however the second hand goes (some of the time) the hour and minute is always wrong. Very very diappointed!!

review_title: The crystal fell out of the watch after a day of wearing it
review_body: Pretty when it came out of the box, but after a day the crystal fell out of the watch.  Also the numbers on the bezel rubbed right off.  Disappointed with the watch.  The band is bright and the face is nicely done.  Looking at the reviews (after I buy) many people report the same experience with the crystal

My grand daughter is actually learning to tell time.  she wont take it off except for bath time!  the band is too big and the watch  flops around, but  she loves, "pop's watch."  seems sturdy and much better quality than I expected at the price.  by the way, she is two.

review_title: Cute and comfortable little girl watch
review_body: very cute watch. looks more expensive than the price charged. My three year old neice loved it and did not want to take it off. the rubberized band makes it very comfortable for a little child to wear.

review_title: Nice kids watch for the money
review_body: We've only had this for a week, but I'm very impressed with the quality of the watch of the money.  And my 8 year old daughter loves it.  I found a Youtube video on how to set the time (it's the lower left button), and it was really easy to set up.  The upper left controls the lighting, which is my daughter's favorite feature, especially since it changes color.  Overall, I'm very happy with the watch.  Time will tell if it holds up, but, honestly, for $12, if I get a year out of it I'll be thrilled.

My 8-year old loves this watch! I was worried it would look and feel cheap, but it looks great. Somehow the hourly alarm keeps turning on, and I’m not sure if it’s my daughter accidentally bumping the buttons. The jury is still out. But we know how to turn it off, so we just have to do that every once in a while. She loves the different color backlights. We refer to the instructions every once in a while, so they’re good to keep on hand.
Super Cool watch
Beautiful watch. It was a gift and the child really loved the gift.
ty
My niece loved it and now he has a watch like his mom and dad has and his siblings
Kids Love!
8 yr old daughter loved it

review_title: Too complicated to set time setting.
review_body: The watch itself looks very nice.  Setting it to work with the complicated setting process was impossible and I am a retired technology specialist.  It was a gift for my 8 year old granddaughter who loves watches.  I plan on sending it back now that I have let another very technical 12 year old grandson try and set it also to no avail.  Sad because the quality of the watch seems very nice!

I  bought this watch on 9/13/18 for my daughter's birthday on the 17th. She had worn it the sum total of NINE DAYS (less really, when you consider that she wears it for school and therefore not on the weekends) when the battery began leaking fluid. She was not injured - but this item was a complete bust. When I went to return it, I saw that this item is not eligible.  With a kid being exposed to battery acid - and an item that is LESS than 30 days old, one would hope you could return this. Let's hope Amazon comes through.

Brought a 3T for my 2 year old & a size 18 month for my 10 month old, bc she's chunky. The 18 month is a little big as expected I want her to grow into. 3T fits perfect can't wait to order more colors!

got the 18month old for your 12 month old because the 12 month old size was getting a little tight. She is pretty small about 20 lbs and the 18 month jacket fit her ok with room to grow or add clothes.

Love Carhartt jackets! This is our daughters second one like this. We usually buy the next size up so she can wear it for a couple years. They hold up for several years and usually get passed on to another child. Very sturdy construction and warm. We will continue to buy these as long as we can.

Perfect!  Very soft on the inside. Softer than a teddy bear. I washed it in the in normal settings and air dryed it mostly then finished drying it in the dryer on low. This was purchased for my daughter who was born in 2009. The lighter color means I wash it more but she likes pink so I wash it. No big deal. It is very warm. She can maneuver the zipper just fine.
It fits snug. The sizing is wrong and the seller was going to charge me to ship back so we kept it because it isn't worth the hassle and money. Just going to last a year...:-(

review_title: Great fit, perfect material and weight, very comfy - kiddo loves it
review_body: I got this for my daughter when she damaged her cheap wally world coat by simply leaning against a tree. Who knew kids where so rough as to destroy coats by leaning? Anyway, it was her 3 or 4th jacket, and we hat the winter "arctic vortex" thingy in oklahoma, temps dropped below zero. She only had the one coat with a giant hole in it. So, I ordered this little coat.

review_title: Soft on the inside, durable on the outside
review_body: Though this is still big on my daughter I did size up when I purchased it, it is plenty big enough for her to grow or wear a bulky seater underneath.  The arms are a little long, but to be expected and the inside is extremely soft.  Wish they made it in adults sizes.

I always like the Carhartt jackets and took a chance on these.  I ordered these for my 2 granddaughters and took a shot on sizes.  The only problem the girls had was the binding at the sleeve was too tight on the wrist for their liking, but with with some wear it  should eventually give.  It appears to be warm, and the color was perfect for them.  My son appreciated the coat as he requested an outdoor coat for snow and play.

review_title: Id definitely recommend to other small-figured adults like myself that want the ...
review_body: I am 5'4, 115 pounds, and usually wear a size XS. I got a girls size large and the jacket fits me perfectly! Id definitely recommend to other small-figured adults like myself that want the warmth and durability of Carhartt without having to pay the full price of the adult sized items

review_title: Love it, hope she don’t grow out of it ...
review_body: We’re going on our second Alaskan winter with this coat and it still looks new. Love it, hope she don’t grow out of it yet. Keeps my toddler dry and warm.

review_title: Great first watch for a little girl
review_body: The strap on this watch can be adjusted to a wide variety of sizes. My almost 4 yr old daughter is extremely petite and it adjust down to her wrist size with no problems and no extra strap sticking out anywhere. The strap material seems durable and dries quickly when it gets wet. I am not sure if this watch is water resistant but it has survived a few splashes. I love the fact that when she is ready that it will help teach her how to tell time. In her own words, she likes her watch because "it has pretty flowers and the strap is purple. It tells time, but I don't know what time is.".

Despite being advertised as an Indiglo watch, it is no longer made with that feature. I bought it having read other reviews mentioning the Indiglo face. On arrival, the face didn't say Indiglo and pressing the crown had no effect. I called Timex who confirmed that they changed the watch and it no longer has that feature - and hasn't had it since April 2013.

review_title: Purchased twice. Dead battery both times.
review_body: Didn't work. Could hear the watch ticking once or twice, but didn't work. Cute and had an adjustable strap that fit my 6yo (she preferred to wear pretty loose). I'm returning and ordering another because this is one of the few ones that are advertised as water resistant.

review_title: Cute watch but questionable value on the warranty / face is prone to scratches
review_body: After buying and breaking cheap watches for my daughter, I figured I'd try a more reputable name-brand along with a warranty.

review_title: and is easily adjustable. It's super comfortable for her if you ...
review_body: I bought this for my three year old daughter. She LOVES it. It fits on her little toddler wrist perfectly, and is easily adjustable. It's super comfortable for her if you get the tension right. She'll wear it for hours, checking the time every few minutes. It's a great way to teach her to read the time. So far she can read the little hour hand fairly accurately, and we're working on the big hand. It's fairly durable, although I don't expect anything I give her to survive indefinitely, toddlers are tiny balls of destruction.

review_title: The "minute" numbers aren't what I expected.
review_body: I've been a long-time fan of these timex kids watches, I even wore them as a kid myself.  I just bought this one for my eight year old daughter who wanted to get better at telling time with a "real clock." I like the idea that this had both the hour and the minute numbers on the face.

We were so excited to get our daughter her first watch. I loved that this watch stated the "hour" and "minute" hand because she kept confusing the two. I also LOVED that it had "5, 10, 15" minute indicators..... but when I asked my daughter what time it was this afternoon, she had a really hard time realizing it was 1:56.... because the face doesn't count by 5s to 60, just to 30 and then back down to zero. I understand this is so they can say "5 minutes to 1" but it's more important to me that she learn how to state the actual time. My whole reason for loving this watch was because it would have been easy to see "55 minutes plus 1 tick mark makes :56!" I really wish I would have looked at the picture closer before ordering. She got the flower design- I now see the butterfly design counts by 5s all the way around.

review_title: Watch didn't come in original box, but great otherwise
review_body: We have only had the watch for a day and it seems to work well, but just a warning that ours did not coming in the actual product box.  This wasn't an issue for us because we were giving it as a gift to our 6 year old for her birthday so she didn't care, but for someone who is giving it as a gift it might seem a little tacky to give it in a box that isn't made for it.  It also came running, which may be standard but I thought it was odd.  Who knows how long the battery has already been going now.  The watch itself seems great, though.  It fits my 6 year old perfectly and it fit me, too.

review_title: my daughter is FINALLY telling time
review_body: After years of trying to teach my (now 8-year old) daughter to tell time, this watch was the thing that did the trick. It's got a pink hour hand, which matches with the pink hours printed on the watch face, and a purple minute hand, which matches with the 0-60 minutes printed on the watch face. She just matches them up (pink hour hand goes with pink numbers, purple minute hand goes with purple numbers) and she knows the time.

Great first watch for my 7 year-old.  She loves the look and feel.  She absolutely loves how the second hand is a butterfly that "flies" around the clock.  The band is comfortable and adjustable, and the watch can be removed easily over your hand since it's stretchy.  The only thing we don't like about this watch is that the band loosens on its own, and she has to pull it tighter from time to time, which makes the loose end of the band stick out to the side.  Sometimes I tuck it back in for her, but she can't do that on her own.  My son had a boys' version of this same watch when hew as little, and he experienced the same thing, needing to tighten it often.  It still beats a buckling band for this age.
These are the best rain boots.  We have been buying them for years as the kids grow.  I don't think we will ever switch to a different brand, as long as they keep making them.

I seriously cannot say enough about these boots! My son has had a pair for every shoe size he's been! He is a busy 4 year old who lives on a farm and has put these boots through everything! They are seriously the best boots we've ever purchased! They clean so easily, very comfortable and he has gotten so many compliments on them. I recommend them to all my friends and just to everyone! Seriously, parents, buy these boots for all your children! You will not be disappointed, they fit as expected! My son already has a pair to grow in too! He wears them all seasons and even all day during school.

review_title: Came back for a second pair
review_body: This is our son's second pair of these. He loves them. The handles make it easy to take off and put on until his foot gets too big (hence the second pair).  The soles do wear down compared to a standard rubber boot but kids grow fast so that was not an issue.  The tradeoff to quick wear is that softness = comfort... the boots give against the foot and so feel more comfortable than a standard boot.  4 stars  because the sole could be tougher... both for the wear and keeping sharp sticks out.  We did have a close call towards the end of the boot's life. 4 year old stepped on a stick in the brush and it stuck into the boot, right between his toes. The sole was about half the original thickness at this time. Those old boots are still fine looking but due to the wear I don't think we will pass them down to the 2yr old.

I ordered the smallest size available (size 6), hoping that they would fit my daughter who is in a size 4.5 in Stride Rite shoes. After reading a lot of the reviews saying they run 2 sizes too small, but they don’t. They fit like a 6 and are huge on my daughter’s Size 4.5 feet. She loves them though so I let her play with them but not wear them cuz they make her walk funny since they’re too big. But when they do fit eventually they seem like they’ll be very comfortable. We’re keeping them since they will fit eventually. But they do run true to size, maybe a half size small but definitely not more than that. I wish Crocs sold these in smaller sizes since most babies are walking long before their feet reach a size 6... Also the color Fushia is slightly darker than pictured.

review_title: Update: Shrinks!!!! ........Daughter loves it. I do too
review_body: Update 9/20/2017

Awesome!  Was very hesitant to purchase boots online but our grandson has just turned 6 and the size 12m fits perfectly.  We have moved out to the country and this is an awesome boot for everyday wear that he can just slip on to avoid all the bugs! Highly recommended, I purchased these boots in December, it is April and they have been worn many times and roughed up and as you can see they are still in perfect condition. The photo was taken today on his way to explore for more bugs!

review_title: We love how lightweight they are compared to traditional gumboots
review_body: This is the second pair of croc rain boots we've ordered for our daughter, after she grew out of her last pair. We love how lightweight they are compared to traditional gumboots.  She uses them for both rainy days at preschool (they go out in all weather) and at home for tending to the urban chicken coop. We knew from experience that while the length is good or even a bit larger for size, the ankle can be narrow. As long as our daughter wears socks, she doesn't notice but there's been a few days when she's removed socks and complained of how they rubbed.  Never kept her from wearing them though. Love the easy handles and the ability to spray them off when the hoze (inside and out) without damaging them one bit. We gifted our old pair to a friend after she outgrew them and despite having two years of wear before that, our friend would have never known the difference. Good durability!

These are super lightweight and practical. My kid loved these so much he actually wore them to bed the first night after he got them. He was so excited that he could put them on all by himself with the big handles to pull them on. At 2 years old doing things by yourself is a big deal. Worth every penny. He is able to walk fine and they appear comfortable. Sometimes pants are a little awkward with them as they don't always have room to tuck inside the boot and the pants aren't always wide enough to go on the outside (plus they would get wet and defeat the purpose) so they end up bunched up at the top. My kid doesn't seem to mind one bit. Best boots for jumping in puddles and mud. Easy to wash off inside and out. I've even put Crocs in the washing machine (though not these boots yet) and they come out squeaky clean. I will absolutely buy another pair when he outgrows these.

I have only ever bought Crocs boots for my kids because I love how light & confortable they are plus easy to care for.  However, I am very disappointed with this most recent pair.  I bought them in February toward the end of the rainy season with intent to have them last for next season but they broke after only 4 months.  My son barely even wore them because the weather has been nicer the last few months and he only wears them on rainy days. Today he came home from school with a huge split down the middle.  I have never had to deal with this from his or his sisters’ previous Crocs handle it boots but now I am reconsidering what to buy next.  I guess the quality has gone downhill.  Too bad because I would love them if they didn’t break so easily, but they are just too expensive to last a short time with little use.

review_title: True to size. Good style. Practical rain wear.
review_body: These boots look great, are true to size and very light weight - a quality that is very desirable for toddler boots. My 2 yr old is a size 5 and I got the size 6 based on other reviewers and it fits a bit larger as expected. He still can walk and run in them with room to grow. Right now his feet can get into them easily, will see how easy it will be to get them on when he is actually a size 6. I got the boots in yellow color and my child was very eager to wear these even when it wasn't​ raining and he looked comfortable with no rains and outside temp. in the 80s. He is a skinny kid so fitting in the calves is not an issue for him ( see pics for fit). Haven't tried these yet in torrential rains or even light rains but I am guessing it will be alright.
I purchased larger size. "EVERY FASHIONISTA MUST HAVE A JEANS JACKET IN THEIR CLOSET"
I don't think the item was made correctly.  It was about a size 6 in the shoulders and larger everywhere else.  I saw one in a Children's place store, and it was not made like that.
Love it and it's good quality. The size 14 is perfect for my 10year old girl. She likes to carry her trinkets with her so I really wish it had pockets.

Super cute in person and a great color. I was worried about the fit reviews however I ordered a medium 7/8 that's what came and it fits perfectly and is a true to size fit. Would absolutely recommend. Incredible price for the product received.
My daughter love love loves this jacket.  She has worn it every single day since she got it.  It is made very well, and is extremely comfortable!  I would highly recommend it!
my daughters won't take it off they absolutely in love...

review_title: This is the perfect jean jacket
review_body: This is the perfect jean jacket ! I have a 2.5 year old that normally fits perfect in a 4T I bought it in a 5T (so she can grow and just in case) its a true 5T - a bit big for her but just how I wanted it. -
Adorable jacket! My daughter is currently wearing a 2t, but I bought a 3t (so she can wear it for awhile since she is growing so fast) *tear drop*.
Nice and good price,it fits a little bit loose but my girl is also very skinny.

review_title: Buy a size up from your regular size.
review_body: Anytime I buy clothes from the Children's Place I always buy clothes a size up. There clothes are cut small. The jacket fit. The color was true to the picture. My daughter is happy with it and so am I.
Nice watch, my son likes it!

review_title: I bought this watch excited about the fact that it ...
review_body: I bought this watch excited about the fact that it is digital and analogue, and quickly found out that the two are out of sync. Also the date will unexpectedly stop at any random day and the digital time gets ahead quite quickly.

review_title: Not waterproof, broke in a week
review_body: Not water proof. My son wore this for less than a week before it broke. Sad

review_title: I also like the waterproof function of the watch
review_body: My son likes this watch very much. I also like the waterproof function of the watch, the surface of the display is very clear, suitable for children to use.
My 8 year old has very small wrists so it barely fits.  But that isn't the watch's fault.  :)  It looks and works great.
Not as durable as some of the others in the same price point.

review_title: Good for a child watch because it’s cool looking functional ...
review_body: 10yo son loves it. Good for a child watch because it’s cool looking functional and cheap
Wouldn't have given one star if I didn't have to.
The clasp broke after only a few months.  The pin just flew out and was lost in the grass

review_title: Definitely recommend! Was great quality and good size if band
review_body: Bought for my 7 year old nephew and he loves it! Definitely recommend! Was great quality and good size if band!

review_title: Good shoe, velcro strap a little hard to open up when putting the foot in, great color.
review_body: I ordered way too large on this shoe. My daughter is growing out of a size 7 and I got a 9. It was way too big. I love the mint color and the construction. The double velcro strap is a little more challenging than the usual double straps. They don't pull through the openings as easy when trying to get the foot in, so it's harder to squeeze the toddler's foot in. That is my only complaint. We started her off with Adidas sneakers that had great padding on the heel and footbed. So, since those shoes, we haven't been willing to put her in really uncomfortable, unpadded shoes. These Saucony sneakers would be acceptable compared to the Adidas Neo shoes. I think she would be comfy in them all day long.

review_title: These shoes are fantastic! so easy to put on and take off ...
review_body: These shoes are fantastic! so easy to put on and take off and he can wear them all day with no complaints. He has had a few different brands of shoes and boots in the past and after awhile he has started to whine and point at his feet letting us know they hurt or are uncomfortable. He has never done that with these once. In fact, this pair was a replacement pair we bought for an identical set that was lost at some point on a trip. We even paid to have them expedited because it is worth it. I even bought myself a pair of matching Sauconys and they are my favorite daily shoe as well!

Very cute little shoe. I needed a shoe for my little girl who's almost two years old. She has such a tiny foot that's it's hard for me to find shoes that are her size but made for children who walk. These are perfect for her. She keeps them on all day without complaint and has no trouble running around in them. She gets lots of compliments to which she loves! She can also get them on by herself (usually the wrong foot). Would definitely recommend!

I bought these for my color red loving little girl. Fit is as expected. She says they are very comfortable and was instantly running around. The velcro seems like it will hold well. The red is not as ... ugly as the stock photo shows - so there's that if you are having trouble deciding if red is right for you! And the price, we could really not go wrong for t-ball and outdoor play!

Not a great fit for wide sneaker? Shoe seemed wide around heel and ankle but then narrower toward toe where you need the width more. So heel sliding and barely able to velcro comfortably without leaving imprints on feet. Also NO Cushion On footbed, Seemed VERY Hard FOR A Saucony??? Love amazon,  free return

Very cute shoes, but they didn't fit my daughter. The size was correct. It wasn't that they weren't long enough. It was that the velcro strap didn't leave enough velcro space to fasten these closed once she got them on. For a tiny girl, she does seem to have a slightly chubby foot but there was no way to even close these over her foot, so I don't know if the width was off, but we ordered the size 10 with normal width and the width seemed very narrow.

Love these shoes for our toddler. Had gotten some discounted off another site over a year ago and was looking for these same shoes. My daughter lives in tennis shoes. She has been wearing this shoe since she was 14 months old - she learned to walk at 9 months and stayed  in Robeez until we purchased these. They seem comfortable, they are practical and she never trips in them or complains when wearing them. Amazon prices compared to zappos but with free 2 day shipping prime. Will get these shoes until she learns how to tie laces. Also I never bother with half sizes for her in these- seems to work fine.

review_title: Tight fitting even with size up; difficult to put on
review_body: I would NOT recommend these shoes. They appear good quality but the fit is small. I even went up a size and although their is plenty of toe space the Velcro closure area is too tight. My kid does NOT have big/chubby feet but these shoes are tight, difficult to put on, & difficult to Velcro. My 2.5 yr old has been able to put on her own shoes & Velcro close for quite some time but with these she is not able to put them on or do the closure - if I knew that was going to happen I would have bought another brand with laces since I have to help every time now.

Bought this in a size 6 for my now 17 mo. old toddler. Wore it for the first time out yesterday and he did really well in them. He's been walking since 13 months, but still trips over his own feet once in a while. He seems to walk better in these than the pair of stride rites he was wearing previously. Looks to give solid support and not too stiff, and the shoe itself doesnt get in the way so he trips over himself. and the gray/lime color combo is pretty stylish too. Would buy another pair once he outgrows this one in a heartbeat!

review_title: Great for an active toddler- Update on pair #2
review_body: So far so good. Bought these for my 2 year old as he likes to do everything himself, so velcro tabs are necessary. They have held up so far (granted it's only been about 3 weeks of use). He is able to put them on and take them off by himself, and he likes and wears them. So all the necessary positives for shoes for a toddler.
So cute! My little sister wanted a plain pink watch and she is over the moon with this one (she’s 9). It came very well packaged and looks like it will last a while.

review_title: Packaging is awful for gift giving
review_body: This watch was purchased as a Christmas gift so I cannot comment on its quality. It is attractive, however it was delvlivered in a thin cheap black box that is too big and has a big hole in one side.  The box was probably intended for a photo of the product, but it is just a hole. It is so tacky looking that I will have to re box the watch before giving. Also there is absolutely no information or warranty included.

review_title: The strap is a bit long for her little wrist but the two loops over the strap makes it easy to control it
review_body: It's still running !!  I bought it for my three year old grand daughter (she had to have one since her older brother got a new watch) for Christmas.  She loves it and has worn it most of the time since then.  The strap is a bit long for her little wrist but the two loops over the strap makes it easy to control it.  She is learning time and we wanted them to recognize analog as well as digital.  The numbers are large enough and easy for her to read.  Definitely recommend !!

This is an adorable little watch, perfect for a baby, toddler, or little girl. It's even smaller than the women's easy reader watches, which is perfect for tiny wrists. And unlike the other Timex kids' watches, it has a metal case and looks classy. The band is attached with a standard springbar, so that can be swapped out if needed.

I don't like the way the band is designed.  When its bucked the watch rides off center of your wrist.  The instruction that came with it showed how to install a 1 piece band. Maybe that would be better.
My granddaughter loves this watch. It looks beautiful. She is very excited about learning to tell time.

review_title: It's a good watch, but not what it was supposed to ...
review_body: The advert said it was supposed to be the Indiglo model, but it isn't. I bought it for my niece for Christmas, by the time I got it I didn't have time to complain & send it back. It's a good watch, but not what it was supposed to be.

review_title: Great watch for a young girl
review_body: Great watch for a young girl. Kids actually like to see the time in something other than a digital manner.

I bought this watch for my daughter for school test time keeping only. It stop working within a month without being used a lot. It actually sat in the drawer most of the time. I thought it ran out of battery. A new battery did not work, either. I measured both the original  battery and the new battery with a voltage meter, they were both fine. Unfortunately I can not return it because it was 3 days past the return window.

I'm an adult with a small wrist and have trouble finding watches that fit me, but this watch did not solve the problem. It was described as having a "Pink Leather Strap" but the strap is not actually leather -- it's stiff and uncomfortable. I hoped that, after I wore it for a while, it might soften up and conform better to the shape of my wrist, but that didn't happen. Eventually I gave up on this watch.

review_title: Even at this price the watch is garbage...
review_body: Watch came with a dead battery and even after replacement will not keep time at all...it is basically garbage, my daughter was very disappointed and has now requested a new watch.  do yourself a favor and spend a little more money on a better watch.

Very cute watch but unfortunately both the pins on the side of the watch were broken so there was no way to set time or date.  I was very disappointed.  I plan to find another one at a store so I can see that when I give it to my Grand daughter we can set it properly.
Def cheap, but 4yo won't tell difference.
Within 5 hours of setting the time it was wrong.

review_title: For the price it is fine. The only reason I did not give it ...
review_body: The watch is cute. My daughter loves it. For the price it is fine. The only reason I did not give it a better review was because the name is COMPLETELY MISLEADING!! It does not “Sing” at all! It is simply a cute childs analog watch. I understand for the price, you get what you pay for. They should change the name and take out the “singing watch. LET IT GO!”
If you’re looking for a watch that literally is just for looks, then it’ll work.
For a Kid it should last past her interest  span, for a an adult or teen maybe you should buy something else. For my child it was much appreciated not for the time but the characters

review_title: This watch is overpriced and underwhelming.
review_body: This watch is not worth the money!  I was glad to know it did not sing; however, it is also true it does not keep time accurately.  It was purchased for a two year old so it will do.  But forget her learning. accurate time.

review_title: I got this for my almost three year old who ...
review_body: I got this for my almost three year old who insisted she wanted a watch. My husband had to poke an extra hole in it for the band to fit her tiny little wrist.

review_title: ... two watches for my twin nieces and they absolutely love it. Especially anything with Anna and Elsa on ...
review_body: I purchased two watches for my twin nieces and they absolutely love it. Especially anything with Anna and Elsa on it. They used to come to my house and put on my watches and try to go home with them, so I promised I would get them for Christmas. They came 2 days later than expected, but still in enough time for Christmas. I am still the best Auntie (I'm winning)!!!!

I had spaced and forgot to get my toddler ballet shoes for her first class and amazon came to the rescue. I'm not familiar with ballet shoes, and if you have a toddler, you know that sizing their feet can be difficult especially with all the various brands. I read the reviews on this and it was so helpful! The majority of the reviews said to size up at least 1 - 1.5 because ballet shoes run small. I sized up 1 from her normal size and crossed my fingers and they fit PERFECT. The quality is also great. She is very particular with what is on her feet and she loves these and doesn't complain so I'm guessing they are comfortable! Thank you amazon and thanks to all the reviewers for helping me make a smart decision. Hope this helps someone else!

review_title: Not our favorite of the 3 we tried
review_body: We tried three different kinds of ballet shoes for my 4 year old, these the Bolch Bunnyhop and the Stelle.  We went with the Stelle over these.  While they fit, they just didn't look as nice.  They also had a much wider elastic band than the other two, which made them a little harder for my daughter to put on.

I'm writing this review because I was completely confused as to what size to buy.  My toddler son wears a 7 or 8 in street shoes and the size 8 ballet shoe fit just right. I used to be a dancer, and I know that older dancers would probably prefer a tighter fit, but I am not interested in jamming my son's feet into shoes that barely fit.  I was pleased with the quality of these shoes. Capezio is one of the best brands of ballet shoes, and these did not disappoint.

I know these are great shoes when they fit, but I suggest going to a dance store and trying them on first.  I bought these for my 2.5 year old in a size 6 which is her regular shoe size and we could not even get these on her. I would definitley suggest going a size or 2 higher if you must purchase online.

These are the exact same shoes that my daughter’s dance studio sells but at a fraction of the price. Arrived quickly and it good condition. Had to really pull the strings together them tight enough for my daughter’s foot but fit true to size. They will make their recital debut tomorrow!

Darling shoe, well made, however these were too large for my daughter, and will be returning them.  She typically wears between a 8-9 size (normal width) in shoes, and I bought a size 10W, thinking these shoes ran small.  Upon arrival these proved to be too big and much too wide for her.  Even after using the drawstring to tighten the width, they were still too wide.  I'll be trying a size & width down for her.  She loved the flowers on the inside, though!

review_title: Make sure to read the reviews
review_body: I purchased ballet shoes for our three year old earlier this year in her normal size and was disappointed to find that they were very snug and she outgrew them quickly.  This time, before purchasing, I read the reviews and found out that ballet shoes are often times a size or two smaller than you would typically buy.  Our daughter usually wears a size 8 in shoes and I bought at 9.5 in these ballet shoes. They fit perfectly and she has a little room to grow as well.  Great shoes, just read the review.

review_title: TOO small even when orders size up! Seller won’t allow return according to Amazon.
review_body: The shoes appear to be well made and what I was expecting, expect they are WAY too small. I even ordered up an entire size as suggested on the listing and they are still too small. Disappointed that the seller does not allow to return or exchange because I would reorder in just the next size up... now this pair is useless to me.

review_title: As of November 2013, sizing is WAY too small
review_body: Pictures tell 1000 words, so please see my picture.  As of early November 2013, Amazon's description for these slippers states that they are sized like street shoes, as does Capezio's website. However, you can see from my picture that that is clearly not the case. My daughter wears a 6.5 to 7 and I thought she'd have room to grow in a size 7.5...obviously, not so much.
