review_body: Works great and holds up well! Been kicked around, buried in toy boxes, etc more than it's been on the wrist, but it still looks new and works perfect! The elastic band loosens up on it's own it seems like, but it is going on a tiny wrist and it doesn't loosen enough to fall off...just enough to be annoying for a 4 year old. Highly recommend.

Kids often struggle with telling time. As a teacher. I wanted to avoid that problem with my daughter, who just turned five. I purchased the butterflies style, since the hours and minutes seemed more distinct and easily differentiated due to differently colored hands and correspondingly colored numbers. We are only focusing on the hour hand throughout the day, as we have been for the past year, using it to know when snacks, outings, and snacks are coming (great practical incentives). She can tell me what hour it is, including when it is almost a the hour.
I have been looking for a "time teaching" watch for some time now.  I like this watch for the following reasons:

review_title: Daughter likes it but multiple scratches on the face the first day
review_body: We got this for my 5 and a half year old, and while she loves it, I am feeling so/so about it.  First off, it is really cute, but the straps have a ton of excess on her little wrists.  It adjusts to fit any size, but there is a lot of fabric that just hangs out.  Also, within 3 hours of getting it I notices several permanent scratches on the face.  She had been playing inside and not around anything that would obviously do this to the watch that wasn't normal wear and tear kind of stuff.  I am disappointed that it didn't hold up to more than that.

I got this for my daughter's 7th birthday and she loves it!! I didn't realize when I bought it but it lights up when you push the button on the side, which is a cool feature. And the second hand is actually a little butterfly that ticks around in a circle - so cute! She is learning to tell time at school, and this is perfect to help her learn because it has the values for each number in small print (5, 10, 15, 20, etc.) right next to the big numbers. It adjusted easily to fit her narrow little wrists too, so it would fit a variety of sizes. She says it is comfortable as well. I would absolutely recommend this watch! It's great!

My daughter was asking me for a watch and I wanted to get something appropriate for a 3 yr old but that she could grow into & eventually learn to tell time on...this is a great watch, she can put it on & take it off herself, the design/colors are great for little girls and I like the different info on the face when the time comes (that is, if she does not lose it by then, which she already has twice but such is life with a 3 yr old). My only real complaint w/ this watch is that the strap doesn't stay snug and loosens up over the day a little, which leads to it coming off sometimes, esp when taking jackets off, etc.

review_title: PERFECT watch for five and six year olds.
review_body: My daughter is in first grade, and they started learning about clock faces and telling time, so she came home they other day and asked for a kids watch.  Amazon is awesome because this same watch at the mall was 30 dollars. I paid half that on Amazon!  There is a light (bluish green illumination) feature, which my little one likes a lot. The face has two sets of numbers (hours and minutes)and it makes it simple to read the time.  She is already a pro at telling time!  The wrist strap is a little goofy, but I doubt kids will mind. There is always a little extra material that kinda either binds up or flops around.  No biggie.  For 14 bucks I really don't mind.  You can't go wrong with this purchase for your 5 or 6 year old.

I gave this to my six-year-old daughter for Christmas.  Within 24 hours, the face was scratched so bad the bottom half was unreadable.  And it's not like she was rubbing her wrists on concrete or anything - she was just being a kid, doing her usual kid stuff.  The face really needs a raised edge around it to protect the plastic.  Other than that, this is a great watch.  She had no problem reading the small numbers around the edge, but she was very upset that the watch was ruined so quickly.  I'm going to look for a different watch that can handle typical kids "rough and tumbleness" for her.

review_title: Cute and effective all at the same time
review_body: My little girl has been using her watch for about a week and is loving it.  It is cute and colorful...she loves the little butterfly that is the second hand...and very little girl.  She is quickly being able to tell time and enjoys doing it.  She has a tiny wrist and it fits well.  It doesn't have a clasp or buckle so it just slides over the hand.  At first it was loosening quite frequently but it seems to be staying the right size more now.  Maybe the warmth of her arm and getting the band to be where it fits makes it less slippery on the metal band holder.  All in all we are happy with the purchase so far.

review_title: I loved that there were no seams to fall apart
review_body: Just what I expected from crocks. I loved that there were no seams to fall apart, loved that the handles were also sturdy. I bought this so my granddaughter could go out in the rain and play in the puddles, or when they go camping and fishing so her shoes won't get wet. And of course, the pink color was very vibrant. she loves pink and the definitely were pink, just like the picture shows

review_title: Very happy with the quality of these boots
review_body: Very happy with the quality of these boots. We're on season 2 of use and they still keep out the water and function as they should.

We have gone through so many boots for my 3 year old and we always end of throwing them out. These are amazing boots! They fit his foot without falling off when walking or running. They are a very sturdy material that doesn't get "worn" looking. They get muddy and dirty obviously, but nothing that can't be quickly rinsed off. We are obsessed with the boots!
This product run small and it cane with a deffect.

review_title: I love these boots because my son can get them on ...
review_body: I love these boots because my son can get them on himself. They take a beating in rain and shine, fit him well - he can run and play on whatever he wants while wearing them. I wish they came in more colors they are doing the trick! I bought myself a matching pair in an adult size for a farm class we take together. Super cute and great for little hands to pull on.

My 2yo son loves the color and is excited to wear them however the ankle shaft is incredibly narrow so it's hard to get his foot in and we can't tuck pants into the boots. Also because of the narrow ankle, walking in these us very difficult for him and he kind of waddles around and then falls. Unfortunately we threw away the box so we can't return.

I bought these for a last-minute camping trip to the beach during the early fall. I needed something that would keep my son's feet dry and work okay in the sand. These were great! He wore them with and without socks and always said they were comfortable. Now that it's winter, he's actually worn these in the snow (we don't get a lot) with several pairs of socks on, and his feet have stayed warm and dry.

My 4 1/2 year old LOVES these shoes. They were just the right size and stayed on his feet when he was running (which was not the case with other boots we tried) AND he could pretty easily get them on and off (also not the case with all boots we tried). The plastic is pretty rigid, but he seems to like them.

These boots are the best. They go on and off very easily and my son gets compliments from nearly everyone he meets while wearing these boots. He loves them, and seems to be very comfortable running around in them. I've bought them in two sizes and I might buy the next size when he outgrows his current ones.

True to size. My toddler loves these boots, they are her go to shoes right now. She loves the handles and the color of course! These boots are EXTREAMLY light weight. They are not bulky and heavy like most rain boots, which makes them perfect for toddlers and children. I wish I had a pair for my self, seriously the best rain boots ever!
love this brand and the price is right. fits as expected and washes up great!

review_title: Fashionable jean jacket and good quality
review_body: Good quality. I recommend this jacket to kids. It's a little big ( I wear size mm starting to wear size large) but it is fashionable and cute with rolled up sleeves. If you want a jean jacket, get this one! (If it fits.) Totally recommend this jacket!  As written by daughter!
It is so cute on my granddaughter!

review_title: She loved it! For as expected and the quality was ...
review_body: Bought this for my daughter to wear to a concert! She loved it! For as expected and the quality was great.

review_title: has a nice stretch to it and it isn't stiff like denim ...
review_body: has a nice stretch to it and it isn't stiff like denim can be.  It looked just like the picture.  Dark denim that looks great with pants, dress or skirt or shorts for those cooler summer nights.
It fits my daughter great. A little long on the sleeve, but we folded up the cuffs and it's great.
Perfect jacket for my 5 1/2 year old daughter! The snap buttons make it easy for her to get on and off. Great jacket for the price!
Prefect for my daughter to wear to school.  Very comfy and cute with dresses
Fits great and no rips yet. Had for over a year now!
Little long in the arms, but no issues with the sleeves rolled up.
It was so hard to find a watch to fit my 10 year olds wrist. Happy to have finally found one. My son loves it too!
So many function you can’t get time info very fast
Great watch!!! Second one we ordered!!
The digital numbers disappeared after a few days but the hands were still right. Seller did refund.

review_title: Have to put the watch in 24 hour mode to ...
review_body: Have to put the watch in 24 hour mode to set the time, and often gets onto the wrong day and time due to kids trying to hit the light feature.
Nice

review_title: Analog and digital sections aren't linked. Comes with no ...
review_body: Analog and digital sections aren't linked. Comes with no instructions on how to set the digital clock, you just have to figure it out. Band does go small enough for a 4 year old.
Bought it for my son and he didn't like that it. I thought it was fine.
My grandsons love this watch!

review_title: Sturdy watch. Doesn't break and is water resistant
review_body: Sturdy watch.Doesn't break and is water resistant.

Unfortunately these shoes don't fare well at daycare.  Within the first week part of the front rubber end fell off, a few days later I noticed the fabric on one of the sides has a hole in it.  Lengthwise the shoe fits, the width is a little small.  My son has narrow feet so it's not that he has a wide foot, the shoe is just a tad narrow, we do not have problems looping the top fastener but half of it is definitely exposed.

review_title: The shoe looks adorable, but boy is it stiff
review_body: The shoe looks adorable, but boy is it stiff. It's hard to get baby's feet inside and it's pretty narrow for a toddler shoe. Also, the tongue keeps rubbing up against the top of my daughters foot, causing irritation, so now she tries to get them off any chance she can get. Disappointed.

My kiddo has a slightly low volume foot and a wide-for-their-foot toes.  These fit good although it would be nicer to have a little more width in the toe box for a growing kiddo.  Regardless, parents be aware that if your kid has a cute chubby toddler foot, I suggest getting the sneakers that do not have the one-piece connected velcro strap.  The straps on these can not be unthreaded so it can open so wide versus a shoe where you can open it completely to get that chubby little foot in!

review_title: These shoes are really nice and full of style
review_body: These shoes are really nice and full of style. I need to find an adult version of these to match. I got 5.5 for my daughter and even though they're said to be boys, I think they look good on her anyways.

review_title: The best shoe for a child that is extremely rough on ...
review_body: The best shoe for a child that is extremely rough on his shoes. they are the only ones that have lasted him til he outgrows them. Minimal sole wear but every pair of shoes he wears out the toe area. These are my 5yr old sons 6th pair. We will continue to buy different colors as he out grows these. Excellent shoe. Fits perfect, Last forever.

review_title: These shoes were a great pair for my son
review_body: These shoes were a great pair for my son. They do run big and it took a while for him to be able to wear them. My son is active and these shoes held up. There were no rips or tears compared to his other shoes. They are a bit stiff so it took a few times for my son to wear them in.

review_title: These are adorable but fit about a half size smaller
review_body: These are adorable but fit about a half size smaller.  The sneaker is also on the narrow side.  Velcro tabs don't easily slide open to allow access.  Its a bit of a struggle to get these on when compared to the Stride Rite sneakers with similar velcro closure.

review_title: Little girl is happy so so am I
review_body: This is the 3rd pair of this style Saucony sneaker that my daughter has picked out.  She had pink in spring since purple was sold out, purple in the fall and wanted a new pair of purple.  The store we had been buying them at stopped selling them so Amazon it was and they did not disappoint.  My daughter saw purple AND leopard and was so excited she nearly jumped out of her skin.  She shows everyone her purple leopards and wears them almost daily.  This is a kid who only wore sneakers if prompted to before this pair.  Sizing tends to be a little big especially in the heal area but when I went down a 1/2 size in the fall I got burnt so just go with the typical size your child wears.  I should add that my daughter does have slim/narrow feet compared to other children her age.

review_title: Great quality but small and narrow
review_body: Great quality but small and narrow. My daughter is in an 8 normally, but I knew this shoe ran small so I went up to a 9W. It's still too narrow to Velcro easily, and it almost fits her perfectly, so little room to grow. I love the look, sturdiness, and support of this shoe; but the fit is disappointing.

These are really cute shoes and the velcro straps make on & off so easy for my 2 yr old and 5 yr old.  I have to say I should have took others warnings on reviews that the width is narrow.  They fit my 5 yr old perfect, but my 2 yr old still has chubby-baby feet and the strap doesn't fit across all the way.  But they work, are comfortable, easy for me to take off and on when rushing out the door and they really are nice looking shoes, so we will keep them.
100% recomendado
Grandaughter loved this watch.
My niece loved it!
Back fell off
It was difficult setting the watch.
This watch is for a child that is underprivileged overseas for Christmas.  I think she will love it.
good
love it

review_title: Grand daughter loves Frozen, can't wait till Christmas morning ...
review_body: Grand daughter loves Frozen, can't wait till Christmas morning to give her this watch,

review_title: I looks and works as expected and my 3-4 year ...
review_body: I looks and works as expected and my 3-4 year old loves it and is learning to tell time with it.

review_title: The watch is cute and it fits my daughter's arm ...
review_body: The watch is cute and it fits my daughter's arm the way I want it to. My daughter's wrists are very small and the watch has enough holes to make it fit. Just what I was looking for.

This is a great watch.  I chose this because of the clear face, numbers, hands and second hand.  The indiglo light is a big hit.  I purchased this for my 7 year old daughter so she could see how time works in a non digital fashion.  I bought a more fashionable watch for my older daughter and I think she seems a little envious of the indiglo light this features and its readability.  If it would have come in additional band colors I would have bought this style for both of them.

Bought this for my 8 year old  grand daughter because pink is her favourite colour.She loves it. Allows her to tell the time numerically rather than digitally. It was a perfect fit for her small wrist. She claims it rings at every hour so it keeps her abreast of the time.Very suitable for her age and upwards to pre-teens. The band seems sturdy but is not genuine leather.She is very pleased with it because it is not plastic.
Perfect size for a seven year old learning to tell time.

Unlike the other reviews, we didn't have a problem with the strap or the watch working properly, but the face became scratched and unreadable within a week of my daughter wearing it.  This watch is NOT WORTH THE MONEY.

Honestly, as an adult with really tiny wrists, this is perfect! It works great, and even though it's a kids watch is a plain enough color and style that it's suitable for work. For parents looking into watches for their kids, it's perfect! If you're just looking for a cute watch that works well, this is for you.

Purchased for my 7 year-old granddaughter. This watch, as opposed to others for children (example Frozen Watch) actually has a number for each hour. Bella will be reading numbers, not dashes, as she learns to tell time.

review_title: Great sized watch with easily read numbers!
review_body: Easy to read numbers for someone learning to tell time, and a smaller face size for young girls. I ordered this for my grand-daughter's 7th birthday, and she's only taken it off once in about 4-5 days. She loves it! Flexible, but sturdy band, also.
Great watch for my child. Very sturdy and cute. I wish it had the glow in the dark light, but it is still fine without it.
This is a great watch for a young girl that is getting one for the first time.  My granddaughter loved it, it is pink and she just loves

My two year old niece wears a 7.5 so we ordered an 8 and they were too small. We returned and purchased a 9. These seem a little big, but will do the job for her dance class. The shoe is cute, I just wish the sizing was not so complicated and got more true to size.

The shoe is a nice shoe but it looks as though it has been stretched on the sides.  I ordered a narrow but the shoe is exceptionally wide and there is a huge gap at the sides of the foot.  My daughter typically wears a regular size (i.e., not narrow) and her prior now outgrown ballet slipper never puffed out at the sides.  It looks as though the shoe may have been stretched on the sides.  The length is okay but I question whether this shoe has been previously worn and stretched.

review_title: Nice shoes but not for chunky feet
review_body: My 2.5-yo baby girl has chunky feet. Street size 8-8.5W and the top of her feet come up pretty high. The 9W fit in the foot but the strap was too tight. My daughter said it hurt and took it off immediately. Nice and cute shoes, but I have to keep looking.

review_title: My all-time favorite shoe after four little ballerinas
review_body: This is my favorite ballet shoe!  I have reordered the same shoe several times in both full sole and split sole.  The quality is so nice for the price, and the shoe looks great!  Their ballet teacher sells a different brand, but the quality and fit is not as nice as these.  They look nicer on the foot because they don't come up high in the front, making the foot look dainty, not floppy.  The leather is super-soft, the color is nice, and even the floral lining is pretty.  They have held up long enough to pass down to sisters too.  This shoe is more than worth the reasonable price!

review_title: The shoe is fine but the SIZE IS WAY OFF
review_body: I bought these for my daughter who is 5 and just started wearing a size 10 street shoe (she still fits in a size 9 but they are close to being too small). I did a lot of research on sizing, even looked up the Capezio sizing chart since I know ballet shoes can run small. The Amazon sizing is way off but even the Capezio size chart says these should fit true to street shoe size. I ordered a half size bigger just to be safe and her foot barely squeezed into them, toes were crammed to the end. I returned them and ordered a Bloch pair (those I know run 1.5 size too small so I knew what I was getting). Quality of this shoe was good and seems like a nice ballet slipper but beware they DO run small so order up at least one full size if not 1.5 size up.

Excellent ballet shoes, made very well with good leather. My daughter wears size 10 shoes in Stride Rite so I got size 11.5 in these.  They are slightly big about half inch in the back so she has room to grow.  I use the ties to make the shoes fit tightly on her feet.

review_title: Recommended by her ballet instructor and we approve
review_body: I was nervous but what size to order because the dance stores around us close. My daughter wears about a size 9 shoe depending on the company's and I ordered a 9.5. It fits her beautifully with a tiny bit room to grow. I know ballet shoes are supposed to fit snug. She loves them and so do we!

review_title: Very very light pink - more like nude. I'm okay with that since it's $6 ...
review_body: I followed all the other reviewers here and bought too big of a size.  My 5.5 year old daughter usually wears size 13 for all her normal shoes.  I bought size 2.5 thinking that these fit waaaaaaaaaaaaay too small.  I was wrong. Now I need to either exchange them or just keep them when she grows into them.  I'm now purchasing 1 size up.  I think size 1 will fit just right......I'll post my review again after I receive it.

I had purchased these for my daughter at a store before and whey they got small, there was not a doubt in my mind I would order the same ones from Amazon. I had gone through the running-around-store-while-trying-to-get-the-three-year-old-to-try-on-shoes struggle once, I was not gonna put myself through that pain again with my now 4yo (not a bit less energetic). I just went with a full size bigger and we are happily ever after.

I ordered for my 3 yr old daughter. They seemed to be well made,nice shoes; however, they run at least one size too small. I had ordered this pair and another brand too. I ordered the other brand 1/2 a size up and that worked so I returned these and didn’t reorder.

review_title: Super cute watch for a Minnie Mouse lover!!!
review_body: My daughter loves all things Minnie Mouse, so when I saw this watch I knew it was for her.  I gave it to her today for her birthday and she was so excited.  I love that the hands of the watch are different colors and have the words minute and hour on them so that you can teach your child how to tell time.  Also it is great that the multiples of 5 are above each hour.  My daughter turned 4 today, and is already very conscious of time so this watch was very fitting! The band of the watch is a soft rubber and the watch itself is light enough to not weigh her little wrist down.
Perfect little watch for my toddler and nice quality.

review_title: I thought it might not be too nice because of the price
review_body: I thought it might not be too nice because of the price.  It will be a Christmas gift, and I’m sure it will be loved.  Even the box it came in was cute.

What a beautiful jacket! It feels like a well built and very warm coat and I am very happy with the overall quality of it. I recommend this for colder climates, the only downfall is that it is a soft canvas kind of material so it will get wet with snow and slush, but that's to be expected.

review_body: Daughter loves, nice and thick for being out in the elements.

I bought my 5 year old a Carhartt so she would be warm for the Tennessee Christmas we're going to have this year. She LOVES the color and cant wait to wear it. It was a little large, but that means she can wear it longer!
Great jacket, will be perfect for cold weather!

review_body: So cute. Great quality we washed it 4 times before winter ended. Rugged and durable.

Caught these on sale and love them. Bought them a little big so the girls will grow into them for next year. Anyone that has bought Carhartt knows they are quality and if you haven't try them for yourself, you'll love them too.
My daughter loves this jacket and I trust it to keep her warm. Machine washiblity makes it even better.
I got this for my little girl and she loves it. Not to heavy for her to play in but kept her warm in 40 degree weather. The cheapest I could find and glad I got it.

review_title: Good Value, Daughter Loves It, Very Good Customer Service
review_body: My 6yo daughter really likes this watch. It's cute, it's easy to read, and she particularly likes the multi-colored backlight.
7 yr old daughter lives this thing. Works well and just enough features to be fun but not overwhelming.

review_title: Perfect Watch for a little girl learning to tell time
review_body: I got this watch for a very sweet little girl that is in second grade her grandfather is trying to teach her to tell time with out a digital watch and I thought this would be perfect to help her out. She did not know she was getting it. When she got it  she was so excited  she loves the watch dearly . I recommend this to any one wanting to teach a child how to tell time  with a real clock instead of a distal  number.

Great watch! I bought this watch for my 8 year old/entering 3rd grade daughter and the very first time she was able to tell the time. She's worn the watch every day for over a month and has it next to her on the bed when she sleeps. She checks the time at night by pressing a button that illuminates the face & I often ask her the time just for the heck of it. She's learned to round off the time to the nearest 5 minute mark & can tell accurately to the minute as well. The elastic band is holding up well, with no signs of wear other than normal. Great watch! Highly recommend this type of watch for kids learning to tell time.

review_title: A Few Odd Things Otherwise A Great First Watch
review_body: This watch is super cute, and my 7 year old squealed with delight when she opened it on her birthday. I have the same complaints as everyone else: 1. The strap has a buckle that makes the stretchy band adjustable, but the buckle doesn't stay fastened. I will remedy this by stitching it closed. 2. The small numbers that are to serve as a guide (for example, the 2 has a tiny 10 above it so a little one would say x:10) count backwards beginning at the six. This confuses my daughter (and me!). Does anyone really say it's 25 'til one? Other than these, it's a great first watch for a girl learning to tell time! I'd buy it as a gift in a heartbeat.

review_title: We have had this watch for a year now and ...
review_body: We have had this watch for a year now and it's OK.  The time isn't as accurate anymore but I need to replace the battery, so that may be the problem.  The band is a bit weird, per my daughter,  She likes the butterflies but there is a lot material left at the ends.  Also, if it gets wet while washing hands, it does take a while for it to dry and should be taken off...which increases the risk of losing it at school or where ever.  The second hand is really cute.

Great first watch for an 8 year old. The face of the watch is easy to read. The arms on the face of the clock have the words "hours "and "minutes" written on each arm so it is easy for beginners to tell time. It also has an arm that shows the seconds. On the outer rim of the face of the purple watch, is a pink edge, one darker pink ( to show the first 30 minutes after the hour) and then a lighter pink,to show the 30 minutes preceding the hour. The wrist band is flexible with enough stretch for easy off and on and has plenty of extra band material to expand as she grows.

review_title: Deceiving watch for a new learner.
review_body: For a "beginner" watch for a child learning to tell time, this watch could confuse them.  Instead of the minutes past 30 being marked as 35-40-45-50, etc. They begin to count down, so 25-20-15-10. etc.  VERY confusing for a 7 year old.  3:40 was looking like 3:20 to her, thanks to the markings on the watch.  It made me sad to see her so frustrated.  I used it as a learning tool to teach "20 minutes till 4" but that was over her head as she is still trying to grasp counting minutes on the clock.  I will be buying her a new watch that doesn't confuse her.

review_title: Fantastic watch for practicing to tell time!
review_body: Excellent choice for a littke girl's watch.  I wanted an analog watch that has minute marks on it as well and in addition the butterfly moves as it measures seconds.  Makes this watch perfect for kearning to tell time!  I like the band as well you can make it as tight as you need.  My daughter has a very small wrist so there is extra material but it doesn't bother Her.  The band can be washed which is always a plus.

My 5 year old wears this non-stop.  We like the small minute numbers on the outside, it's helping her learn to tell time.  The clear face did scratch within the first 2 weeks - I was able to buff some of it out but still scuffed.  Will revise if any more issues discovered.

We got this for my daughter for her 8th birthday. She LOVES it! Hasn't taken it off yet. The little unicorn circulates as the second hand and just adds to overall awesomeness that is this cute little time piece.

My daughter is very happy with this watch! She loved this surprise. I love that the band is fabric, has a little flex, and the whole thing is water resistant. The only thing I would change to give it 5 stars would be the outter numbers. I was under the impression they counted the seconds 1-60, but they do not. What they do is count 1-30 after the hour and then 30-1 'til the hour. I find this is confusing for a beginner time-teller... my child is trying to read what the second had is pointing to and that is incorrect 50% of the time on this watch. (example: the minute hand pointing to the nine means 45 mins, but the outlaying number is 15.)

review_title: If you are looking for something that’s cute and well ...
review_body: If you are looking for something that’s cute and well made, then you’ve came to the right place. My daughter won’t go anywhere without those cute boots. She just turned 2 and I got her a size 8. A little bit bigger but it doesn’t bother her at all.

I ordered the correct size and they were WAY too small. I had to return. Later I saw somewhere it written that you have to buy a full size larger. Well it's great that it was posted, and it's my fault for not reading that...but why would a shoe company make shoes with wrong sizes!?!? Bizarre. I reordered with the correct size, and they work great--if overpriced.

review_title: Light weight, comfy, and easy to clean
review_body: Such a great buy! Great price in comparison to other stores and the boots are perfect! My son doesn't like being restricted so it took him a few days to get used to the idea of rainboots in general but now he loves running around in puddles with them. They are sooo light weight and easy to clean. I purchased a size up because I read a review saying they run small but they are big on my son...so his current size would have been right. It doesn't seem to bother him that they are a bit big for him. He can still run around in them just fine and they will last longer too! I highly recommend them!

review_title: 5 year old son is pretty picky about his shoes
review_body: My 3.5 year old son is pretty picky about his shoes.  Sneakers have to be laced or strapped TIGHT, and he rarely agrees to wear anything other than Nikes.  He's even been known to pick out a pair of shoes (high top Chucks) only to later profess that he doesn't "wike them!" I bought these for him and his little sister for Christmas and held my breath that he'd like them.  To my surprise, he loves them!  She does too.

We love these boots! They are the second pair we've bought for my son an he never wants to take them off! That said here is why I love them... They are that light weight croc we all love so the boot isn't comber sum for my son to walk in and they are super easy to clean and have little handles to make them easy to pick up an carry or help pull on. The reason I gave 4 out of 5 is because the leg of the boot is somewhat "fitted" so we had to order bigger boots just to get them on. My son wears a toddler size 6/7 an I bought 8 because the 6 that I had bought when my son wore size 5 became harder an harder to get in because of the leg part... There is a trick to getting them on which is giving the leg of them a squeeze going the way of toe to heel so that the leg is wide enough to get the foot an heel through.

review_title: but my kiddos love them. I love that there is no seam ...
review_body: I bought a pair for my one year old and my three year old. I bought a size larger for each of them due to reading some reviews of them fitting on the small side. The boots fit as expected. I ordered a size larger so they each have a little extra room. We will see how they hold up to the wear and tear. Only had them a few days so far, but my kiddos love them. I love that there is no seam and they can be easily rinsed off.

review_title: I had no idea how great these were until I tried other brands
review_body: These boots are fantastic.  They keep my girls' feet dry, they appear to be comfortable, and they STAY ON THEIR FEET.  I didn't realize how novel that was until they grew out of this size and I tried some different boots.  They were wearing sizes 6 and 7 respectively at age 2 when they grew out of them.  Bought them a pair of Hunters (for 55 bucks...) and they fell off their feet every single time they tried to go upstairs.  Or when I picked them up.  Or when they took a step that was slightly too high.  Sitting in a highchair at a restaurant?  You better believe they fell off.  Can't deny they looked cute as hell, on the rare occasion they weren't lying on the ground.  These were sized by a saleswoman at Nordstrom so I imagine they weren't the wrong size.  So I returned those and tried a pair of Oakiwear, same problem with the stairs, although to a lesser extent.  In those other brands the shaft just isn't curved at all  so they slip right out.  Which is pretty much the most annoying thing ever when you're trying to navigate a flight of stairs with a 2 year old on either side of you, who is now barefoot, screaming because her boot fell down the stairs.  Pretty sure I said some inappropriate words...Clearly crocs gets it.  These boots take a bit more effort to put on and take off, but that's how they manage to stay on the foot, which is kind of the whole point of a boot to begin with.  I imagine this would be less of a problem for kids with bigger feet.

My kids love crocs of all kinds! Both my little girls have the croc rain boots and if it’s not raining, they wear them around the house like little house shoes because they love them so much! I ordered green for my youngest daughter and they’re very vibrant! I’ll buy them again after she out grows them :)))

review_title: Bought these for my son I like crocs for him because he has wide feet we ...
review_body: Bought these for my son I like crocs for him because he has wide feet we spend alot on his regular shoes witch is fine but it's nice to not spend a arm and a leg on rain boots that he will wear only when it rains. I can buy him his size and know they will fit his wide foot and still be made to last.

Favorite boot almost five years in a row by a pickyshoe wearer—went through so many sizes, never fails to provide great water puddle splashing fun. Easy to pull on and cushiony. We tried the narrower version with the holes on each side, and those went untouched so I’m relieved to find these still available. This one’s great for growing feet.

review_title: Shoe was too tight from my son's foot.
review_body: This shoe was purchased for my son, who has worn Saucony brand shoes in the past.  Both of my children have worn this brand and they both have wider feet.  The shoes we have purchased in the past fit their feet well.  This shoe was smaller, and did not fit the width of my son's foot.  Buying shoes online is a gamble however, and I'll know in the future to buy up a size.  This situation will not prevent me from purchasing this brand in the future.

review_title: Thanks for sending dirty shoes! Not acceptable
review_body: The shoes that I receive are worn and have a dirty sole!

I bought these sneakers for my 3 year old daughter. She has narrow feet so I've been picky on the shoes I research as most seem to be made for wider feet. I received these today and after putting them on, they definitely fit her just right. My husband actually even commented about how slim they look, so I'm not sure these would fit wider feet! I also absolutely love that they have half sizes as my daughter's in a 7 but will outgrow them soon, even though 8's are too big on her. The 7.5 I got her are perfect! She looks adorable in these sneakers as well, and I already received compliments from strangers after her wearing them only a couple of hours. Great shoes, and as always from Amazon, speedy delivery!

These are cute and they fit my kid just right! They don't look super expensive. If you want your kid to look preppy, pay a few more bucks and get something else. But for basic everyday stuff, these are just fine. I have a boy although I think the cobalt color is unisex (could work for a girl). The only thing I'd change in order to improve these would be to have the tongue be larger and to have the counter (part at the back) be taller. Both of these changes would help make it easier for me to pull these onto my kid's feet.
We love these shoes.  They fit our toddler perfectly and we continue to buy them as his foot grows in size.  He has a slightly taller and wider foot than most, and these work out great for us!

These are really cute and my daughter loves them and her feet are pretty long and thin.  The one issue and probably why they are so inexpensive, the velcro strap is about half an inch too short.  This allows the sticky part of the Velcro to remain exposed to all kinds of debris.

These are so cute on my toddler! They fit him as expected and are easy to put on and off. They seem to hold up well to messy play time at his daycare.  The only suggestion I could make would be to make the velcro strap a little bit longer.  Highly recommend, would purchase again.

This is the second pair of Saucony tennis shoes we have purchased for our toddler, and they are perfect. Some of his other shoes have heavy or slippery soles, but these are just right. The shoes are lightweight, so they are easy for him to walk in. The hook & loop closure makes it easy to get the shoes on and off. We finally had to get him a new pair, because the old ones were getting a bit small and the tread on the bottom was wearing out. These are wonderful everyday shoes!

review_title: My favorite baby and toddler shoe...
review_body: I have tried a lot of shoes for my little one and these are, by far, my favorite. Easy to pull on and off. Easy to take care of. Many colors to pick from. The price is right as well. Maybe slightly narrower than some, so it's something to think about if your kid has very wide feet, but I think they'll still work and be comfortable.

review_title: I was able to pick the size that fits nicely. So I guess you could say the fit ...
review_body: I followed the previous reviews recommendation and bought a size bigger since they seem to run small. With that calculation, I was able to pick the size that fits nicely. So I guess you could say the fit is somewhat small unless you read the reviews, then they fit as expected.
Kids love them pain in the but to set time

I ordered this watch as an incentive prize for our Sunday School. I also bought other watches in the same price range. I was unable to get the time. It blinked a number and never was able to adjust properly.  Very poor quality.

review_title: Had to send the first one back as it was ...
review_body: Had to send the first one back as it was defective. Luckily Amazon is fab with returns.  The second one worked for 1 week and now won't keep time.  My 3 year old still loves it, but I certainly wouldn't buy it again.

review_title: Nice Child's Watch.  Pink Is Cool.
review_body: Nice watch for a small girl.  She liked it very much.  However, the Amazon ad is a little confusing.  The watch says WR30 right on the face of it, but the Amazon ad said it was not water resistant.  I bought it because I believe the manufacturer.

A very nice-looking watch with simple face, perfect for my daughter who is learning to tell time. The face is small and fits a small 7 year old's wrist fine. The pink is lovely, especially for any child that loves the more feminine side of life.
Just received it and gave it to my daughter. She is 9 years old and looks like a lady with it.  If it continue working, it would be the best present ever - her words

review_title: ) Classy little watch that I'm quite pleased with!
review_body: Got this as a first watch and birthday gift for my 5 year old, and she loves it! It's smallest hole fits her tiny wrist, and the largest hold fits my wrist (just a gauge of size, not that I wear it!) Classy little watch that I'm quite pleased with!
The best cheap watch ever.  I use and abuse it and it still keeps the time!  I buy a new one every year.

review_title: The strap is synthetic leather, but still a good watch
review_body: I bought this for my 8-year old, and she loves it. Numbers are clear to read, color matches with web picture, and it comes with night light. it is a cool function for kids. The strap is right size for kid's wrist, not too long.

Gave this to my 8 year old granddaughter for her birthday. Her cousin and sisters got character watches and she was a little disappointed that she did not. I offered to take it back and buy her a "little kid" watch, but she decided to keep it. It's a Timex and should last for years barring a violent collision with something hard.
The watch was perfect for a kindergartner. Numerals were easy to read. Watch fit nicely.

review_title: My 9 year old daughter loves this watch, but ...
review_body: My 9 year old daughter loves this watch, but the face is scratched up and completely unreadable!  And now, the battery has died.  She received this as a Christmas gift two months ago and I can't think of any reason for the scratches.
Bought this for my niece, it’s a nice first watch, band feels like it has a cardboard inside and there is no backlight but she’s 9 and doesn’t care. Keeps perfect time.

review_title: Buying a few sizes up would be best
review_body: I bought these ballet shoes a year ago for my daughter to use at home when she was 3 years old because she loved her ballet class so much that she never wanted to take the ballet shoes off! She is an average size but I found that tap shoes and ballet shoes in general fit very small. I bought her a size 10.5 wide which was a few sizes up from her size then and I'm glad I did because the strings pulled tight enough to bunch up the shoes for a snug fit and now can be worn more loosely now that she is a size 9. They have kept in good condition even with how rough she plays with them and I'm hoping to still get a lot more use out of them.

Sizing was way off. My daughter wears a girls 10. I ordered at 10.5 and they were too small so I ordered an 11 and they were way to big. It's a shame because we normally love Capizo and the slipper itself was made well and was cute.

These beautiful, sturdy ballet shoes are comfortable and affordable. I have purchased them in various sizes as my daughters out grow them since 2014. They're Capezio, so you can trust they're sturdy and hold up well. My daughters are still rather young, so they out grow theirs before they wear through them. They're not stiff, as the ones from Payless Shoes or Target tend to be, and usually the price is pretty similar. I always recommend these to the other dance moms when they're looking to replace their daughters' shoes.

The shoes were cute, but the packaging looked very worn. I ordered a half size up from street shoe size and they were still a full size too small. Shoe in picture is a Nike size 8, I ordered an 8.5 in the ballet shoe.

Great quality shoes but they run really small. I ordered a size larger than my daughter’s actual size based off of the reviews. I should have ordered a size and a half. I’m returning them but did end up ordering the next size up because they are adorable.

They do run a size too small. I read the reviews and decided to order a size up for my daughter's size 8 shoe, but when the 9s got here they were too small also so I had to order a size 10. Those got here and they fit with just a tiny bit of space, but you can adjust them with the elastic tie in the front of the shoe. With all that hassle I should be giving this a bad review but I just cant. These shoes are amazing quality and comfort. They are genuine leather and with wear there is no creasing or color removal yet they bend with the foot. A perfect shoe.

review_title: Very cute, run a little small.
review_body: These would have been great had I ordered a size bigger. My 2 year old is currently wearing a 6 shoe in all of her sneakers and shoes, but the 6 in these ballet slippers looked like her toes were going to break through the front. The width seemed fine, it was just the length from heel to toe that seemed off. I know ballet slippers like this stretch, but she could barely get these on, never mind wear these long enough to stretch them. They are adorable, I suggest ordering one size up. I had to return.

These ballet shoes are an off nude/dusty pink color and fit my daughter perfectly. She finds them incredibly comfortable and tries to wear them everywhere. In fact she often wears them after dance while we run errands. Even so the soles are still firmly attached and besides dirt and scuffs and she would have gotten from dancing anyhow they are still in great condition. The elastic band holds the shoe in place well without being too tight. We would definitely purchase these shoes again.

review_title: Nice but needs some work on the drawstring
review_body: Good pair of dance shoes for the prices.  Only problem was that the strings that tie in the front of the shoes kept untying and that's the drawstring that keeps the shoe somewhat on the foot (helps with the width).  The string is a tough rubbery type and so was hard to keep tied.  Ended up gluing it to hold it in place.

My daughter is 3, size 7/7.5 shoe but needed a 9 narrow for the gapping issue in these. Free returns helped, originally ordered an 8 -too short but gapped on the sides.  They look cute, she loves them, but they still gap on the sides and the tie comes undone often.
nice
Cute but broke after 6 months.  The second hand came lose and just rattles around in watch.
super cute looking watch. we bought this for our daughter who in 20 months and she loves wearing it and showing it off.
great watch!!! My 5 year old daughter has learned to tell time with this watch!! It makes it really easy and the watch itself is very durable!!

review_title: This is such a cute watch. I looked all ...

The seller of this product was very thoughtful in writing me a Thank you Letter.  I do appreciate it.  Most seller don't take the time to do anything after the sale.  The product was really nice, and my 11 year old daughter loves it.  Very nicely made, and the back light is very easy to read.
Nice
