review_title: and even better that they come in all sorts of great colors
review_body: This is my sons second pair. Lots of abuse and never any issue. Everyone loves the shoes, and even better that they come in all sorts of great colors.

review_title: Cute. But they run a little small therefore they ...
review_body: Cute. But they run a little small therefore they didn't last as long as I wish they would have.

review_title: Got another pair true to size and they fit great. He wore them all week in Disney and ...
review_body: Got them big because of reviews but they were too big.  Got another pair true to size and they fit great.  He wore them all week in Disney and never  complained!

I bought these sneakers for my 4YO and we absolutely love them. They are low profile and comfortable. The purple is really vibrant and she has no trouble getting them on by herself. They remind me of the sneakers my little brother wore in the early 80s - have a funky retro vibe. They make me feel happy just looking at them and the plus is my little one likes wearing them!

My daughter loved these.  This is her 2nd paid (in a different color).  The thing I love about these shoes is that although they dont look it, the last areally long time.  My 5 yr old is rough in her shoes but these have lasted longer then any other brand...Nike, Puma, etc.  Bye 'em!.
Poor strap fastener, have not been able to use. Cute, though
A curious and nice clock until met the depths of the ocean.. then die inside a bottle. Just wet in the sink. the product was delivered according to the agreed conditions and at the time indicated
Watch is adorable, the band is very soft and the fastner is easy for my 4 year old to work herself.  Like that it lights up at night as well.
Great for teaching time, elastic band great for small arms!

review_title: Great starter watch for 6 year old girl!
review_body: Perfect for 6-year-old​ just learning to tell time. Fits comfortably and she likes wearing it.  Great starter watch!
Got this for my 7 yr old and she loves it!

review_title: This basic watch is just ok for a child learning ...
review_body: This basic watch is just ok for a child learning how to tell the time. The watch face is very small, as are the numbers, and it has no light. One of the delights of a first watch is checking the time at night. Back to Amazon, this went.
These as a gift made my 5 and 8 year old really happy. They love the moving butterfly seconds hand. Quality and fit and finish is really good for the price. Recommended.
Returning it. Seems cheap and hard to read the numbers.
Timex removed the indiglo feature from all their kids analog watches April 2015.
We like this shoe for ballet class, works well!

review_title: shoe has held up well and was comfortable for my daughter
review_body: Fits as expected for a dance shoe.  No problems except for the laces that never want to stay tied!  Otherwise, shoe has held up well and was comfortable for my daughter.  i buy 1 size up from their sneaker size
Fits well. Looks nice.
This is a great children's ballet shoe.  I have ordered these in several sizes as my daughter's foot has grown. Each pair has been made well and the fit is true to size.
Super cute and good for my little one.  She's 3.5 and a size 8 and they fit great.

My toddler needed to size up from her sz 6 Bloch ballet slippers.  We ordered the sz 7 Capezio's to save a few dollars.  Not worth it.  They were basically the same size length wise, just wider, and not nearly as cute.  Go for Bloch instead.

review_title: Ordered a size 6 and fits more like a 4
review_body: Ordered a size 6 and fits more like a 4.5/5. My daughter couldn't even get her foot halfway in. Overall, seems like good quality, but if you purchase these, get a size larger. if not two sizes larger.

These are nice looking slippers and they were comfortable for my little dancer. One problem was she fell and got scared so not in dance anymore. These shoes are for sale if you are interested! Worn once! Slippers were not on when she fell.

I purchased these in size 11 for my 4 year old who wears a size 10 shoe. I measured her foot with a tape measure (7 inches), then printed a size chart from a random shoe site & measured her foot on it (11). Based on that, her actual shoes are too small! However, they fit perfectly. No room to grow. She seems to be comfortable in them and I know they'll get allot of good use before she grows out of them. Happy with the purchase.

review_title: and I love them. They're inexpensive enough
review_body: This is my daughter's second pair, and I love them. They're inexpensive enough, and they feel like real ballet shoes. I think they might run just a touch small, maybe about a half size smaller than expected.

review_title: Great watch for teaching children to tell time
review_body: Great watch for teaching children to tell time. I have bought this Timex Teacher for each of my grand kids. A real winner.

review_title: Seemed good quality for what you pay but of course after ...
review_body: Very cute Timex. I bought this as a Christmas gift for my daughter. Seemed good quality for what you pay but of course after I could no longer send in for a replacement it stopped telling the correct time even with replaced battery. Was only used twice by my eight year old. This is an Amazon purchase but for some reason won't post as an Amazon purchase.
ok for a child
The band is easy to adjust, it's soft and pretty. My daughter loves the glow feature. And it even took a trip through our HE washing machine and SURVIVED! lol.

review_title: Our daughter loved this! I especially appreciate how the minutes and ...
review_body: Our daughter loved this! I especially appreciate how the minutes and the minute hand is labeled.  This watch is perfect for learning to tell time.
It is a nice watch, seems to be durable. My daughter learnt the tell the time with it. Also the glow function is a matter of awe between her friends.
Gave as a gift and as far as I know it has worked. It did fit well.
For first watch to teach a six year old time it will suffice. Wish the face was bigger making the numbers larger - but. For the money it is an ok starter watch.
Item as described. Satisfied!

review_title: This is the perfect watch to help my kids learn analog time
review_body: This is the perfect watch to help my kids learn analog time. The hour hand is labeled "hour" and the face of the watch says half past. And it has a kid lost it warranty!

review_title: My son lives them and cans them his super fast shoes
review_body: My son lives them and cans them his super fast shoes. Only improvement would be a little longer Velcro strap.

Just bought these and we are very happy. They look great and you can really feel the quality in these shoes. Son really likes them too. My one complaint is because of the Velcro straps, it can sometimes be a pain to loosen them enough to get his foot in, but that is a minor, minor squabble.
Love them. Came a little stiff but didn't take long for my son to break them in. The sole is also hard so I wouldn't recommend them for early walkers.
These are the only sneakers I buy for my kids. They hold up VERY well. Worth every penny.

my kid was the coolest kid in daycare w/ these on.  They fit properly, were apparently comfortable because the kid didn't try to take them off as much as his other shoes, and they were easy to put on/take off.
Wow! Glad we found these 1/2 price on Amazon vs on Stride Rite! Easy to put on. Seems comfortable. Lightweight.

If you're looking for a shoe that is easy to work with for young children, has vintage style, and is just as reliable as it's adult counterparts, you've found your shoes. Velcro makes it simple, Saucony makes it cool.
Best sneakers for kids!!!
I have bought multiple pairs of Saucony shoes for my toddlers as they grow. They are durable, fit well, and are easy for me to get on and off with the double velcro one piece. And they look adorable!
Adorable little sneakers that fit perfect! Bright colors and Quality Construction.

review_title: I bought her size 9T in this ballet shoe and it fits really good..
review_body: My daughter is wearing 8T on dress shoes. I bought her size 9T in this ballet shoe and it fits really good...
Good quality! Both of my daughters love them.
Perfect fit! Capezio is the only way to go!
These ballerina sippers are adorable and provided that authentic ballerina look we were going for our 2 1/2 year old daughter's Halloween costume. The color and quality were excellent!

My daughter is a size 9 (toddler) in other shoes, but has almost outgrown her 10.5 size ballet slippers. These slippers run small! But otherwise they're great - quality is good, she definitely outgrows them faster than she wears them out!
I ordered 1.5 sizes bigger and they were still a size to small. Found some at Payless for the same price and I was able to try them on my daughter
Great as the first pair of ballet shoes. These were a pretty close to true size.

review_title: these have much more room for my son than the ...
review_body: these have much more room for my son than the last pair we bought him. he loves these and they are rich in color, as well.

These shoes seem to be really high quality but my daughter wears a 6 I ordered a 7 to be safe and they came EXTREMELY small. I know her foot didn't grow because all of her other size 6 shoes still fit well.  I had to re-order a larger size so her little toes aren't crunched.

review_title: Wonderful, cute shoe but sizing still off
review_body: This is a beautiful shoe for a great price, but the sizing is still off.  I measured my 3 year old's feet and went a half size up and they are way too small still.  Amazon is always great about exchanges thankfully, but kind of irritating for the sizes to be off that much.  I have ordered another size and I am hoping that works better.
my son runs his little tush off in these.  They are wide and come in HALF SIZES!!!!!  LOVE HALF SIZES!!!!!!

My 20 month old wear these and she wears them all day walking great. She loves the look of them too and loves to wear them. The shoes are quality made and look great in person. they are solid and sturdy. I ordered a 1/2 size up so she could wear them now and grow into them and she wears them with no problems.

review_title: easy to put in and out
review_body: Light, easy to put in and out, and reasonably priced. Can't find anything wrong with them.
Daughter is just getting into size 8, but had to order a whole size up...

review_title: ... yr old and I thought these would hold up better. They look awful less than 2 months later
review_body: I have an active 5 yr old and I thought these would hold up better. They look awful less than 2 months later. I love this brand for adult shoes but I'm not impressed with these.

review_title: Might be better if the velcro was longer
review_body: Nice shoes, I returned them because the velcro strap over the top seemed short. (Looked half closed on my toddlers foot - and she has normal feet, a more petite kid actually.)

I think this is the 4th pair of these I have purchased. We have never worn out a pair, only grown out of them, and my son is hard on shoes. They're great. My son has kinda wide feet so the Velcro is perfect.
We have received so many complements and she loves to stomp and run in these. I like these because they are lightweight and easy to put on.

review_title: Will buy more shoes like this as my son grows
review_body: Love the shoe for my little guy. His feet are a bit wide, and it fits perfectly. Snug but not too tight. Purchased for a trip in February to Disney and tried for a few days beforehand.

review_title: We love saucony shoes as my sons outside shoes
review_body: We love saucony shoes as my sons outside shoes. They are durable and seem to be comfortable for him. They are easy to get on and stay on!

My 3.5 year old is just outgrowing her size 8 shoes, 9 fits really well and can wear a 10 but they are a bit large. I ordered a 10w and hey fit great with enough room to grow in the toe that they should last all year. The strings tighten around to make the shoe more or less snug and the band sits nicely on the foot. Color is a perfect ballet pink. Very happy with the purchase.

It's slightly snug, but it fits exactly as it should. My daughter looks absolutely adorable in them.  And the elastic that sits at the bottom of the ankle allows the shoe to stay nice and stable, doesn't squeeze but is tight enough to keep her shoe from falling out of place.  They're beautiful shoes, the quality is spectacular and they really look like ballerina shoes.

review_title: Otherwise these are super cute and a really great price
review_body: Do not buy these shoes at the size your child is.. even in the stores tap and ballet shoes run one size and 1/2 smaller than actual size. My daughter wears a 6 and she took a 71/2 in both ballet and tap shoes. Otherwise these are super cute and a really great price.
Great quality. Great price
These shoes did not fit well.  Very wide and strap was too high on foot.  Ballet shoes are very difficult to buy without trying on..i would suggest trying on in store and then shop for price.
Good fit. Easy to get on & off
My daughter is 7 and I bought size 1 it fit perfectly

Great shoes! I purchased a 10 for my 3 yr old daughter who normally wears a 9, they were a little big, but not so big that she will trip. There is room to grow into them. Love the construction, the only issue is it is impossible to tell right from left.

review_title: Little great grand daughter just loved She dresses in her Tu ...
review_body: Fast delivery. Little great grand daughter just loved  She dresses in her Tu tu and slippers and dances away.
Granddaughter loved them!

review_title: Runs somewhat small, my daughter's size is a 12 ...
review_body: Runs somewhat small, my daughter's size is a 12 & she has narrow feet, I ordered a 12N but was small for her. Exchange was fast though & the 13.5N fits her well.

I ordered the same size that my daughter wears and they were way too small for her feet.  Unfortunately, I ordered them a month before her class started and didn't try them on until the week of her first ballet class and it was too late to return them.  They seem like they would be good quality, just very small.

review_title: quality seemed good. if they fit i would give them 4 ...
review_body: very small. had to return them.  quality seemed good.  if they fit i would give them 4 or 5 stars
My daughter needed pink ballet shoes for her Christmas program.  These were priced well and great quality! Will order this brand again!
Daughter and granddaughter loved the shoe.
I ordered these a size larger than my daughter's current size and they fit great.  If your child has a high instep, these are the ballet shoes you want.
just perfect.

These are fantastic little shoes for toddler dance. I bought them for my 3 year old, and they are sturdy and cute.  They seem to run very true to size.  She is a 9 1/2 right now.  I ordered her a 10 and they fit great with some room to grow.
I love these dance shoes. They look great and seem comfortable on my daughter. The quality is excellent and I would certainly buy them again.
These were pretty wide, but my daughter doesn't mind at all.  She is in a ballet class and can easily wear them for that and then all around the house afterwards.

These are perfect for my daughter's dance class - the teacher prefers they have the leather kind rather than the "slipper" ones sold @ Walmart.  The fit is great -- true to size -- they're comfortable, and the price was right.

review_title: Consider sizing up for growing feet...
review_body: Bought these for my daughter to size up from outgrown 13.5.  Bought 1.5 which were no longer than the 13.5 pair were.  As an aside I received 1.5 W when 1.5 M was ordered, not the end of the world since they didn't fit anyway.  If in doubt, I would order a size up.  These are a great product when they fit.
This is our third pair. My daughter (kindergarten) wears an 11-1/2 and has a VERY narrow foot. We bought her the 12N, fits her well (slightly large) with room to grow.

My daughter just outgrew her size 9 street shoes and is swimming in her size 10s.  I ordered the size 10 ballet shoe based on the sizing chart on the Capezio website, measuring her foot with a ruler, and measuring her at a shoe store.  When I received the size 10s, they were smaller than her size 9 street shoes when held sole to sole.  When I had her try them she said they hurt her toe.  I just exchanged for the size 11; I hope they work.
These were cute ballet shows but hated they didn't fit.

review_title: ... way to let it out -- but they are great shoes that I wish we could have worked with
review_body: bought for grandaughter to wear to wedding but elastic band too tight over fat foot & no way to let it out -- but they are great shoes that I wish we could have worked with 1
Very good price. Size was as I would expect, which was somewhat unfortunate since I ordered up a size based on reviews. Order the size you want. They are true to size.
The size chart is not very accurate for the item about 1 size smaller, and Amazon doesn't allow returns which were not told before purchase. Shoe is well made and nice for ballet.
sized per the instructions, works as expected
Perfect for my daughter's recital!  So glad I didn't have to schlepp her around to get them!

review_title: Shoes are good, while the sizes are confused
review_body: Shoes are good, while the sizes are confused. I printed out the size chart and my daughter's feet are 8 M. I got a pair of 8 M but the measure is just 7 M in the chart. I got another pair of 10 M and it's 9.5 M in size chart. So I need to get another of 9 M, but I could not know if this pair fits.
Couldn't get her our of these shoes.  Great shoes for a beginner.

if you're looking for a classic dance shoe for a toddler, these are the style you want.  buy up at least a full size... our daughter is in 8 and these in 9.5 fit perfectly.  I didn't get wide or narrow.

review_title: Ordered a half size larger than what she typically wears ...
review_body: Ordered a half size larger than what she typically wears and they are still rather snug on her foot, she will need a larger size very soon.
Their site says to buy 1 size up from shoe size. We ended up buying slightly larger than that, but the elastic strings allows us to pull it tight enough. This gives us some growing room!

review_title: My girl usually wears 6. 5N. I ordered ...
review_body: My girl usually wears 6.5N. I ordered the size and they were extremely small. So I had to return and get 7.5N to try. I did the samething for my 4 year old girl. She wears 10.5 N so I ordered11.5 but they were too big! The size is very inconsistent!  >:
This is the third year we have ordered these shoes. They work for us so we keep buying the best.

review_title: They fit great and stay on her foot really well
review_body: These shoes are just what we needed for ballet class. They fit great and stay on her foot really well.

review_title: Good quality, but to large for child intended.
review_body: Too large for child intended, was a gift.
They’re beautiful but run so small and I can’t return them!!!!

We wanted stylish, not-break-the-bank shoes for our daughter. These are adorable and well made. I love that they actually come in half sizes, so they fit her tiny feet.  She can get them on and off at 20 months, which is a plus. Also, the variety of colors is great. We'll likely get her the green ones when she outgrows these!

I bought these for my 2 year old daughter and they are a good color, the shade of green is not too masculine, and the fit is good. The velcro strap is easy for my daughter to do and they are comfortable for her to wear. I like that they've got a little style to accent any outfit of the week.

review_title: Whish they made these for adults
review_body: These are the best kids shoes to get on and off.
great quality - holding up well to frequent wear by my 3yo
Awesome school shoes for my son and they fit perfectly. This is the first pair I will repeat buy once he outgrows them (which is going to be soon)!....Toddler boys right!
My 3 year old loves them. I ordered half a size larger for room to grow,  but they fit more like 8.5.  It's snug to get his foot in.  Otherwise, very nice shoe.

review_title: ... than expected and difficult to get on but overall good for the price
review_body: These are a bit tighter than expected and difficult to get on but overall good for the price
This pair of sneakers are easy for a 3 years old to put on and off. The only complaint that I have is that they get dirty easily.
They are good sneakers.  Just too small.  Maybe my son had a growth spurt.

review_title: Cheap shoes but little boys destroy them.
review_body: My kids like these shoes but they don't withstand the rigors of the playground very well. The suede upper tends to look worn after a couple days. We are on the third pair and it's pretty consistent.

review_title: These rainboots are preschool perfect. My 4 year old can run
review_body: These rainboots are preschool perfect. My 4 year old can run, jump and play in these boots and put them on herself without issue. They are very lightweight and so much better than typical, clunky, heavy rainboots. 2 thumbs up all around. The hot pink is a great color too!
great boots for kids, easy to pull on and take off, sizes run a bit large but good for thick socks
Awesome shoe. Easy for my 3 yr old to put on by herself  Gets dirty easily but also easy to clean.
2nd year ordering these boots, my daughter likes wearing them and has never complained.

I got these for my 3y and 4.5y old and they love them.  They are very lightweight and easy for them to pull on. The kids went on a muddy 1.5 mile hike in them and they were very comfortable and great for stomping in muddy puddles.  I trust Croc quality and didn't want to risk getting another boot that might crack at the sole.  I don't worry with these.
What a gorgeous color! My granddaughter wouldn't take them off even though it was a sunny day. They're comfortable and fit just fine. Wish they came in size 4 for next year.

review_title: great for stomping in the mud
review_body: Fits well for our little guy, great for stomping in the mud.
Nice and lightweight. My son loves puddle jumping in these.

review_title: Cute rain boots for a tween girl.
review_body: It was really hard to find a pair of rain boots for my 9 year old daughter.

These have great support for my two-year-old son, come in great colors, and are reasonably priced. I do find that they run a bit smaller than other brands, so I go up a little bit to ensure they fit my son. We are on our third pair due to his growing feet and we'll likely keep ordering these for a few years!

review_title: These are great! My 3 year old loves them and had ...
review_body: These are great! My 3 year old loves them and had to show us how fast he can run in them. The true test will be how long they hold up against a 3 year old's activity level.

review_title: Nice colors and the Velcro is very strong
review_body: Really cute! We Got the pink and grey pair for 19 month old. Ordered size 6.5 toddler and they fit perfectly. Nice colors and the Velcro is very strong!

review_title: Perfect for just being a boy.... or girl
review_body: Fit very well and are consummately comfortable for an active little boy with very wide feet.
Awesome shoes for our Kindergartner.
Great sneaker for a toddler
Too narrow for my kids feet

review_title: Only lasted 3 weeks on a normally active toddler
review_body: I've been a fan of Saucony Jazz for my own running shoes which have lasted me years, but for my 15 mo son, 3 weeks into wearing these shoes, the toe seam one one shoe split wide open from poor construction. He's walking but not THAT active, and the shoes are the correct size on him. If there was a way I could return these for a refund, I would.

My son is convinced he is the flash when wearing these shoes.  He zips around the house bouncing off walls and tripping over the dog.  All in all a good thing.  They fit well and he's likes them.  I have some as well, though in blue, and he's excited that we match.

My busy toddler loves these shoes! We've only had them a week, so I can't tell how well they'll hold up, but they feel well made. They're easy to put on, and the way the velcro strap is designed, it's impossible to pull out of the side of the shoe, so you're not constantly re-threading it.
Run a little small but overall a great product.
These boots are perfect for a rainy day - my son loves these. And they look cute, too. Too bad they don't make these in adult sizes
These are great! Best qualiry boots I have tried for mt toddlers and they love them!
Fit perfectly and the handles help with my kiddo being able to put them on by herself!

I purchased these about 5 months ago for my then 1 1/2 year old son. He spends a lot of time outdoors at daycare, specifically doing gardening and playing in dirt, so I was looking for a good pair of boots to a. keep his feet dry, and b. keep him clean.

review_title: My 20 Month old Son LOVES THEM!
review_body: We needed a boot for our little man to run around our chicken coup in so we wouldn't have to wash his sneakers every time he walked in the coup. We bought him regular toddler rain boots from target, they were heavy, clunky, and too tall for his legs. So he never wore them because he couldn't walk in them.

Our grandson loves these boots.  He goes and plays in the grass and pasture and needs waterproof.  I only wish I would of gotten them one size bigger did not realize his feet had grown that much.  Oh well he will use them for now and pass them down to his smaller cousins....

review_title: Solid construction, great for the price.
review_body: These rain boots fit well, and kept her feet dry for a misty day at the pumpkin patch.
My daughter wears them everywhere, rain or shine!

review_title: Croc is always good quality and these are no exception.
review_body: Works for my little one on a rainy day. They are good quality and kept her feet dry during some snow ball fights. Fit is good and they are comfy.

review_title: Perfect for my daughter's elementary dance class
review_body: These ballet slippers were exactly what I was expecting and arrived just in time for my daughter's dance class. She loves the look of the white slippers.

We have two young daughters in ballet and they have only used Capezio Ballet shoes.  They are a very good quality shoe and we havn't had any problems with any of them.  The Dance studio we go to highly recommends these shoes and all the dancers there use them.
Bought these for my daughter forty years ago and remember wearing them myself!  Now, my granddaughters receive these from me for their dance classes and I think the quality is unsurpassed!
Perfect fit and great price for the beginning dancer!

I need to return these but do not have return info.  They have never been worn.  I got a size up from what she was using and they are still too small.  The size of the shoe did not change at all.  Can return label info be sent to me?

review_title: This shoe has no arch support to speak of as ...
review_body: This shoe has no arch support to speak of as they are ballerina shoes ...However ... My Grand Daughter LOVES LOVES LOVES them !
I have purchased about 4 pairs of these ballet shoes for my girls and they have all been great.  They are very flexible, hold-up well, and seem to be comfortable.  No complaints from my little ones.
Its a childs dance shoe.  Some of the choices not appropriate unless a full time dedicated dance student.  Typical Capezio.

review_title: Runs small, order one size larger
review_body: This brand does run small. I had read previous reviews that said to get a size bigger than your child's street shoe. My daughter wears an 8 Toddle and I ordered a 9. It fits with some wiggle room yet in the toes. You can pull the strings to tighten them though. Only complaint is the strings are long and the elastic material of the strings makes it difficult for the bow to stay tied (even when double knotted). Overall quality of the leather and the shoe is great
They are so perfect for our little ballerina!
Little one loves these shoes

My girls loved this shoe. Very bright and well made. They loved the color. They wear them all day long in daycare with no complaints. One of my girl's feet are slightly... pudgy? the Velcro works well to allow for her keep the shoe on without having to crank down all the way on the Velcro.
Super cute, fits well, and the Velcro is sturdy.

review_title: These have been great for my two year old
review_body: These have been great for my two year old.  He has long, skinny feet and the medium width work great.

review_title: Baby needs a new pair of shoes!
review_body: I love the fact that so many children's shoes now have Velcro.  Makes it easy to take them off for diaper changes, running around the playroom, and snugging them up for narrow feet.  These are well- made, the colors are classy, and the price was unbeatable!
my kid has fat feet, but most toddlers' feet are a little chunky. as usual buying shoes online can be a misadventure

Cute, but they don't fit my daughter's feet.  There is a pretty thick seam in the front upper part of the shoe (it must connect the tongue to the rest of the shoe) that really bothered her.  She said the shoes felt too tight, even though there was plenty of room for her toes.
I love these for my preschool age kids. They hold up well and are easy for them to put on themselves. The toddler sizes seem to run 1/2 size small. The little kids' sizes seem spot on.

review_title: Nice shoes for my little guy
review_body: Nice shoes for my little guy.  Purchased a full size up.  He does complain they are too tight if I cover all the velcro with the strap, but other than that, they are stylin'.

I bought these in a size 6.5 for my daughter who wears 5-6 (depending on brand). They are definitely big (I can feel a lot of space in front of her toe), but the Velcro straps help them to fit snugly and she has not been tripping at all.  And she loves the bright color scheme.  Great shoes!
Shoes are cute, our 2yo toddler wears 6.5w (stride rite) shoes.  We bought the same size for this purchase.  These shoes I think run a little small in comparison, but will still work for us

review_title: These shoes are super cute and seem to fit well
review_body: These shoes are super cute and seem to fit well. I am slightly disappointed that they immediately looked worn.
Best shoes ever! Easy for my daughter to put on and hold up very well.
These are so far my favorite kid shoes. Flexible support for new walkers and easy for mom to get on little feet
I purchase for my 2 year old son. He is pretty chunky and has wide feet. This is too narrow for him and the material is cheap, not well made. The design is cute though..

review_title: Super cute, but a bit pricey for kids shoes
review_body: Super cute, but a bit pricey for kids shoes. Regardless my daughter loves them and insists on wearing these every day over her other 200 pairs of shoes...;P
Sturdy, lightweight, and easy to get on and off a toddler. I will definitely buy them again as he grows!
Looks good but difficult to wear. There is not much opening. Runs small, my kid won't be able to wear it for long.

My son loves the fun colors of these shoes and this was our second pair as he grew out of the other ones. He wears them everywhere. They are easy to get on. I put them through the washer and dryer when they get muddy and they wash up perfect. We love these sneakers.
These shoes are really cute. They have a little sparkle in the material which adds a little flare. The huge positive too is that these are very easy for a toddler to get on and off by themselves.
They seem nice and well made but run very small. I order a half size larger than my daughter currently wears and could barely get them in her at all.

review_title: Good quality, but run a little small.
review_body: Shoes are great and pretty color, but they do run a little small.  I would order at least a half size to a whole size larger than you actually need.  Good quality shoe.  I would definitely recommend this product.
Great price, good fit.

review_title: I bought these for my 2 1/2 year old not ...
review_body: I bought these for my 2 1/2 year old not because she was in a class but because she likes to dance around the house. She loves them and wears them all of the time
Seemed like the target ballet slippers, way too loose around the top of my daughter's foot.
Sweet little ballet shoes.  My only complaint is that they seem to come untied quite often.

review_title: I want to order her new ones in exchange but ...
review_body: I want to order her new ones in exchange but I do no know how I would pick the correct size.  We went by the size shoe that she normally wears.

The slipper were beautiful and the quality was great, they just ran small.  I did find a local store and bought the 7.5 size which worked out great.  They were more expensive but I was not able to exchange on line.

I ordered true to my daughter's size and these were way too big!  They gaped on the sides even with tightening the bow as much as possible.  These looked cute and the quality seemed nice, but the sizing was way off.

review_title: Such a great shoe for the price!
review_body: Purchased for my 7 year old.  I usually purchase her a brand new pair of ballet shoes before the recital at the end of the year and these shoes are perfect.  This is her third year and these shoes would be perfect for the newbie or the seasoned dancer.  I would recommend these cute ballet shoes.
Looks nice and fit as expected. My daughter love it.

review_title: Best Boots for Puddle-Splashing!! Can I give Six Stars??
review_body: I admit I was heartbroken when I went to Target and learned that the Hunter boots for toddlers had sold out within an hour of stocking. Well. . . thank goodness they were! These Crocs boots are absolutely perfect.
Best rain boots ever

BOY does my 3 year old son love these!! He often chooses to wear them outside to play on nice days. They fit great, are worth the price and are what I expected from Croc regarding quality. I will purchase again.

My daughter wears these every single day. These are so much better than regular rain boots because they are so light. She can slip them on herself and can easily run around in them. We will be buying another pair once she grows out of this pair.
Perfect

I really wanted to love these but my son could not get his foot in them. He doesn't have a particularly wide feet and he's owned plenty of rain boots in the past. I also bought these in pink for my daughter and she had the same problem. It seems as if the lower part of the shaft is not wide enough for their feet to slide into the base of the boot.

Love these boots!!!  Love the bright, yellow color, they go on so easily - my just-turned-3 yr old slips them right on, and he seems to be fine wearing them with or without socks.  My son hates having anything on his feet so they must be comfortable.

review_title: Lightweight, easy to walk in, easy to clean boots for my toddler
review_body: My kid lived in these last fall, winter, and spring (in a very rainy climate). Just replacing with a larger size for this year!

review_title: they are adorable on him and i love that they are easy ...
review_body: my son loves these!  he just turned 2 and can even put them on himself!  they are adorable on him and i love that they are easy on/off, lightweight and a cute solid color.  he's in a size 7 sneaker now but we kept the size 8 boot for him and they stay on his feet great.
We love this brand of shoe and bought two different colors.
Thank you! Gorgeous shoe!

review_title: The velcro makes it easy for her to get the shoes on and off
review_body: We were looking for a pair of running shoes for our preschooler, and these fit the bill quite well.  The velcro makes it easy for her to get the shoes on and off, and she can fun in them for long periods of time.  She has a high instep, so the top of the velcro flap doesn't exactly cover the bottom part, but otherwise the shoe fits great.

review_title: So cute. Order up a half size
review_body: So cute. Order up a half size
Perfect shoe! These are not wide, nor narrow, they tighten to fit individual, have great insole and tread, and they're awesome colors for children!

review_title: Too narrow but otherwise really cute.
review_body: Great looking shoes but simply too narrow. They fit length wise but when putting them on, we could barely close the velcro. Too bad, really cute otherwise. Had to return.

review_title: My 5 year old is very happy with these
review_body: My 5 year old is very happy with these.  The velcro makes it easy for her to put them on by herself.
We've bought this shoe for multiple growth spurts. Sturdy and stylish.
Very cute, love the ease of the Velcro and they're light weight. Ordered a size 5 for my 15-month old and they fit great with a little room in the toes.

3rd pair of these shoes.  We've also had multiple friends buy these after they saw my son's.  They are now on 2nd or 3rd pairs too!  Great for preschool ages!!!!!  Comfortable and children can put them on by themselves.

review_title: So nice. easy for my boys to put on and ...
review_body: So nice.easy for my boys to put on and take off by there selfs and so light for them to run around in !!!
We love our Croc boots! They don't have the liner, so they are perfect for making messes and easy clean up. We LOVE!
no smell.  Flexible
My kids love them. Comfortable, lightweight and durable.

review_title: The best rain boots for toddlers like to play in water
review_body: The best rain boots for toddlers like to play in water. Even if water goes in, it is easy to dry these out than those with linings inside. The daycare teachers recommended these and they are worth it!
My three year old loves them and I love how lightweight and colorful they are :)

review_title: and light enough that they don't fall off all the time like most kids' rain boots
review_body: So cute, and light enough that they don't fall off all the time like most kids' rain boots.
Great boots! So lightweight!
perfecto

review_title: Totally recommend. Perfect rain boot for a toddler.
review_body: When I was looking to order a pair of rain boots for my three-year-old, I was concerned that they may be too tight, too stiff or difficult to put on. I decided to go with the crocs based on other reviews. I ordered half a size up (my son is 8.5W in all other shoes, so I got 9 for these). I am AMAZED how wonderful these boots are. They fit perfectly! They are so light and soft - my son loves them; and he really is not a shoe person; as a matter of fact, he usually freaks out when I buy him new shoes. He's the type of a kid who gets used to one pair and will not wear another pair until I throw the first ones out. It's not the case with the crocs though, because as soon as they came in, he put them on all by himself and wanted to wear them that same day even though it was bedtime and not raining. They are perfect and cute. I really didn't expect it from a pair of rain boots. We will definitely go with the same brand for as long as we can.
Runs small.

review_title: 5 comfortable in girl's shoes) and the 1
review_body: Slighlty big (She wears 1/ 1.5 comfortable in girl's shoes) and the 1.5 of these are just ever so slightly big. They'll work though, and are very soft.
Very good quality.
I had read the product reviiews beforehand and was disappointed at how terribly small the shoes ran! Good thing is, when I required a refund, they didn't require the item returned.

Capezio impresses again, we have been buying dance apparel and shoes from capezio for years and the quality is outstanding.  These should be ordered TRUE TO SIZE for a correct fit.  However if you want a little grow room you can easily order 1/2 size larger because they have an adjustable elastic band.  I would not order larger than that since a sloppy ill fitted shoe is difficult for little ones to dance in.

review_title: These are not very comfortable. My 2 year old loooves wearing ballet flats ...
review_body: These are not very comfortable. My 2 year old loooves wearing ballet flats but when she put these on... she wanted them off.

review_title: Good product, but sizes run small
review_body: These are really nice ballet shoes. The only problem I had was the size. my daughter wore a size 6 when we purchased the shoes and when we put them on her they were really tight. They came from "Santa" so we could not return them, which was unfortunate. So if you purchase these you may want to buy them a little big.
Love these! Was so happy to find them. They were great for my daughters ballet class!

review_title: Not sure if W will be better.
review_body: The width of M is really narrow for my daughter who always wear M. Not sure if W will be better.

We only have one ballet store in town, and its hours are quite odd. So having the ability to order our Capezio shoes online through Amazon is a true gift! These shoes wear wonderfully and fit comfortably as expected.

Crocs rain boots are great for the toddler. He tries to get them on and has managed to walk around with them on the wrong foot. They don't seem to breath but I expected this much. I would recommend them for the price.
My grandson loves these !!!
My son loves this bright green color. The quality is also good

Love these. Super lightweight, unlike most other rain boots, which is great because my 19 m.o. can actually walk (and run) in these. Easy to take on and off too. Will buy again as he needs larger sizes.
Strongly recommend this boots for toddler. Super light weight and durable material!

My son loves his new rain boots and even asks to wear them at home. They seem to be super comfortable, not at all difficult to put on, and he can walk really well in them. I'm not a fan of the regular crocs shoes because I've heard they can be dangerous on escalators, but these are great!!
Great quality and super light. My 3 year old son loves them.

Bought these for my chunky toddler. They are great! Easy for me to help get on and off, they seem to fit really well - maybe slightly narrow, but not bad (Most rain boots are so skinny). I decided to get a size bigger just because, and I'm glad I did. They are roomy, not hug, and measure up to the same size as the snow boots we have, that are a size smaller. My only comment is that they seem to be warm. Slightly sweaty sock feet after they are done being worn.
Great boots! My little guy loves them. Cute and comfortable

review_title: ... son and this was the first time he didn't love them. He only wore them a handful of ...
review_body: We've purchased multiple pairs of Croc boots for my son and this was the first time he didn't love them. He only wore them a handful of times before saying they hurt his feet.

review_title: The Velcro is a little tight on wide little feet ...
review_body: The Velcro is a little tight on wide little feet, but it straps okay. It's hard for my 2.5 year old to strap them himself too because of the double strap.
They are good but don't have a lot of arch support. Bought cuz it easy for my toddler to put them on and ale them off.
good sneaker, comfortable and fits as expected, my 3 year old son loves them. he's been wearing them for 3 months now and no signs of tear, they hold up pretty good.
My two year old wouldn't wear :( I loved them though!
Love these shoes!  Super cute and stylish.
These are just adorable. I bought them too big, so kiddo has a hard time walking in them. Once he grows into them/gains better balance, these will no doubt be a staple in his wardrobe.

review_title: They say wide but I don't think they are. ...
review_body: They say wide but I don't think they are. If you child has wide feet they will not close all the way and the open for the foot will be very tight.
Absolutely adorable and durable!

My daughter, a new walker, loves these adorable sneakers. She can't tell us if they're comfortable or not, but she's eager to wear them and usually gets angry when we take them off, so I assume they are. They're fairly easy to put on and seem well made. We'll continue to purchase this style as she grows.

review_title: These sneakers are adorable but be forewarned
review_body: These sneakers are adorable but be forewarned: the glitter scuffs off really easily.  My daughter has had these for under a month and the toes are glitter-less.
very nice

review_title: Street size fit and great quality
review_body: Another vote for street size fit! Great Capezio quality. Toddler loves them. Only wish I didn't have to deal with the long laces all the time but they're necessary if you want them to fit like a glove.
Wish they made this shoes for the bigger a little older girls.  Mine is 11 and they just don't make it in her size anymore.
Good quality

review_title: Always love Capezio slippers for my little ballerina
review_body: Always love Capezio slippers for my little ballerina. Great quality but I ordered the narrow and these were wider than the ones I normally buy her in the studio.
They run about a full size too small, length wise. Other than that, they are great, and my daughter loves to dance in them!
Great quality.
my granddaughter love them
Cute but they do run very small. I had to get a full size up. Tight may be standard with a ballet shoe but for a toddler, it's not comfortable.

My daughter is a 10/10.5 normal toddler shoe size.  These are perfect for immediate use.  The band across the top keeps the shoe on well.  It is a little wide, but not enough that I'm worried about it falling off.  She can grow into it a little as the shoe is used and stretches.
Love these! My toddler wants to wear them all the time!

review_title: Good things when he go outside play rainy days
review_body: Good things when he go outside play rainy days! It's not slide than I think he like it and wear it to school the first day !

review_title: These are so cute. I wish the top of ...
review_body: These are so cute. I wish the top of the boot was a little looser though. It fits in the foot but looks tight on her calf.

I have a pair of these for both my 18 month old and my 4 year old, and they are awesome!  They seem to be pretty comfortable, and are great for the snow when paired with thick socks. Very happy with them.
Great for children to romp around in- very lightweight and durable!  Great for camping too!

We've been having some rain lately and my 3yr old has been asking for rain boots to splash about in the puddles.  I originally went to the local store looking for some, but they are currently out of season, so I turned to Amazon.  I wanted something simple and easy to get on for my son.  My son has a gross motor delay and even though he's made huge strides and walks quite well now, his gross motor is still behind.  He does not do well in heavy shoes, so I had some trepidations about rain boots in general.  I was sold on the Crocs when another reviewer noted how light they are.  They are Very Light, especially compared to the typical toddler rain boots.  My son has no trouble walking in them.  He's got little fat feet and typically wears a wide shoes, so Crocs roomy fit worked well for him.  The big handles on the boot make it easy for him to put them on himself....an added plus.  They are made with typical Croc material, thus making them easy to clean.  My son was very happy with his new yellow boots.

These are FABULOUS...just like Peppa Pig's! Baby couldn't be more thrilled and neither could her mom (well, except for that one meltdown when she wouldn't let baby wear them to bed...). they fit as expected, were delivered in no time, and are of typical indestructible Crocs quality
good product second pair due to child growth

They are all you would expect from Crocs - ultra lightweight, soft, and loved by kids! My 2.5 year old put them on right away and went ahead on jumping. This tells me that even though I bought him almost a size bigger what he now wears, they are comfortable and light enough that he is able to move around easily. This is unlike regular, more bulky rain boots he has, which are much harder to pack when we travel. The color sea blue is not as bright as pictured, but rather what you can see on Crocs website, which is what I wanted. Great buy for the price. Highly recommended.
None
My daughter uses a size 71/2 shoe and I bought a size 71/2 it was too small I'm ordering a size 9 because the show is made of great quality.

review_title: Good but order 1 size up from actual shoe size

I ordered crocs Size 8 and its fitted well for my child who wear size 7.5 for stride rite.  He loves to run in it.  Easy to put on and removed.

I think these are just as durable as Stride Rite and New Balance and just as stylish.  I found them to be true to size on my son's average width feet.

review_title: if only they were true to size

I bought these for my 3 year old for a tiny tots ballet class. After reading the reviews, I had no idea what size to buy, because some say buy a full size bigger, some say half size bigger, and Capezio says to start with the street shoe size. I just had my daughter's feet measured at Stride Rite less than a week before ordering these slippers. They measured her feet at a 9, so I bought her 9.5 shoes. Going with the size up recommendation, I ordered these in a 10.5. I didn't want them to be too small, and I wanted a little extra room so she could get more wear out of them. The length is fine, with a little extra room. However, the slippers seem quite wide (I ordered regular width, my daughter doesn't have narrow or wide feet). Even after tightening the strings (which did help quite a bit), there seems to be extra room. It's not enough of a problem for me to send them back; I think they'll work fine for her class. The quality does seem good, and the color was what I expected (ballet pink, not really pink). Overall, I'm happy with this purchase.

I have very small wrists, so most "adult" watches don't fit.  This one was both easy to read and comfortable - not to mention colorful and fun.  I purchased it for our trip, because I wanted a watch I could both wear and attach to my bag.  This one fit the bill, and when the trip was over I could let my grandchildren use it too.  They love to wear "Grandmas" watch.  The band is easily adjusted so it can fit their little wrists.  The extra numbers counting the minutes also helps them tell the time easily.

Easy to read the clock face and clearly marked hours and minutes. We bought 3 different 'time teacher' watches for our grandchildren (who can read a digital clock fairly well but have no idea how to read a traditional clockface). This watch made it easy to show them how to read hours and minutes.

According to that, I was supposed to order an 8, however they are a bit small. I would recommend going up a half size from what is suggested on the size chart. They will work in the short term but I will be ordering at least a half size up if not a full size very soon. In the mean time I used my hair dryer to soften the shoe and stretch it out a bit so her toes weren't so cramped.

review_title: Great shoes for the price, but don't go extra Wide, unless you are a giant
review_body: My 3 year old daughter has rather wide feet her size 9 ballet shoes were getting too short and they had always been a bit snug in the width, leaving an elastic impression over her foot for an hour after class.  When it was time to move to a 10 for length, I decided to go wide (W), hoping they would offer just a little extra give.  They are a LOT more wide than the standard shoe.  The shoe itself is almost 1 inch wider and then the elastic band has a HUGE amount of strapping.  These are for extremely wide feet, not just little flintstone feet like my daughter has.  She has always worn wide shoes, like Striderite WIDES, Crocs, etc. but these are too wide.  They might work for some, but I would not order these without trying on.  The other standard (non-wide) 9's fit okay, so I didn't think trying on was necessary.  I was wrong.  The difference in 1 shoes size and W, feels like about 3 sizes too big.

They have been in perfect condition to pass down to the next kid even when worn and played in hard almost daily Fall-Spring! All other rain boots we've tried are just to clunky and heavy for my kids to wear all the time.  They do seem to run small so I always buy a size bigger.  With other rain boots that's another thing you can't do is buy them too big.  The size doesn't actually seem to matter so much, as long as they aren't too small they are perfect.  We are loving these and she doesn't seem to trip in these like other crocs.

review_title: Ordered a size up, shoe area fine, ankle shaft too tight
review_body: These seemed softer on the inside than the outside (which is made of the same regular Croc material. However, we ordered a size up and the shaft of the boot seems to be pressing against my daughter's ankle bone. She complained it only hurt when she walked (which of course necessitates that it be returned), but that it was roomy enough in the toe box and rest of the foot area. My daughter is generally skinny for the size of clothes she wears, so I can't believe her ankle is larger than normal for her foot size. In fact she has wide feet, thus the reason we ordered a size up, and I'm surprised the ankles are the issue. I'm disappointed as the kids love their Classic Crocs and this seemed like a slam dunk for rain boots.

review_title: very weird fit, hard to get on
review_body: I thought I loved these when we first got them for my toddler boy, but as time has gone on I've decided I'll never order more for either of my kids. Here's why. Very strange fit: toe box is wide & boot is actually quite clunky-looking, but it's SO impossibly hard to get on!!! Harder than any rain boot I've ever seen. Part of that might be the grippy Crocs material, different than typical slick rubber boot material. I knew from reviews that these ran super-small, so when my toddler's foot was a sz. 4, I ordered sz. 6 for him and was pretty happy with the fit. He is a very tiny 23-month old (5%) with small, slender feet for his age. He's worn these boots for about 6-8 months and is just pushing into a sz. 5 now, so it's time to move up a size anyway, but these are just so hard to get on that I will never re-order. I'm back to traditional rain boots!! The pluses are that these are very lightweight, cute, kind of unique, and they do seem 100% waterproof because of the molded design (no real seams).

He normally wears a 5 but I bought a 6 for him so he has room to grow.  It fit him great and he doesn't seem to have a problem with the extra sizing. Overall, I'm satisfied!

It seemed a waste for event specific (i.e. rain) shoes to only get a handful of uses before being outgrown. I was worried that they would be too big. They seem true to size, because they are, indeed, about one size large. She seems to be totally comfortable in them though and was running around with no issues. Looks like we will be getting much more use out of these than I expected, as she's all about wearing them with or without rain.

My son has gone through two pairs of vinyl rain boots because he wears them nearly every day (they crack and break after enough wear and tear)  These boots are flexible enough that they don't crack and comfortable enough for him to wear every single day. Even if the handles do break, the boots will still be use-able, whereas if the vinyl rain boots crack they take on water and his feet get cold.  When he outgrows this pair I'll get a bigger size of the same thing.

I got these for my 2 year old son to use for splashing in puddles this spring. He has low muscle tone and is still not the greatest walker, so I was attracted to these since they are lightweight and more fitted, so I thought they would be more comfortable and easy to walk in than the usual clunky rain boots. This seems to be true- he likes wearing them. They also fit closer to the leg than typical rain boots, which I think adds to the comfort. He wears ankle-foot orthotics and these are too tight to wear over the orthotics, but obviously this wouldn't be an issue for most people. We got the blue, which is very cute and less purplish than it looks in the photo.

review_title: Best shoes for kids! And we've tried several!
review_body: I absolutely LOVE these demi-point ballet shoes from Capezio! My 7 yr-old daughter wears a size 2.5 youth. We had bought the ABT shoes from Payless when she was younger, but as her foot has grown, the sizing of ABT got odd--the shoe itself was longer, but extremely narrow. We went up a whole size, and while the shoes were longer, they were IMPOSSIBLE to get on. I remembered one pair of these Capezios we had bought a year ago, and decided to purchase again, but in the wide width. The leather is so soft and supple, and they are not *too* wide, either. The drawstring gives a perfect fit. Also, the elastic is nice and wide and soft--doesn't bunch up into a painful rope across the foot like some brands do! (My daughter does not wear wide width in regular shoes, by the way, in case that can help with sizing for you.) Highly recommend!

review_title: Perfect gym shoe for the busy and active toddler , no complaints with these shoes at all!!
review_body: Saucony has great Athletic shoes for the whole family. I purchased a pair for myself and they were so comfortable that I bought my toddler a pair ! he grew out them but he wore these shoes everywhere! They are sporty looking and retro , very cute . They went with every outfit he had this summer . I had to hide them from him in order to get rid of them because they were to small  after his last growth spurt. I will buy him a new pair of these again , he usually prefers sandals or nothing over a pair of gym shoes....not this pair though . These were the closest thing to a gold bar for him. I recommend these to anyone with toddlers, as well the adult gym shoes are great too! You cannot go wrong with this brand. I will say you should probably spray them with suede protector but they are going to get worn down by kids no matter what protectant you try. My 6 year old son now wants a pair too and he prefers Under Amour gym shoes usually!
These are the best shoes for toddlers! Durable, long lasting, and comfortable.

review_title: The sizing issues make it REALLY NOT WORTH IT
review_body: I ordered these despite all of the other reviews about sizing problems. I checked the Capezio website and the sizing charts indicate to order the child's regular street size. Further, I've returned things through Amazon before and for some reason was SURE that I wouldn't have to pay to exchange if they were still the wrong size. Well, they arrived and despite my double-checking the brand's size charts, they're way too small! And Amazon wants to charge $5 to ship them back. So really, don't be like me and think you did your homework and you'll be fine. Buy them in store. Major Amazon FAIL.

review_title: comfortable, easy to put on & great active shoe for toddlers
review_body: Best shoe for active little girls.  I have 2 toddlers who love these shoes.  As they grow out of a pair, I replace them with a larger size.  I'm always happy with Saucony.

Saucony Jazz shoes are our go-to sneaker. They are just the best shoes for an active kid. My daughter is 3.5 and has been wearing this brand and style since she was one and learning to walk. They are easy to put on, they open up wide to let the foot slip in easily. The velcro closure is easy and secure. My kid can now put them on by herself, which she loves to do. They last a long time, that is, until she outgrows them. And on top of all that they are SO CUTE. I love the bright purple version and this time wanted to try the yellow. I know it says "boys", but that's ridiculous. These are super cool KID shoes and both boys and girls can wear whatever color they want. The yellow color is very bright and she LOVES them. Surprisingly, they go with a lot of her clothes and she gets tons of compliments. I do dress her in a lot of black, white and grey with some pastel and neutral tones so these just pop on her little feet. Very cute and fun shoes!
My 3 year old loves these shoes.  They fit well and the sole is more flexible than many other kid shoes.

They are flexible enough and light so he could walk really well with them. The only reason he doesn't wear them anymore is because he grew out of them! Striderite sells them in their stores, so they are definitely good shoes for little walkers!

review_title: This watch works great but has some flaws
review_body: This watch was just okay for me.  Although it is quite cute and the watch works fine, I actually have a few complaints about it.  First, the letters and numbers are so small that I question how much the watch is 'teaching'.  My daughter is 7, so she has already learned basic time skills, so it works for her.  The reason I purchased the watch was the elastic band.  The idea was good, but the execution was just okay.  The watch has a buckle of sorts so you can adjust the band size, but nothing keeps the watch "tightened" when she wears it.  It is always slipping off as she wears it, so I am going to have to sew some Velcro into the watch to keep in in place.

Way too wide, even pulling the strings tight, but I thought the length might not give her enough room to grow. Next I ordered a size 11M. Also way too big. I finally ordered both a size 10 and 10.5M and the 10s fit with room to grow and are still a tad wide. I think her true size, 9.5, would have fit just right.

She always outgrows them before they wear out. I have never had to buy her another pair of the same size. The stretchy band is perfect for contouring them to her size and you just cut off the extra string with scissors. They are comfortable and stretchy. She loves dancing in them and wants to wear them all the time but I already explained to her that they are only for class and recitals. The soles and toes do not wear out even though my daughter dances all over the place and sometimes drags her feet on the floor of the ballet class. My daughter has a slightly wide foot so I can adjust these fit to her feet perfectly.

These shoes are durable, adorable, and sturdy for an active toddler. They have held up very well to LOTS of wear and cleaning. They are soft, easy to put on, and the Velcro is a plus! My son has narrow feet and these shoes are almost not wide enough. They work, and they fit, but I could have ordered a wider width and half size larger for him to grow into. This is our third pair of these sneakers and I highly recommend - just order a half to full size up (depending on your needs).

He did play with them in a pea gravel pile (small brown rocks like on a playground). They did stain (just like anything would in pea gravel). But over time the stain wore off. They are not easy to find. I will probably order a size larger for next year to have in the closet.

Turns out they're better than his tennis shoes.  And he loves the bright yellow color!  Now I need to teach him to pull them on himself because they have those handy straps on the side!

My daughters toes are right at the shoe edge so I see me having to buy another pair in a couple of months maybe sooner. I'd say I wish I got a bigger size but like I said; any bigger and the width would have been to big. My daughter is only 16 months and I got these for a little baby ballet class she's in, so it's really not that big deal. Although their fit is a bit off from a normal shoe size they are SO cute and she has been prancing around since I put them on so I still give it 4 stars!

Good

Our daughter needed some boots for camp. She wears Crocs all the time so we purchased these pretty blue boots sure they would be as comfortable as her everyday wear. They rubbed blisters on her foot, so of course she wore socks and the boots were okay. After camp, we tossed the boots in the car and did some traveling. When we unpacked,we found the boots had shrunk. The top of both boots were less than half the original size and the shoes had warped. I never thought boots would melt!

Though this is a great rain boot, I was a bit disappointed when I saw silver scuffs in two different places on both the left and right boot. My 3 year old loves the design, but as a mom I wished it was properly scrutinized before packaging because it would be impossible, now that she has already seen the boots, to take it away from her. :-(
Love it

We purchased these blue Croc boots for our 16-month-old granddaughter. They are her first rain boots. They are easy to put on (but they stay on!), she can carry them around by herself, and they've been utterly satisfying puddle-stompers. We're hopeful that they will also last through the summer. A very satisfying purchase so far!

We have had these for about 6 months now, and they are still holding up great! No cracks in the sides and since there's no liner it's not a big deal if they get wet on the inside. I just shove a towel in and dry it out. Finally I found boots that can stand up to my active kids!

I think they are adorable, but after a few times of my boys wearing them, they show wear more easily than some of their other shoes.  We normally buy Stride Rite brand shoes, and we have also had good luck with Crocs.  They fit a little on the large side, for us at least.  They were a very good price, but I do not think I'd purchase them again, just because I find the quality to be lacking.

review_body: I LOVE these boots and so does my 4 year old!  Anyone with an opinionated preschooler will tell you what a big deal that is! She can easily put them on by herself (thanks to the built in handles) and they are cute! We got them in Fuschia, and they look great with her multi-colored raincoat and just about all of her clothes.  She gets tons of compliments on them too.  Oh, and they are so lightweight! I guess that's to be expected, since they are Crocs, but all other rain boots are so heavy, these are lightweight and easy to run/walk in all day long. We had 2 pairs of the Croc Jaunt rain boots in the past, and they are virtually indestructible.  When my daughter outgrew them, they still looked brand new after months and months of heavy use.  When this style came out and it was time to size up again, I didn't hesitate (I really like the updated style without the holes in the side that the Jaunts had.) So far, we're thrilled with them.

review_title: Great Watch for a Young Girl
review_body: We gave this watch to our six-year-old girl once she had learned how to tell time.  For about two weeks, she would not take it off except at bath time (it is waterproof).  The wristband is easy to operate and has been dependable for us so far (we have had it for about a month); the band will loosen over time, so we do need to cinch it up occasionally.  The watch is attractive and keeps time accurately.  It ticks softly every second, which I think is a good way of learning about the passage of time.  There is a little flower that moves with the second hand -- very cute.  There are two rows of numbers around the watch -- one set of the 1 to 12 numbers and also an outer set of 5 to 60 (by fives).  This second set of numbers is what makes it so helpful for 'watch learners.'  I highly recommend it!

Living just south of Seattle rainboots are a MUST for my kids. My son recently turned 2 years old and I could not find a decent pair of rainboots for the life of me. The typical rainboots you see at Wal-Mart or Target have a heavy sole and my son didn't like to wear them (he had a difficult time running around in them). After doing some research and going through the customer reviews I decided to go with these Croc rainboots. Anyone who knows me knows that I am not a Croc advocate as I think they are hideous (sorry, just my opinion) however, these rainboots are cute, simple, lightweight, durable, and perfect for wide-footed toddlers!! My son LOVES them. As another person has already mentioned about their child, my son never wants to take them off! They are super easy for him to get on as well. I would recommend these rainboots to anyone and plan on getting them for my daughter when she starts walking as well. Great buy!

review_title: The Only Rain Boot I'll Buy From Now On!
review_body: I'd give these ten stars if I could!  They are hands down the BEST rain boots I've ever bought.  I just wish they had them in bigger sizes for our older children!  The only thing I don't understand is why everyone says they fit small.  I'd say they fit about right on to a tiny bit big if anything.  I have bought two pairs and plan to get a third pair for my other child.  They can pull them on by themselves with, with eight children is a HUGE deal!  They are sturdy, (other pairs of only slightly less expensive rain boots don't even last a full season,) and they keep their feet dry.  I love these!  Please make them in larger sizes!

review_title: They both love them. After reading the reviews I purchased a ...
review_body: I purchased the fuchsia ones for both of my girls...  They both love them.  After reading the reviews I purchased a size 10 for my little one who currently wears a size 8 1/2 wide.  They were way too large.  We went into the store to exchange them and tried on the size 9 and they were still too big.  The size 8 fits with some room to grow.  I don't think they'll fit her next year but the size 9 was over 1 inch too large.  My 2 year old wears these all day long.  I would suggest wearing socks for a few days to break them in and to prevent blisters.  My 8 year old wears a size 1 so I bought a size 3 for her.  They are huge on her and I probably should have exchanged them for a size 2 but she does like them and they don't make her feet look overly large.  She's been wearing them for a few days and doesn't seem to mind that they're too big.  She says they're comfortable.  It's been raining here for a couple of days so these have been wonderful and they are super cute!

review_title: but once in they are pretty roomy. I'd order a size up in these ...
review_body: These run about a size small, but it's mostly in the ankle area of the boot. My girls have average girly feet, and they really have to push their foot down and pull up on the 'handles' to get their foot in, but once in they are pretty roomy. I'd order a size up in these though if you are considering them.

review_title: I understand the not so good reviews
review_body: I read a lot of the comments before buying these boots and a common complaint was that the boots were too tight at the ankle which caused blistering or skin to just completely peel off. When I got to the store I noticed the boots weren't lined with a chafe resistant fabric like most rain boots I've seen and figured that if put my daughter in with no socks or socks that don't give her complete coverage that obviously the friction between her skin and boot would cause issues. So what I did was put on thick knee high socks and long pants over her socks so that there was enough cotton cushioning between her and the boot and no chance of skin contact. After 3 hours playing at a farm I took the boots off and sure enough there were blisters beginning to form just underneath her inner ankle bone on both feet. I think these boots are adorable and my 2 year old daughter loves them but in my opinion they aren't meant to be worn for hours of play. Just from point a to point b. Maybe a little longer.

I bought this for my six-year old daughter and it lasted three days. OH! and the first time she wore it in the pool, it filled with water. Extremely disappointing for a Timex product. My daughter has been begging for a watch but I guess I'll keep looking...

This is a cute pink and purple watch for a child.  Two features seem new from previous models we have bought.  One, the clasp.  It isn't Velcro and it isn't a clip - rather it's a metal clasp that holds the strap together.  Basically this is now a slip-on watch. Adjust it once, then slip it on and off.  Two. The hands on the face.  It does have a seconds hand to show seconds, but includes a ill-placed butterfly 45 degrees off of it.  For a child learning to tell time, seeing 4 hands versus two or three is incredibly confusing.  Lose the butterfly! It's not necessary and makes teaching kids to tell time that much harder.  I'm very 'pro' non-digital watches...please make learn-to-tell-time watches easier to learn.
arrived with a dead battery. granddaughter can not use the watch until we get her a new one. she lives quite a distance from us and so it may be a while. she is very sad.

review_title: Cute first watch for tiny wrists
review_body: This is a just okay little watch for a young child learning to tell time. The face is quite small - I could barely read the minutes/seconds count (every 5 minutes). The hour numbers were larger but an odd green font that is harder to see, so this is not ideal for learning to tell time despite the "minute" and "hour" labels on the hands.

review_title: Scratches easily, but repairs easily too
review_body: Very cute and whimsical while also easy to read with hour hands and hour numerals color coded and minutes hand and minutes numeral color coded. Elastic band adjusts easily while off and then stretches to fit over hand and into place. We have had it for 3 days and one day it did loosen as other reviewers have stated.

review_title: So many good ideas ruined by too much "cute" and a hard to use band
review_body: This is a cute "learn to tell time" watch.  However, having bought a lot of these over the years, it's not my favorite.  First, the band is not velcro but rather a single loop buckle.  It is not secure and keeps slipping out.  I can't figure out why Timex didn't just use a velcro loop here like their other watches.  Also, the second hand has a little butterfly which follows it around.  The butterfly is so big it can easily obscure the hour hand.  For a kid learning to tell time, this is a constant distraction.  Every 45 seconds you can't see the hour hand.  Adults can figure it out, but little kids?  Also, the minute labelings are a good idea, but are impossibly small and hard to read.

I really like this watch, I do, but the band and the mechanism to "latch" (for lack of better words) does not work together. After just one day of wearing, my baby girl came home from school looking for a scissors to trim the part that was reeling off the band. The latch also makes it pretty difficult to put on with one hand for a 7yrs old. I had difficulties putting it on for her because of that closure, not sure why wouldn't it have been made with the regular way to secure other watches. My daughter also liked the watch, had her reading time within the 1st hrs of trying it on. Because of the end result after just one wear, she didn't even look at it this morning to put on. I'll just have to return it, no need to have it here gathering dust.

review_title: UNACCEPTABLE! Watch Battery Was Running, NOT OFF!!!
review_body: NO NO NO. I cannot believe this! The battery was running! I've had this watch for yrs BUT I always pulled the battery out. The little silver ribbed button on the right. HOW DO I RETURN THIS?? I don't want it to die quickly. How I've missed it. But I won't pay for something which is used. NO NO NO. Watches should NEVER be running. SO not cool!!
