review_body: These are great for my little ballerina. The hardest part is getting her to take them off when we leave dance class.

I absolutely love these boots for my 2.5 year old. I purchased a size 7 in Sea Blue through the Prime Now app. I was hesitant with the color since a couple previous posters said the color leaned more towards periwinkle/purple. However when they arrived they were exactly the shade of blue I was hoping for.

review_title: Chunky, soft plastic rips after a few months
review_body: We bought these to replace a pair of red shiny rain boots my son wore nonstop for over a year. They were $10 at Kmart. These are definitely a chunkier style than traditional rainboots. Not my favorite, but that's just a personal preference. The 3 stars is because 5 months later these much more expensive boots are actually ripping. My son for sure is not easy on them, but if Kmart can handle it, Crocs should DEFINITELY be able to.

I have really liked these boots for my 5 year old son. They are easy enough for him to slip on and off and they are very light weight. My son has to wear them with socks or they will give him blisters. We bought them too big so he could grow into them and also because I read reviews that they run small. Even though the foot bed was large, the tighter ankle made them stay on his feet just fine. We went through an entire season without any issues. This season, I realized that sharp sticks or a nail : ( can go through the bottoms fairly easily and make them not waterproof anymore. Just something to consider as you're looking for footwear. Overall though, these have been great boots. We bought a smaller pair for my 2 year old and it's a little harder to get the smaller foot into the boot, but they still go on without too much fuss and he loves them.

review_title: I love the color and that it is not heavy or ...
review_body: My little one is a shoe size 8 and I got a size 9 and it fits and still has room for socks. My little one  has seen the Peppa Pig episodes and whenever we come to a puddle wants to jump in. When I got these boots my little one said "Like Peppa!" and wanted to play in the rain during the next thunderstorm! I love the color and that it is not heavy or clunky. My little one can even put the boots on without any help.

review_title: These a great boots thus far and I'm sure I'd order them ...
review_body: I just ordered a pair for each of my kids. I wanted something that will be versatile in rain and snow. I got a size up from what they usually wear, so they can wear thick socks underneath and they will be able to use them longer. My 3 year old usually wears a 9, and my 1 year old wears a 5, so I got size 10 and 6. They have a little room, but not so much that they have a hard time walking.

review_title: seem to run true to size
review_body: My daughter wears a toddler 7.5 - 8. I ordered these in a 10 after reading reviews that they run small and are narrow around the ankle. I saw people mention getting them up to 4 sizes bigger and having these boots still work so I thought I'd be safe with 2 sizes up. They are great boots but seem true to size to me. The 10s are huge on her and she steps right out of them. I'm going to keep them to grow into because I got them for a great price and now the price is higher but I'm also going to purchase a pair in size 8 so she can actually wear them now. Love that they are super light weight!

We love Crocs in our household. I decided to purchase these for my 6 year old son this year for the upcoming rainy season. I love that they are lightweight. We also love the handles which make it easy for him to put on and off. Crocs are easy to throw in the wash or you can use disinfectant wipes to clean scuffs. This is a nice true blue and doesn't look purple at all.

I purchased these for my very active two year old. I wanted a rain boot that was light weight, had no seams (to prevent leaking at the toe), and handles for my toddler to be able to pull them on herself.  I'm so glad I bought these! She's been wearing them everyday since we recieved them. They weigh less than her sneakers and she can easily pull them on and take them off. We've had one day of rain since receiving them and they worked wonderfully: her feet stayed dry and warm and they didn't slip while she ran around on wet cement. I definitely recommend!

This are the best rain boots out there for kids. Light weight, keep dry, very comfortable. I bought a hot pink one at Marshalls for my daughter and she loooovvveeeeddd them, she loved them to the point of wearing them daily. Now that she has outgrew them, I need a new pair as she keep going to them even thou they don't fit. These are amazing and I will be buying them for my nephews as well. Highly highly recommed.
I love them because they are lightweight, durable, comfortable, and WASHABLE! I'll never go back to buying heavy and clunky rain boots again.

This watch is exactly what my young, active preschooler needed.  The watch runs on battery and never needs winding.  The elastic strap will fit a wide variety of wrist sizes and adults can easily adjust the wristband for the child.  It's not waterproof, but it is water resistant.  My daughter accidentally worn it into the bath before she remembered to take it off.  It still keeps time.  For the price I paid (less than $10), I couldn't ask for a better watch for my preschooler.

review_title: Cute watch for kids.  Stopped working-replaced battery and still not working
review_body: My 9 year old Daughter loved this watch and especially the easy to remove and put on band.  Nice cute "look", Second hand etc.

I originally began researching time teaching watches for my son, but decided to also get one for my younger 6 year old daughter. Doesn't hurt to get them to learn earlier, right? The design is very cute, but best of all, it is very practical for learning how to tell time. She is not yet able to add on counting when the minute hand is not exactly on a face number like 3 or 6, but at least she can tell time to the closest time. I strongly feel that getting kids a face watch to learn to tell time is much better than getting them a digital watch until they learn how to tell time using a face watch. The design is also cool enough to wear as she grows older. I deducted a point only because the face of the watch is plastic and it scratches very easily. Her brother loves his watch too and has the camouflage version.

My daughter received this as a gift 3 months ago and continues to love it and use it as much as the first day. I love that it has helpful time reading features like labeling the minute and hour hand and the face also says "past" and "to" next to the minutes that it would be appropriate to use those terms with. I was sceptical of the elastic band at first, but in reality, it makes the watch extremely comfortable. My daughter only takes her watch off to bathe. Even then, she forgets to take it off occasionally and the water resistance has worked perfectly. The band has gotten kind of fuzzed up and doesn't look as nice as it once did, but it is a small price to pay for a watch much loved by its owner. Although the clasp seems kind of rinky-dink, it has never failed on us. I would by it as a gift or replacement in a heart beat
This purchased as a gift for my  grand niece for her 7 year old b-d.  She is a first grader and learning to tell time.  Her mother indicated to me that she loves it and loves practicing telling time.
Got this for my 5 yr old G-G-granddaughter and she loves it . . . learning to  tell time . . .

review_title: Would have been better off spending more in the first place though
review_body: Just purchased this for my daughters birthday. Opened it up and the battery is dead!!  I’ll take it and have the battery changed instead of returning it at this point since she really wants to wear it. Would have been better off spending more in the first place though.

My two year old Grand Daughter Olivia (she turns three April 2nd.) has been asking for a watch for many months now. Most of the kids watches have plastic bands you buckle. Further, most bands are too big, as she has the tiniest of arms. This watch has a stretchable cloth band that fits her perfectly and is easy to take on and off. All in all I am quite pleased with the product. It is a little pricey for a three year old, but if yours is as responsible as mine it is worth it. We created a treasure box in her dresser, where she keeps precious things that need to be safeguarded. So when she gets this watch it already has a safe home, when not on her wrist.

review_title: So far it's great. My 3 year old granddaughter got her cast ...
review_body: So far it's great. My 3 year old granddaughter got her cast off today(daycare) and I gave her this watch. It fits her tiny wrist and we will test it in the pool today. Update to follow

Very cute watch for a girl. Looks just like the photo. Good quality and easy on and off for kids. I agree with one of the reviewers that the minutes counting backward by 5s on the left side of the watch is odd. My three year old won't know the difference but it can confuse those ready to learn or who all ready know how to tell time. Purchased a digital Timex elastic band watch for my son a year ago and his is still going strong with no issues so I expect this to hold up as well. Overall, a good buy.
Happy wth this item
Looks good
Very comfortable and light sneaker shoe. My daughter loves it.
The material felt very plastic and cheap. Not the quality I was expecting from Saucony.
My son loved these shoes
Love these except the inner foam insert comes out too easily.
Great comfortable and stylish shoes for my toddler

review_title: But i love the way they look
review_body: These are very cute, but run about a size and half too small. I had to exchange for the correct size. But i love the way they look.
If you need a nine get a half or a ten. These fit a bit small but they are great.
Excellent bargain for these shoes!  Easy on and off for my 20month old and they look and fit great!

Very soft, a good quality product. The size would be just one size over street size. Based on the previous posts I ordered two size larger but found out when shoes arrived it's a bit of big to my little ones feet.
My daughter was thrilled when these came in the mail! They're a perfect size because they fit, and she has room to grow. Great quality and color.
Not even close to the correct size. Tuns maybe 2 sizes too small.

This is a great ballet shoe, however I found the shoe to fit a little big.  I had a nine for my three year old that were getting very snug, and thought that I'd be safe with a size 10, but a 9.5 would have been a much better fit.

review_title: Great Purchase- Be careful with sizing
review_body: So glad I bought these and read the reviews! My daughter is 27 months and usually wears a bit smaller than a size 7 street shoe. I bought a 8M and they are slightly big, but just how I wanted them.  I would highly recommend these!

review_title: Great fit for your little ballerina!
review_body: Love these ballet shoes for little girls! Came fitting true to size but if they are a bit big the bow is actually a draw string, which was nice! So if unsure of the fit go a half size bigger and tighten them with the draw string!
Ordered these for my daughter and I read the reviews. I went up a size and they were still way too small. Amazon was awesome about returning them.
Shoes fit and the quality is good.

review_title: My granddaughter wears a size 6 but they are not ...
review_body: My granddaughter wears a size 6 but they are not true to size. They were way too small. Sending it back!!
I bought these for my daughter's first ballet class.  They are cute, easy to put on, durable, true to size, and shipped quickly.

review_title: They are so easy for him to get on and off all by ...
review_body: my 3 year LOVES these boots! I bought the next size up which worked out perfectly!!!! They are so easy for him to get on and off all by himself and he wants to wear them all the time. Will definitely buy another pair once he outgrows these.

My 15 months old loves them. They must be comfy, given he was happy to wear them for a long time and had no problem doing his ususl actions - walking, running,climbing, etc. The size seems slightly smaller than clog styles but not  hugely different. I would still recommend ordering these one size bigger than usual crocs the child wears. The yellow colour is exquisitely adorable and i especially like how light the boots are.

Love these boots because they're seamless, so there are no worries about leaky seams or linings separating. They also came highly recommended by other moms and preschool teachers. They do definitely run small. My daughter is a 7.5 so I usually go with an 8 for a bit of room to grow/room for thick socks. I got these in an 8 and there was no room at all. Exchanged them for a 9.

review_title: Design obviously not tested on actual toddlers'.
review_body: Ankle opening is so small, could not get my kid's foot in the boot. Otherwise it would have fit fine.

Love these boots for my 16 month old! We have the Cerulean Blue and they are dark blue.  My son wears a size 5 in most shoes, 6c in Nike, so we went with the 6. He has a wide, chubby foot so the boot shaft is a little tricky to get his foot in (minus 1 star) but once they are on, they are perfect with a little room to grow.

review_title: They are easy to put on
review_body: My 3yo loves these. They are easy to put on, light, and not boxy the way some rain boots are, so they don't slow him down at all. Unlike most rain boots, the insides are easy to wipe dry because they aren't insulated. I am all for function over fashion, but these boots look great too! Win-win! Oh and shipping was quick-we live in ak and they came sooner than expected.

review_title: Easy to put on for toddlers!
review_body: My 2 year old son LOVES these. He refuses to wear anything else- his sneakers are collecting dust as are his snowboots. He loves them because they are his favorite color- blue and he can step into the and pull them on himself. He’s been wearing them daily since September! Purchasing a new pair in a bigger size now bc it’s all he will wear!
THESE DO RUN SOMEWHAT SMALL....... SIZE UP ATLEAST ONE SIZE UNLESS YOU LIKE BUYING BOOTS QUITE OFTEN.

My sons loves these boots.  I bought them to replace the Bogs I purchased for him. The Bogs were way too short and they take FOREVER to dry once wet.  These dry fast and are very comfortable.  He has no problem walking in them or splashing puddles with them. :)

review_title: Truly disappointing as they loved how comfortable they were
review_body: I bought 2 pairs of these for my children and within a week both had broken the "handle" pulling them on. Truly disappointing as they loved how comfortable they were. I also have to say that these seem to be of a less sturdy plastic then the crocs Jaunt.

review_title: Perfect for a 6 year old girl!
review_body: I bought this for my first grade granddaughter.  She absolutely loves it.  It is cute and is keeping time well.  She had no trouble seeing the marks and quickly picked up on reading it.  She has only had it a week, so I can't speak to the durability but the price is right for a six year old.

review_title: This is a beautiful watch for a girl and perfect for one who ...
review_body: This is a beautiful watch for a girl and perfect for one who is just learning to tell time. It's the best I have seen so far...especially if purple is her favorite color.

My kids really love the Timex Kids' Time Teacher watches - we have one with a purple monkey stretch band and one with a blue band with cars and trucks.  We looked around for the longest time before finding these watches - our kids wanted watches, but we really struggled to find simple, inexpensive analog kids' watches (you'd think it would be pretty simple!).

review_title: Perfect watch for kids and Fun too!
review_body: We have one of these Timex themed watches for each of our kids.  We love these watches because they are good-looking and fun to watch the picture go around the face of the watch.  But more importantly, as a parent, I really like these watches because the hour and minute hand are color coordinated with the numbers on the watch face, and the minute numbers are shown in counts of five.  It makes learning how to read an analog watch much easier and fun for kids.  It's proven to be durable and has a warranty in case your kid loses it (I know because it happened to one of our kids).  I would highly recommend this watch and not get any other for a kid.

review_title: The best Analog Watch for Children!
review_body: Purchased this for my Granddaughter for Christmas. Wanted a watch that was Analog but wasn't so obvious that it would make her self conscious. She loved it. Only wears it for special occasions! Very difficult to find and an Analog that has style and educational attributes. Don't hesitate. Buy it now for Birthdays, special occasions or simply as a way to teach in style.

My kids really love the Timex Kids' Time Teacher watches - we have one with a purple monkey stretch band and one with a blue band with cars and trucks.  We looked around for the longest time before finding these watches - our kids wanted watches, but we really struggled to find simple, inexpensive analog kids' watches (you'd think it would be pretty simple!).

My daughter wore this watch for one day and the band is frayed 1/2 an inch. I'm so unhappy with quality of this and because we purchased it ahead of time and waited to give it to her until the first day of school as a gift, it's too late to return it. 100% dissatisfied with this product.

review_title: but I really like this cute watch
review_body: I'm not a kid, but I really like this cute watch.  I have a small wrist, so it's a good fit. It is also easy to read, with all numbers showing. My only issue is the buckle. A regular buckle would be easier to fasten than the pull-through one it has.
Got for granddaughter, her color is purple, so glad I found this, she loves it

review_title: My daughter loves to wear the watch, it is ...
review_body: My daughter loves to wear the watch, it is obviously not the top quality but it is what you paid for.
My daughter wears these daily! Super comfortable and easy to put on! We love Saucony! We all wear them! Must buy!
Look great
Cute & durable at first but Velcro only lasts about 2 weeks of wear. Bought Puma crib shoes instead.
Love these
These shoes are a great casual shoe that is light weight and supportive. They seem to go with everything in my sons wardrobe pretty well too.
Good quality,beautiful!
Bought for my Grandson, they fit and he likes to wear them
Easy to put on and fasten
great toddler style
Great shoe for toddlers!

review_title: I will buy again and again!
review_body: I found these for my 3 kids, ages 1, 4, and 7. They always want to wear them, they are perfect in the rain and mud. They are super light and wash right off. Love love love! I need to buy some for myself.

For toddlers, crocs are the best shoes, so when we needed a pair of rain boots, my first thought was crocs. Therefore, I don't really have a point of comparison, but who cares because these boots are perfect. They are super lightweight. I have looked at boots at Wal-mart and Target and they are very heavy. I could see my 20-month having trouble running around in them. Also, they can be hosed off after playing in the mud and rain. Another thing is that they fit well but are still easy to put on. I have rain boots that will come off when you get stuck in mud. Not these! Since they are so easy to put on, I can set them up and my 20-month can out them on herself. She feels pretty cool about this. My only piece of advice is to order the size your child actually wears because they run a little big, just like the rest of the crocs shoes.

review_title: Perfect fit for thicker legged toddlers!
review_body: I love these boots for my daughter! She has larger calves like me and rain boots are hard to find a good fit. These for perfect with leggings or skinny jeans and the handles are easy for her to pull her own boots on. She's 2.5 and very independent, so it's always a plus when she can do something on her own. These boots don't dull or fade and are so easy to clean. Love them! I'll continue to buy as my daughter grows.

These are great so far! Our 3-year-old can put them on himself, which makes him feel really good and means there is one less thing for us to do in the mornings during the rush to get out the door for school. They are adorable boots and fit well. Very happy with them.

I'm so in love with these rain boots! I got them for my three year old daughter in pink. I did get two sizes up just so she can have them for awhile. She walks well in them and can pull them on and off easily. The best part is how easy these are to clean. The boot is good material and good support for a toddler running around outside the garden and water play.

The candy pink color is exactly the same as pictured. Super cute for anyone who likes pink ! The size chart is correct, I ordered a 13 little kid for my 3.5 yr old a she has a bigger shoe size for her age, and they fit her just fine. They are really light, havnt used them long enough to comment on durability, but for the price of $20 they are a steal! Other brands were in the range of $25-$35, and they tend to be quite bulky. These are perfect!!
Daughter loves them and she has wide feet. We did order up a 1/2 size.
My son loves these and wouldn't take them off
my son LOVED this! wish he didn't grow so quickly though :(
My son loves them. Keeps the water out and fit well.
Just as described; order one size up from regular shoe size

Great watch for kids--just wish it had Indiglo (would be 5 stars then).  My 7 yo is currently using it and has improved her analog watch reading skills with it.  Starting to teach our 4.5 yo old with it as well.
Cute little watch for kids to learn to tell time on. Priced right for the rough and tumble ones!

review_title: Great first watch for an 8 year old!
review_body: My 8 year old daughter absolutely LOVES this watch and wears it all the time. The adjustable band is great, and the having both the hours and minutes written in colors that coordinate with hour and minute hands makes it easy for her to tell the time. Also, price was great, so if tragedy befalls the watch it will not be a big deal to replace.

review_title: nice toy, but not a watch
review_body: It looks beautiful and my daughter loves it. But if it can't tell current time accurately, then it is a piece of worthless crap. Ours is off by one minute per day.  Are you kidding me? Kids may be too young to understand, but I do.  No wonder they do not publish accuracy figures in the spec. For $15, should do much better than this.
Granddaughter loved it.  Gave it to her for Christmas....she wore it everyday until it quit in May, lasted 5 months.  A new battery did not fix it.
Excellent quality my daughter loves it

This is the best shoe I've tried yet for my 15 month old.  It fits well and is easy to get on and off with the Velcro.  He rarely slips in these shoes because they have quality sticky rubber soles.  Not to mention they are really cute.  I'm going to go buy another pair now.

style is very cute.  I ordered for my 4-year old daughter, and she is petit.  The shoe size I ordered is what I would normally order for her, but the actual shoes are way too small. I like the style and color.

Size - ordered 1.5x size up from normal street shoe size, not too big, elastic ties help to gather the shoe around the top of the foot, would definitely buy next size when grown out of these. Very well made,soft and look good on to!

review_title: Good little ballet slipper for toddlers
review_body: Cute and functional! Good little ballet slipper for toddlers.

Great shoe very cute. True to size and good quality  My 2 yr old lives them. She wears a 6.5. The first pair I ordered were (6.5) fit just right so I returned and ordered a 7. That was perfect with just a little room to grow.
These shoes are darling but I need girls or womens in a 5.  I would  like to have size 5 in womens if you have any.  I had to change sizes because I already got a 6.5 in ladies for one grandaughter.

the Capezio Little Kid/big Kid Daisy Ballet shoes are very nicely made. The sizes run a hair small, so order about 1/2 size larger than shoe size. I ordered 2 sizes,not knowing which would fit from previous reviews.I ordered 1/2 size and 1 full size larger than her current shoe size. This worked to my advantage as my child is still growing and out grew the first pair within the first 2 weeks, so we were able to use both pairs, just not for very long with a growing kid. The product is worth the money in my opinion as they are well made.  And according to our Ballet teacher, they were also properly made, with the strap in the correct place.

It is well made. The wrist band is elastic and adjustable like the straps of a backpack, so you can create the perfect fit you kid. It has the Indiglo light, which my daughter loves. It lights up like mommy's. It is water resistant, which is a good things since kids are bound to get it wet. It is also very easy to set the time on it as well.
My great granddaughter won't take it off - she was so excited !!

review_title: Nice watch at a great price.
review_body: I ordered two of these watches for christmas presents. They came packaged well and are even cuter in person. They look to be well made and perfect for beginners

review_title: Will help my granddaughter to tell time better. I trust that since its a Timex
review_body: Cute watch for the price.  Will help my granddaughter to tell time better.  I trust that since its a Timex, it will last awhile.
Excellent quality!  The band is made of stretchy, comfortable fabric.  In about a year, the colors on the wristband start to fade, but aside from that, this watch has made me nothing except happy!

Since my granddaughter is learning to tell time, I got this for her for her pre-K graduation. Being this is a Timex, I know it is well made and will last.  It is so cute, adjustable strap, even glows in the dark, easy to read, set time,etc. It is a must have item and a great teaching tool now for when she starts kindergarten this summer.
Daughter had been asking for a watch.  Decided to go with this for her 7th birthday instead of some digital watch.  She absolutely loved it and it definitely is helping her learn to tell time.
Great for kids trying to tell time!

review_title: My little niece wore this watch for one day before ...
review_body: My little niece wore this watch for one day before the band broke.  She was really upset.
So cute! My 20 month old loves them! Wouldn't take them off the first day they arrived. Great price, too

they were too small cuz the shoes were the wrong style and gender!

These shoes fit as expected and my two-year old loves them.  I also think she will easily learn how to take off/put on her own shoes since they have velcro.  Great for playgrounds!
Third pair for our two and a half year old granddaughter. Fit well and wear well.

review_title: The color posted was more pink and the actual shoe ...
review_body: The color posted was more pink and the actual shoe was a purple color. Luckily my daughter loves both pink and purple, so it wasn't a big problem.
I like it very much
Comfortable and colors look just like the image (ordered the grey pink and yellow).

This is our 4th pair!  We've had these shoes since we started walking.  Very durable.  We've moved up a size and will order the navy and the camo blue.  Would love to see these in green too.  Thanks for these classic shoes!

review_title: Great boots. Just buy them already.
review_body: Awesome. Lightweight, he can get them on himself, keeps the water and mud out. Will continue to size up and buy these for my boys as they grow.

review_title: Great lightweight and truly waterproof boots
review_body: My 22 month old boy loves these ! Lightweight boots that are easy to walk in - important for those still toddling.  Worked great in rainy Seattle. Socks and legs stayed dry.  Will also be easy for son to put on himself.

review_title: They are very easy to put on and stay on his feet well
review_body: These are the most lightweight rain boots I have ever come across. My son is a size 7 and after reading other reviews, I ordered a size 10 for him. They fit really well with only a little room to spare so I would definitely size up. They are very easy to put on and stay on his feet well.
heavy duty and EASY to get on:)

review_title: These are by far the best rain boots
review_body: These are by far the best rain boots.  We are purchasing our third pair, my son has literally worn them daily for the past year.  They hold up much better than standard rain boots and are extremely easy to put on and take off.  They hold up to serious wear and tear.

My son loves these boots. Had to return a pair of size toddler 6. The right boot was visibly  smaller and wouldn't go on. Amazon let me return them and I ordered a new pair. My two year old can put them on by himself! And the handles seem sturdy compared to the other common brand. Thanks amazon and crocs!

Love these new boots - our three year old just got them for Christmas. They stay on her feet while running, climbing and swinging. Her other rain boots fall off as soon as she tries to run or stomp. We thought this would be a great watch to help our child learn how to tell time. It's cute, has a nice soft fabric band and interesting graphics that help her understand time. Unfortunately it has a few problems. First off, the plastic crystal became very scratched in a week. It was almost impossible to tell the time. Secondly, everything is tiny and hard to read. And last, the band, though soft and elastic, doesn't stay very well on the clasp. There just seems no way to secure it well, without doing something permanent.

I got this little watch for my birthday. I had it for about a year, then it got lost. I got a replacement watch that was the exact same. I've had my new watch for about 2 years. I have not needed to replace the battery. The strap is very comfortable and colorful. It will adjust to any size wrist. The face is smallish, but easy to read for kids learning to tell time. The face got a little scrached from rubbing up against the wall, but other than that, it's a great watch! Little girls of all ages will love it. Just watch out for walls.

review_title: Smelled weird after being stored in a small bag

When I opened her shoe bag the other day, I noticed a very strong chemical type smell coming off the leather. This smell wasn't obvious when we first got the shoes, and while she wore them. I think these shoes might be offgassing? I've never had that happen with dance shoes before. I think we may switch to a pair of canvas shoes instead.

review_title: Not a great first watch for a child.
review_body: We purchased the Timex Children's Heart and Butterfly watch for our 5 year old daughter for Christmas.  For a watch claiming to help children learn to tell time, the face and numbers are quite small and hard to see.  The face is plastic, which became scratched the first time she wore it. Which leads me to the clasp...there is no way to adjust this watch for a small wrist.  It is way too big for a 5 year old, and I had to sew it together to make it fit her wrist.  The cheap metal clasp does not adjust....so keep that in mind!

I thought I could "break them in" for a couple of days by working to stretch out the hole that your foot goes in, but this was a waste of time. This shoe is so stiff that my daughter can't even put it on without hurting her fingers as she's trying to get the shoe on. Once the shoe is on, it's fits well and is comfortable. However, I will never buy this brand of shoe again due to the difficulty of actually getting it on.

My son is not quite 3, so he immediately jumped into a puddle with them. We washed and dried them with no issues. I will likely buy another pair of the same shoes in the next size up, since it's so hard to find wide shoes for little guys.

review_title: Great ballet shoe for my tiny dancer
review_body: We originally purchased these in a specialty dance shop.  When it came time for the next size, Amazon's price was awesome.  My 4-year old's feet are narrow, and these were a perfect fit (we got the Narrow style).  You can tighten them a little by pulling and tying the string, and the elastic band that goes over the top of her foot isn't too tight or too loose.  The shoe holds up great, the color is nice (we have pink), and my little ballerina loves them!  You usually can't go wrong with Capezio dance products.  Make sure you try them on in a local store before purchasin, so that you get the correct size & don't waste money on shipping a return.

I feel firmly that she needs to have a thin and pliable sole so that the muscles in her feet can develop naturally and not form her foot to a stiff sole in a regular shoe. These shoes have been awesome, we have them in three colors, wear them to church, the playground, on errands, everywhere. I will buy them over and over again.

review_title: Great shoe, but seems to be sized small.
review_body: I bought these for my 2-year-old for her first trial dance class. She normally wears a size smaller than her sister, whose current ballet shoes (by Bloch) are a size 7, but since her sister's were professionally sized and she's been able to where them for over a year, I ordered these in a size 7 as well. Although they fit and worked well for the one class, they were quite a bit smaller than I had expected. She asks to wear them around the house when practicing with her sister and overall I would say I'm satisfied with the shoe, especially for the price. I would suggest going up a size or two when ordering, however.

The sizing on these shoes is insanely frustrating. I have now ordered and returned these twice and will not be ordering again. The first pair was so small I couldn't even get it on my daughter's foot; the second pair was so large she would have tripped over the extra space in the toes. The size chart provided here is useless, and the list of sizes available doesn't seem to be in any real order, making it very confusing as to what size to pick if you're trying to order up - i.e. what's the smallest "little kid" size after the toddler sizes? I would not purchase these shoes unless you can fit them in person. Why the sizes cannot correspond with the sizes of child street shoes is beyond me.

review_title: Good but not great toddler shoes
review_body: These are great shoes. Seem to be well constructed and sturdy.  Very please for the price paid.  The low sole height and light weight helped our 14 month old walking without drastic difference from being bare foot.  The 1/2 size increments are exactly what he needed. The only complaint, if any, is the internal shoe height.  Although they strap up, they are at the the very end.  I would think every toddler around this age and size would have somewhat chubby feet.  My child is 50 percentile in weight and height so I never thought this would be even close to an issue.  Maybe he has tall or thick feet. Buying the W instead of the M may be the way to go.

review_body: received these, 2 pair for my girls who are starting dance, way too small.  REtuned both pairs in the same box and only received a refund for one pair.  Very upset and dissapointed.

review_title: Always come untied but well made shoe
review_body: These are simple and well made ballet shoes however they always come untied which is not ideal when dancing.
Sizing is tricky. Order at least a full size larger.
These fit like a size 7 on my toddler who wears a size 8 1\2 !  She

The quality of these shoes are nice and I think that they will last a while. There was some confusion about which size to order and I wish that I would have just followed the sizing guide provided. In regular shoes my daughter wears about a 10.5 and I ordered her a 12 for these ballet shoes, which is too big.  I did measure her feet though and they are about 6.25 inches. Have I had followed the sizing guide I would have gotten her an 11 which would have fit perfectly. No biggie though. The elastic bow tie, that is pictured, is not just for looks it actually tightens the shoe around the foot.
Well constructed and fit great.
Great shoe! We buy another pair with each growth spurt
Great shoe! My daughter loves them and worth the money.

review_title: Great Shoes for a 5 yr old boy!
review_body: My boy loves them.  He wears them everyday to school.  Easy to put on.  That's a plus for me.  He's 5 yrs old.

review_title: My almost three year old loves these! They fit ...
review_body: My almost three year old loves these!  They fit her feet well and she is excited to put them on.

review_title: ... cute on my son and go on and off easily.
review_body: These shoes are cute on my son and go on and off easily.
My son is a 7.  I ordered a 7.5 and they were too small.  Great shoes just add about a 1.5 sizes to get what you want.
My daughter's favorite color is yellow. Can't beat the price.
Comfortable and great retro style.

Love the style and fit. Had these for my daughter before and liked them. Glad to find a good color for my son. Only thing is my son must have fat feet or the shoe fits a little snug. We can't completely close the Velcro strap. Would buy them again, though

review_title: I really wanted to love these shoes for my son
review_body: I really wanted to love these shoes for my son.  The colors are nice, and the retro-ish design is very sleek.  However, they are very narrow on my son's normal-width feet, the velcro closure could only come across half way.  Even my son said that they were tight.  He ended up picking a Stride Rite pair instead, which was the same size. I initially thought that maybe my son has wide feet (though he never had to wear wide shoes in other brands), then one day at the playground, I saw another little girl wearing the same pair of shoes, and the velcro closure could not close all the way either.
too small, too narrow
Would not fit my granddaughter. Looked like doll shoes.

review_title: Perfect for our little flower girls
review_body: Just as expected! Perfect for our little flower girls!
Great

review_title: My daughter wears a size 7/8, and this dress ...
review_body: My daughter wears a size 7/8, and this dress in an 8 was HUGE on her. Definitely order a size or two down!! She couldn't even wear it.
Again too small have to give them away.
I had order 7.5 because all of my daughters other shoes fit at 7.5 but these ballet shoes.  I had to reorder size 8's.  I had to reorder!

review_title: The slipper itself is nice and feels like good quality materials
review_body: Should have listened to others reviews. I am returning and ordering a size and a half bigger. The slipper itself is nice and feels like good quality materials

THIS BRAND IS HORRIBLE.  I ORDERED AN 11m, WAY TOO BIG, ORDERED 10 1/2 m WAY TOO SMALL, ORDERED 11n THEY ARE A 1/2 INCH SHORTER THAN THE 11M, ABSOLUTELY NO RHYME OR REASON BEHIND THE SIZING. COST 15.00 TO SHIP THEM ALL BACK AND I STILL DON'T HAVE A PAIR OF SHOES FOR MY DAUGHTER!

review_title: Size down and you should be good.
review_body: These do run bigger than normal shoe sizes. Size down and you should be good.
These are great sneakers, my son has had several pairs.
Daughter in law said they are are like a size 4 instead of a 2, which they are marked.!!!!!÷÷
Cheep.
Sweet kicks for my little dude!

review_title: ... son loves the color and seems to find them comfortable.
review_body: My son loves the color and seems to find them comfortable.
Love these shoes but needed to buy another size up. My son will only be able to wear them for about a month.
Great fit easy on and off
good very good
My son loves this shoes.
love them !!!

These are really great shoes.  As other have said, though, make sure to order BIG.  My daughter's regular shoes are a 10.5W and I ordered a size 12W in these.  They fit with just a little room to spare.
great quality ballet shoe! love this brand.
Great!
We got a different brand than capezio.
My three year old grandson decided he didn't want to take dance lessons afterall.  His two year sister is showing him up for sure.  She loves her dance lessons.
about bs entire size too small

review_title: A little on the small side
review_body: I purchased these for my grand daughter when she starts ballet classes.  While they arrived quickly (Prime), I was disappointed to see that they JUST fit her even though we ordered them a size bigger and extra wide.  I guess the Chinese have smaller feet??  Yes, I pick on the Chinese,,,,,, for good reason.
it was sort of difficult to put them on my son at the beginning.
Love them
cute and my boy walks easily in them without tripping.
Great shoe for our 3 year old

Really like them.
How much can be replaced?
Nice and easy

This pic is after a month of wearing them nearly every day.  She is very active, so the shoes have logged a lot of miles on the playground. Daughter fell in love with these pink sparkly shoes. I think she thought they had super powers to help her run faster.  She wears them nearly everyday and have held up pretty well considering she does things like dragging her feet while biking. As a result, some of the glitter on the toes has worn away but you have to be really looking to notice it.
i choose this sneakers because they are comfortale, however i have to return i ordered the wrong size still in same style and color.
Did not fit. Way too small.
I was very happy with them. They are made well and fit true to size.
Great
My daughter love these shoes!
Perfect
nope i would get again
It's ok
Perfect

I read most of the reviews carefully before ordering. I wanted to make sure I had the right fit. My daughter is three and wears a toddler size 8. She also has a pretty wide foot, so it was nice that this shoe came in a wide option. I ordered one up from street size as recommended. I went with a toddler 9 wide and it fit great with just a little bit of room for growth.  This shoe is great quality and affordable!

My 3 year old daughter wears a size 7 in toddler shoes.  Because of my years of dance, I know that ballet shoe sizes are usually not the same as street shoe sizes.  We don't have a dance store within an hour driving distance from our home, so I had to order all of her dance supplies online.  Because of this, I measured her foot 3 times to make sure that I got the correct measurement.  Both feet were just under 5.5 inches long.  When I looked at the size chart for this shoe, the length of her foot matched with a size 7.  I know that some brands have converted their sizes to match street shoe sizes, so I thought that maybe Capezio had done the same.  Wanting to be on the safe side, I ordered a half size bigger - a 7.5, thinking she'd grow into them if they were too big.  When they came, I could NOT believe it.  There is NO WAY that someone with a 5.5 inch long foot could wear a size 7.5.  Absolutely NO WAY.  I'd say that she probably could have fit her foot in a 7.5 back when she was wearing a street size 4.  That is a BIG difference.  She was so disappointed, and so was I.  It would cost almost $6 just to return them, even though they shipped for free and weigh almost nothing, so I have kept them for my younger daughter to grow into.  Now I'm trying to find the time to drive 2 hours to the nearest dance store to get her a pair that actually fits since there is no way to tell for sure what size she is based on the size guide provided.

So we ordered these shoes, but they aren't the ones that came. The ones that came were blue and yellow with mock laces. Extremely disappointed in the quality in these shoes. My five year old has worn them for less than two weeks and the Velcro doesn't hold like it should and they are already falling apart. Extremely disappointed!

review_title: Very, very stiff shoe.  Makes walking difficult.
review_body: These shoes look great and seem to be well built.  Unfortunately, they seem to be as stiff as plastic ski boots.  Even hiking boots with a steel shank often seem more flexible than these shoes.  So although my daughter likes how they look, she doesn't like wearing these shoes.
Cost performance high

My one year was not walking but I knew he was ready to start. I seen these shoes on the site and I thought they fit his personality and they looked very comfortable and I knew that if I put them on his feet, he would walk. Shipping was very fast, I got the shoes and showed them to him. We put them on his feet and he took off. Now he pulls down everything that he can reach.  Thanks a lot!
A little big

review_title: Doesn't fit my phone. I must have ordered wrong
review_body: Very cute and I love it ..problem is it doesn't fit
Darling shoe. Fit was too small, sent back.

Perfect first shoes!!! They fit babies feet just right. They're easy to get on. (But not easy enough for my 15 month old to take off himself. ) Great quality product. Totally worth the $. I'm pleased and will be buying the next size as needed.

review_title: Vibrant colors, runs a bit small, durable sneakers
review_body: Bought the yellow for future use and the red for current use in my toddler's summer camp school. Both have beautiful colors. I did size up on the red just to leave some room for my growing boy's feet. We like this style of these shoes and I always spare time to clean the white bottom rubber area and around the sides of the shoes every after use since he plays a lot around the sand in the playground. I use a toothbrush to scrub the dirt and upon washing the red shoes bleeds out red stains coming from the suede part everytime I wash the soap off. The red suede part however is starting lose it's vibrant red color leaving it paler than first use. The middle upper part of the shoes began to wrinkle after second use thus losing it's tautness. The velcro strap does run short. My son has narrow and long feet and when I close the velcro, sometimes it cuts short so I have to pull it again to tighten just to properly close both velcro ends. Not helpful for toddlers with wide and chubby feet I guess. It will probably unsnap. It is however durable and flexible. It has that old school classic design which I love. Other than the color bleeding out and the suede fading off while surface cleaning the sides and the short velcro closure, we still love this pair. Consider sizing up a little bit.

I purchased these shoes back in January (not from Amazon).  They have held up extremely well!  Aside from being dirty they are still intact and she wears them nearly everyday.  I've washed them and they come out looking unscathed.  They do run small, order a half to one size up.  When they arrive they will be stiff, after they are broke in (about a week) they will loosen up.  After they loosen up you will get that strap to close all the way, until then it won't close all the way (cover all the velcro).  These are tough little shoes and I am beyond impressed with their quality.

Regards, I have not realized the comment of the purchase, due to the fact that I have had problems with the company in charge of the transport to my country, in all that it comes, I him guarantee that he will think

review_title: Great ballet slipper, fits true to size
review_body: These ballet slippers are perfect. However, I don't know if they have possibly changed the sizing because I read the other reviews and followed their suggestion to order a half-size larger. And of course, they are too big now. Not terribly so, but enough that I wish I would have ordered my daughter's regular size. Oh, well. Four-year-olds grow fast, so I'm sure she'll grow into these by the time the dance recital comes around!

review_title: Bad exchange/return policy. Shoe sizing is way off.
review_body: I ordered a size up as everyone suggested, but unfortunately it was way too small. My daughter wears a size 6 in her regular shoes. So I ordered up to a 7. They were still way too small. And even though she's only tried it on once, the seller is having me pay for return shipping as well as a restocking fee (for shoes? not a big ticket item). Eventually, I went to a ballet shoe store and bought the same brand of ballet shoe, and after trying multiple sizes on, she actually got a size 9. The shoes seem okay for now, but she still hasn't broken them in. But I feel like when it comes to shoes, there should be a better exchange/return policy for this seller. I am now out return shipping cost, restocking fee and my time. Not a great experience.

I bought this ballet slipper for my 5yo daughter for her first ballet class. The shoe is very pretty, but the sizing is way off. I ordered her a size bigger, but it was still far too tight, and as her feet are pretty narrow, it was also way too wide. I returned this slipper (in the end, it cost me a ridiculous amount of money due to return shipping) and bought her ballet slippers at Payless which are her size and fit.

review_title: Go way up for a toddler, less for 4 and up.
review_body: Run small. I have an 17 month old in size 6. She can nearly wear 6 1/2. I went with 71/2 and is perfect for fit and giving a bit of growing space. At first i thought they were too small but they are great. Remember these shoes are meant to be snug and are sock-like to conform to your foot. The length of the shoe new was exactly the same as a carter size 4 crib shoe but the heel fills out the back and you can't tell by simply looking at a pic like some people post. I do feel my daughters size would never have worked and maybe a 1/2 size up may barely just fit and by the time she stretched them she would be grown up a size anyway. My 4 year old wears 11 and 12 fit perfection with only less than a 1/4 inch of growth room. This 71/2 has about a 1/4 inch of growth room. Both kids street size us comparable to stride rite maryjane style.

review_title: Quality slipper but sized ridiculously too small
review_body: Quality ballet slipper, but ludicrously small. We sized up a size from her regular shoe size as dance shoes and slippers tend to be sized small, but it was still way, way too tiny so we had to re-order ANOTHER size up.

They are Capezio.  One star.  The size chart says to order a size smaller than US shoe size.  I did.  The shoes came 2 days late.  I had to take my daughter to a dance store and pay more for the same slipper.  She wears a size 7 street shoe.  I ordered a size 6 according to the size chart.  Her size in this shoe is 8.5!!!

I did not purchase through Amazon after reading the reviews about sizing issues; we ended up going to a dance apparel store to have her fitted.  My daughter is between a 6.5 and 7 size toddler street shoe.  The size 8T medium capezio Daisy 205 was a good fit with room to grow (but not too loose).  The elastic around the outside of the shoe allows for adjustment.  She is very petite but the narrow shoe seemed like it could become too tight as her foot grows.  Hope this review helps other moms choose a size!  The quality of the shoe is just a good as I remember when I took dance for years.  I definitely think this shoe will get us through a year of ballet classes.

We ordered the Capezio Daisy for my 3-year old daughter's first ballet class and couldn't be happier!  Love the quality and construction, not the cheap sticky pleather you see on discount shoe store versions.  I'm glad I ignored the comments about sizing and ordered her street shoe size, 9.5M.  It fit just fine in width and is actually a little long in length.  My assumption is that many of the reviewers saying to size up 1-2 sizes may have their children in the wrong size street shoe to begin wtih.  Take the time to get measured professionally (not by any part time kid with a slide measure in a big-box shoe store) and you'll rarely get it wrong.  On the other hand, this shoe doesn't fit like a ballet shoe "should" - tight and fitted to the foot - but my daughter has plenty of room to grow and being in pre-ballet the form fitted shoe is probably unimportant.

Love the quality of these but will recommend, like others, to order 1-1.5 sizes up. My daughter is 2 years and 2 months old. She still wears street shoes in a size 5 (she wears a 5 in Native shoes and flip flops) but I have recently starting buying her size 6 (just bought a pair of Nike Flex Furys in a 6 for the upcoming winter months) and they should last for a year. I purchased a 6, 6.5, and 7 to compare. We will be keeping the 7 as it is comfortable and she has room to grow. They are a tad big but the elastic tie tightens to keep them from slipping off her feet. I could get her feet into the 6 but way too tight. 6.5 was ok but I wanted them slightly loose with room for growth.

My four year old chose the color.  I ordered them because she has not been happy with her Pumas, when it arrived she took them from their box, put them on and proceeded to run around the house with her brother saying how much she loved her new purple shoes.  Before the Pumas we ordered New Balance but NB doesn't come in all the little sizes. The Saucony Jazz H&L Sneaker offer her support and she runs better and walks better in them than her previous shoes. I asked her if they were comfortable…and the little girl who rather go barefoot than wear the Pumas runs to get these now every time! We are once again back to wearing shoes and sometimes even with socks.  Mommy's learning that it all depends on the right shoe to the little ones!
So cute on my baby boy

review_title: Really cool shoe.....too wide for narrow feet.
review_body: I hated to return these.  They are very sturdy and very glittery shoes which my 18mo. daughter adored.  However she has very narrow, long feet.  She has worn Pumas previously and I wanted to try a different brand so I purchased these.  They are not overly wide but are what I think are a normal toddler width.  They have good soles, secure great to little feet, and seem like they would hold up as best they could on active little feet.  The glitter does not not fall off the shoe, it's on there pretty good.

review_title: Quite small - Size UP.  Quick on & off before your toddler can wriggle & escapes...
review_body: These are adorable on, but my toddler granddaughter wears a size 4 and the size 4.5

My toddler is probably more in the 5.5 size than 6, but she can wear these just fine.  I think the structure of the toe, with the slight curl up, makes it a better fit than a flat 6, which would make her trip on the toe.  So, I think they will get a longer use, since they can be worn a little large.  That said, the velcro on the top is not the best.  My daughter (17 months) can easily pull it off, which would be good for older kids learning to put on their own shoes, but for my little one, it's kind of a drag because she's always taking them off in the car (which she does with all her shoes for whatever reason - when we are at home she wants them ON all the time).  I'm thinking about sewing a snap in there to stop this, though I am no seamstress.

review_title: ... purchased Saucony Jazz for my kids because they are easy to slip on and comes in cute colors
review_body: I have always purchased Saucony Jazz for my kids because they are easy to slip on and comes in cute colors. They are pretty durable as well. If you have a child with chubbier feet, the velcro will not close all the way...but this never bothered me or seem to bother the kids. I would say that the length of the shoe is true to size but the width may be on the narrower side.

review_title: 5-4 and these fit her great with some room to grow
review_body: My daughter is a size 3.5-4 and these fit her great with some room to grow. They are a little bulky when my daughter put them on but she eventually learned to walk with them on.

review_title: This shoe was super cute and I couldn't wait to put them on
review_body: I was purchasing these shoes in a size 7 for my not yet 2 year old. He has fat feet but he can wear regular shoes for the most part. This shoe was super cute and I couldn't wait to put them on. They were very hard to get on his foot and the Velcro only came across half way and that did not look right at all. I really really wish they had these available in wide width. I tried finding something else I liked just as much but couldn't. I settled for a pair of new balance that came in extra wide and they slide on like nothing! If your toddler does not have wide feet then I would recommend these shoes but if your little guy or gal has wide flat little feet like so many do then try something else.

We hit a half-sized plateau, where none of our size 8 shoes fit (but all size 7's were too small). These are filling the void with daily wear. They are pretty easy to get on, although the tongue can get bunched if you don't pay close attention.

Seem very comfy.  Perfect little kid shoe.  Gray/chartreuse colors look good, but about 6 months in, the suede gets a little sloppy looking.  But it doesn't matter since that's the length of time your kid will fit in these shoes anyway.  Five stars.

review_title: They are well made but run very small
review_body: These run very small. They barely fit but they do fit so she will start off with these. The shoes are lovely. They are well made and the leather is soft. I have ordered another larger pair because these are so small.

I ordered size 8 for my small 3-year old (her normal size). The shoes looked really nice, but they were way too small (at least, a size smaller then expected, and probably more). I returned the shoes. Had to pay for shipping, but saved by packaging them in a padded envelope and using 1-st class mail instead of Amazon shipping (saved about $2). I would've gotten another pair, but I'm afraid it will not fit either, since it's hard to determine what size would be appropriate, and I don't want to take chances and have to ship another pair back. If you know exactly which size fits your kid, I would recommend the shoes, but if you don't, try ordering 1-2 sizes bigger than you normally would.

I got this for my 5 year old and she only wore them for a few weeks before they fell apart.  They fit her great and the leather really molded to her foot but, I was sad that she wasn't able to wear them longer.  The price, however, was great and the color was perfect.  I would recommend maybe buying 2 pairs.  I don't think it was the production of the shoe that was the problem but the NATURE of the shoe.

review_title: Fit was same as her regular shoes - good quality - no problems!
review_body: These have been perfect for my 5  year old's ballet class. She got them in size 12 which was her shoe size (in Hannah Anderson). Finally a button popped off but they are too small for her now anyway. They are cute and high quality - she has had no problems with them. They are ballet pink (not pastel pink) which is what we expected but sometimes people are surprised they are more of a beige/pink. Overall a good value!

review_title: The shoe looks like it might be made alright (although they don't look ...
review_body: The shoe looks like it might be made alright (although they don't look like they are as great quality as payless ones that I have purchased in the past...) the issue was that they are WAY too small. My daughter wears a sz 5 in regular shoes and based on the measurements provided we order a 6.5....they came and were even smaller than her foot. We probably would have needed to get a sz 8 or 8.5.

These are cute and sweet ballet shoes, and Capezio is a stalwart in ballet wear.  I saw all the confusion on sizing, and noticed that the size chart Amazon provides is the chart used by Amazon for all footwear.  Having a few dance years under my belt, I'm familiar with the tendency toward sizing discrepancy in ballet shoes.  I looked on dancedepot.com to find Capezio's size chart:  [...]  According to that chart, style 205 (this shoe) is one of the ones that runs comparable to street size.  Best bet is still to measure your child's foot anyway.  Might I STRONGLY recommend going to a shoe store so they can do it with their magical slidey foot scale.  It's *made* for measuring feet for shoes (unlike the tape measure in your sewing kit).  Besides, if your (3-5 year old) is like mine, they'd much rather play along with the nice shoe store salesperson than Mama (eyes roll)...

These arrived USED and disgusting, nowhere in the item description does it say they are used shoes. After putting a sock over her foot, I had my daughter try them on. The fit is to be expected for this brand and size runs like street shoes. She's 4 and wears little kids size 12-13 in street shoes. The 12s fit fine but not a lot of growing room. Returning bc they are filthy!!
Great advice from previous buyers to order 1 size up.
Best ballet shoes. These are true ballet pink which is authentic ballet color not nude as others have stated. I wouldn't buy anything else and I danced for 15 years.

review_title: A little small, but still adorable!
review_body: After reading the reviews, I purchased the shoes 2 sizes up, and they just baty fit. I am hoping she breaks them in as she wears them. My daughter is 3.5 and wears a 7-8 shoe depending on the brand (usually a 7). I bought the 9N Toddler. They really are adorable, though, and if she grows out of them, I'll just buy the next size up, sonde I now have a feel for the sizes.

review_title: Cute and comfy Saucony for toddler
review_body: This is a great sneaker for my 20 month old.  We bought him a size 8.  They are a bit big now, but he will grow into them.  He wears 7 in Converse and these are about a half size larger.  Very cute and he seems to love them, so I think they are comfortable.  His first pair of velcro shoes.  The camo pattern is very cute.  I will definately buy another pair in the future when these wear out.
We purchased the correct size, but these shoes run very narrow. Quality did not seem the best with the material or sole.
Nice shoes, I got the correct size this time.  Thanks!

My five year old daughter has long, narrow feet and hasn't yet learned to tie her laces. These shoes were perfect for her. The athletic shape has more padding inside so they conform to her foot and keep it from slipping (which drives her crazy about other shoes). The Velcro fastening allows her to easily put these shoes on without help. I don't love spending thirty-five dollars on shoes that are outgrown so quickly, but aside from that I'm very happy with this product.

review_title: ... I got a size 5 1/2 and they fit perfect. So the shoe runs small
review_body: My daughter is normally a size 5 I got a size 5 1/2 and they fit perfect. So the shoe runs small. Also the purple is not as vibrant as it is in the picture. The velcro also doesn't close correctly or all the way when she's wearing them.

Love the colors but they are just too narrow for our 18-month old.  Ordered her a 5 and it fits fine length-wise but, as others have said, they are just not wide enough.  The velcro barely touches.  I would not recommend them.  Just get another cute, but wider, tennis shoe, like New Balance.
Great quality
My son loves there, they are wide enough and durable too.
Awful. Shoes were not made properly. The left shoes sole was oddly shaped and stuck out a half inch of the back and one side, whereas the right shoe looked normal. Just to odd to keep.

My son is 4 and we have gone through a pair of these about every 6 months for the last 2.5 years. We absolutely love them! They don't wear out and clean up nicely! Being a preschooler he is pretty hard on them but they always stay looking great! They are the only shoes we buy for him!

These shoes arrived quickly, and are cute shoes, soft leather and matched the description. I ordere my 3 yr olds show size and it was to small, so I had to return them. I ordered a whole size larger thinking she would have some room to grow. The replacements arrived and just fit. Not much room to grow. I don't have to return them again for a half size bigger.  I would suggest order AT LEAST a whole size larger than regular shoe size.

Since my daughter started dance over a year ago I have tried 3 different ballet shoes (4 if you count the Danskin slippers we bought until her actual ballet shoes came in) Her first shoes were the Bloch Bunnyhops, those were amazing. They have more of a bubblegum pink than the Capezios which are genuine "ballet pink" which is more of a peachy hue. These Capezio Daisy's were her 2nd real pair of ballet shoes. For the price, they're great. They fit about right on for us. They're your standard, nice, ballet shoes. The daisies on the inside of the shoe are cute for girly girls. The strap on the top is wide and I'd assume its more comfortable. They have a split sole, which helps with flexability. The only thing that annoyed me? The drawstring is so long and they come undone and I have to double tie them. So.....now that she has grown out of her Daisy's, her new shoes are the Capezio Love Flat. They don't have the drawstring ties on the front. They have some mesh on the bottom though so don't look as "clasical" as the Daisy's. My verdict is that these Capezio Daisy ballet shoes are the most standard and classic shoes that you can get for your daughter. If you like more of the classic ballerina look, go with these.

My daughter is 18 months old and we enrolled her in dance classes. She wears a size 5 in toddler shoes, I ordered a 6 so she’d have room to grow. We got them and they fit perfect! Unfortunately, we’ll have to buy another pair in a couple of months due to them running a little small. But that is completely ok! They are inexpensive and cute!
My daughter didn’t take to weating these at all. They constantly bothered her foot. Quality is good on these and the wide fit was more like regular.

review_title: Great shoe for a growing girl
review_body: I ordered a size up in order to make sure my daughter didn't outgrow them too soon. Although they are a little big, with the elastic strap and cinchable elastic bow they work perfectly. My only complaint, and this probably is the same on all ballet shoes of this sort, the elastic used for the bow isn't easy for little girls to tie tight enough so that they stay tied. It takes a little more dexterity.
Need to size up from street shoe size.

These seem like a cheaper version of the 205C ballet shoe. My daughter currently wears this shoe in a 12N. I ordered a 121/2N. These don't fit at all.They don't fit  narrow, and the color was not ballet pink at all but a tanish color. I still have the box from her pair we got at a store so I know I ordered the exact same style and brand. Not happy with these at all, they are going back! Was hoping to save money and not buy at dance store since they cost more there.
Great ballet shoe!

Very disappointed that these shoes don't look like the product pictured in the shopping description. The lining does not have daisies and I'm hoping they're not a cheap knock-off. My 4 year old granddaughter was thrilled to have "real ballet shoes" though, so I will be keeping them.
Nice product. Fits fine, no problems.

Granted, the Velcro can't be pulled as tight and wished they were a little wider, but not every baby is blessed with two by fours for feet. I only have 4 stars because width (obviously), but disappointed that the difference in price between a 6 and a 7 size was a whopping $16 for that extra 1/4 inch ($24 and $40 respectively)!!

However, they are small enough to fit my younger child's feet (she's 7 months old).

review_title: so I wanted to make sure she gets a nice wear out of them and I ordered a size ...
review_body: These shoes are really cut small. My daughter wears a size 10, so I wanted to make sure she gets a nice wear out of them and I ordered a size 10 1/2. They are really small and I had to buy another pair at a different store..

I read many reviews on these shoes and other toddler ballet shoes by Capezio and was utterly confused.  I was very close to ordering a half size or a size up but after some research I just ordered her street shoe size and they fit.  Some say that it depends on the Capezio model and that may be true.  But for the Daisy 205, my daughter is a size 9 street shoe and I bought these in a 9M and they fit.  They don't have much growing room but from what I read ballet shoes are not supposed to be too big.  I was worried though so instead of saving $4 by ordering here on Amazon and being stuck with a size that doesn't fit, I ordered elsewhere, paid a few dollars more, but had free return shipping if they didn't fit.  That would be my suggestion if you are worried about sizing.  I have a feeling it will cost more than $4 to return ship them if they don't fit. I hope this helps others.
